description:
Our entire family came in for lunch after Golden Bridge sightseeing in the morning. We also wanted to tour Union Square after, this restaurant was within walking distance. Usually I don't like Italian food, but the lunch menu was so extensive with lots of good choices. 

Started off with a glass of refreshing mimosa, they gave us a pitcher of ice water, it was much needed for rehydration! We ordered burger, warm spinach salad, chicken Marsala, chicken panini and seafood pasta. The table bread and dipping sauce was one of the best, sister and I couldn't even help but to have a few bites despite our gluten allergies. All the dishes were fantastic, everything was delicious with a lot of flavors, lunch prices and portions were fair too. 

Our server was friendly and attentive, it was just a bit slow for some reason, but the lunch experience was pleasant enough for us. A good Italian restaurant in Union Square, and it's adjacent to a boutique hotel so maybe we will stay there next time!
author: Mimi L.

description:
We were staying at the hotel next door and our phones died and we decided to walk around and just find somewhere to eat - no phone menus, no photos, just walking spontaneously and finding a spot. 

So we stumbled into this place and it SMELLED amazing. Delicious Italian aroma with the sounds of clinking glasses and upscale Italian vibes. We were in heaven! 

We ordered the bruschetta with this delicious goat cheese and arugula, a caesar salad to share and the Capellini with plum tomatoes, garlic, basil, fresh mozzarella - my friend the vegetarian was already in heaven and I just added meat to mine. We split these items and it was so tasty and filling. I loved it! 

The service was awesome. Our server had so many stories about the city and all the amazing things she has seen over the years of living in San Fran. Such an amazing experience, and really tasty Italian food.
author: Josi H.

description:
Perfectly ok bar to chill at if your friend is staying at the hotel and like 27 minutes late for your meeting. 

I was on a no-alcohol thing so I got a mango Italian soda that was probably the perfect amount of sweetness I just wasn't ready for it and I don't really drink soda so it was a lot for me. 

The happy hour menu is pretty impressive and priced well. Well, not impressive in like quality so much as hearty eats that will fill you up for a great price. Honestly, its a p great lil spot to grab a quick bite and move on. Def not a destination place, but it gets the job done.
author: Candice G.

description: Super cute and fun and very central to downtown. It's a perfect spot to meet for drinks and small bites. If you're in the area I would highly recommend it.
author: Dalia Y.

description: Here on biz. Popped into bar. Waiter meh. No bread served. House salad  good. Trio meatball average. Jameson on the rocks was the best. No good vibe. Bill $42 with tip   Move on.
author: Melissa H.

description: Having an Happy Hour diner here was much better than a normal menu dinner! Friendly staff, good food. We got the bruchetta and goat cheese, the 3 kind of meet balls and the spicy chicken with blue cheese dressing. 2 drink each. We are happy and full! We recommand! $56 plus tips!
author: Nataly P.

description:
The food is delish! And the service is attentive and outstanding! Although the bathroom is a trek thru the next door hotel's lobby.

I order Frutti de Mare, the fishes piece may look hard on the dish, but once you bite into it. They melt in your mouth~~~!!!
author: Jane C.

description:
I was just getting into SF and was staying at a hotel nearby this restaurant. I wasn't in the mood to search high and low for a restaurant, so I figured this place would do. 

The place was decently busy, especially for a Monday night. I was seated almost immediately, but was a bit disappointed by where I was sitting, as I was sat by the bar area tucked in a corner. This was probably because I was a party of one (yes, I was by my lonesome). 

I ordered myself a cocktail (treat yo self), and was given a small basket of bread. The cocktail was pretty delicious and so was the bread. The bread tasted like it was infused with rosemary and olives, which was delish! 

For my main course, I was torn between ordering a steak or a pasta. Although my initial thought was to go for a pasta, especially as I was at an Italian restaurant, I had a change of heart at the last minute and ordered a steak instead. 

Although not mind blowing, the steak was pretty good. It came with a large portion of fries, and filled me up just right. I definitely had enough food to take home to eat for a later time. 

Though maybe not my favorite Italian place, I don't mind it. It has a decent amount of options on the menu, and the food is good. The service is decent as well.
author: Margaret P.

description: A really good chill corner restaurant. Food is amazing. You gotta try the crab cake Benedict. Hands down the best I've had and I've eaten a ton of them from different places. The mimosa is very strong and well worth the price. You'll be done by 2. Only complaint. Prices are high but that's coming from me being a peasant. Food quality and prep and attention to detail as a real foodie is amazing. I'll pay the price if the effort is put in the prep and everything. Place is clean, quiet. Mostly regulars but hey, become a regular by coming to good places like this. Hands down will come back again. Our server Luna is amazing, really nice, cute smile and very good.
author: Matt D.

description:
-- TL;DR --
We had such a terrible time that I decided to write my first Yelp review. SO and I went for dinner on a weekend around 9pm. This place seems like it might be ok for happy hour drinks and finger food. I would not recommend eating here. Our meal was something that would be served on Nightmare Kitchens. We had a really terrible experience. I found out only after that this is a restaurant associated with a hotel, so take that as you will.

-- Service --
Our waiter was really rude from the beginning. I know every one has a shitty day, but his attitude was more than that. The restaurant was basically empty and service was terrible. Our waiter was usually no where to be found. It took a *really* long time to get our plates cleared and to get the check. 

-- Drinks --
SO ordered whiskey on the rocks, which tasted watered down.

-- Food --
We started with olives, which weren't great, but weren't that bad. The serving of olives was quite large though compared to other Italian restaurants so that was nice. SO had calamari and enjoyed it. We were brought what looked like focaccia and a questionable and oily sauce.

Looking now, entrees on the Yelp menu have half-size prices available, but on the restaurant menu, these were not available. Full size portions are really large. I had the Capellini which is described as "Plum tomatoes, garlic, basil, marinated fresh mozzarella." SO had the Linguini and Clams which is described as "Littleneck clams, Calabrian chili butter, garlic, tomato, white wine, parsley, crostini." 

I've had meals where the food wasn't really great, but never inedible. The Capellini was inedible. It's a really simple and classic pasta dish, so it's quite sad. It did not come with plum tomatoes. Instead it came with sun-dried tomatoes? maybe fried tomatoes? I honestly don't know what they were but they were really gross and definitely were not fresh. They came in this oil sauce which covered the pasta so I couldn't even eat the noodles. The mozzarella was covered in oil and not soft. It took effort to cut through it. SO had a similar experience with the Linguini and Clams. The linguini was overcooked, covered in oil, and under seasoned. The clams were bland but not terrible.

-- Price -- 
SO EXPENSIVE. I enjoy eating out, and this is not worth the money. Capellini alone was $22, which is expensive even for SF. Total we paid $120. Maybe it's because of the Union Square location and owned by the hotel.
author: Cristina E.

description: Ugh. Very limited wine menu, lasagna was mostly carrots! And hardly any marinara sauce.  Didn't see that coming. Spaghetti was bland and sauce like water. Good atmosphere though. Service as bad as the food. Just saying...Hard pass.
author: Bill H.

description:
Due to the fact that I was staying at the adjacent hotel to this lovely Italian restaurant, I decided to try it out for both dinner and weekend brunch. 
It didn't hurt that my hotel gave me discount coupons for the restaurant either! 

The service was excellent on both occasions as the waiters and staff were very attentive and easy to catch, as the restaurant was quaint. 
I tried chicken Marsala, minestrone soup, a gem salad with champagne vinaigrette, creams brûlée, and mimosas along with a bottle of red wine. 
Was not disappointed by anything and would definitely return here to eat again in the future. 
Tasty!
author: Karli D.

description:
We went here for dinner for a friends birthday. I had he fettuccine chicken pasta and my goodness, it was delectable. They have some lemon sauce that they use in few pasta and other chicken dishes, which just doesn't let you stop eating. 

The servers are polite and suggest good options for dinner. A good place for Italian food. Thumbs up
author: Subha J.

description: Just don't go there. Food is doesn't taste like something you should eat. It reminds me of cafeteria pasta. Way over priced. With a 30$ price tag for food like that they are clearly counting on one time visitors I can't imagine anyone going back there. We won't go back I suggest you won't go even for your first time.
author: Yishay S.

description: Great little Italian restaurant in a mediocre neighborhood.  The cannoli was tasty but not worth $25.  I'd go back again in I was in the neighborhood.
author: Clark K.

description: Went here with my Bf since we were craving pasta. We both ordered spaghetti and meatballs ($26 each) and a soft drink ($4 each). I absolutely loved the pasta, perfectly al dente and the meatballs were flavorful and juicy. He prefers his pasta on the softer side so he felt the spaggetti was average. Overall happy we stopped by and we enjoyed our meal. Was pretty empty for a saturday afternoon. Was seated right away and got our food pretty quickly. Service was good. Will come back again to try their pizza ($12). Total bill for 2 spaghetti and 2 sodas $70+tip.
author: Jennifer P.

description: This place is terrific. Went during happy hour with a couple coupons from hotel Abri... Veronika was friendly and knowledgeable... Totally helped us take advantage of our coupons and the food and drinks were awesome... We'll be back for brunch tomorrow! We hope Veronika is serving!!
author: Kendra M.

description:
We visited on new years eve. Food was great. "Chicken marcella, and sausage pizza." The service not so great. Every time we needed or asked for something the server was not around or dorgot about us. Even when we asked the busboy for lemonade they told us to ask the waiter!
We spoke to the manager about it and they took care of us. Thankyou so much we will definitely be back.
author: ARMANDO G.

description: Came here for an early dinner on Saturday and pleasantly surprised by the food. My friend and I shared the Caesar salad, margherita pizza, and pork chop entree. The salad was so simple yet delicious, the dressing was really good. The pizza was good and I do love thin crust, but I wasn't wowed. The best part of the meal was the pork chop which was so juicy!! It came with a creamy corn polenta and fig compote on top that perfectly complemented the pork. I was a little skeptical since pork chops tend to get overcooked, but I'm glad I listened to our waitress Amy who was awesome btw. I would come back here for the pork chop and Caesar salad for sure!
author: Denise H.

description: Sevice and food we're great.  Will definitely come back again.  Great atmosphere too.
author: Joe T.

description: Came in for a quick bite today because it's right across from hotel fusion, where I stayed my last night in SF, super easy why the hell not? So I waited to be seated after being walked by at least 5 times I decided to seat myself. When I sat down I was immediately approached and told, "you can't sit there can you move?" By an employee so I had to ask "will you show me where to sit?" I was pointed to a table. The best part of the dining experience was that I didn't have to ask for menus, water,or bread. After the bread and the water were placed on the table our server hovered and waited for us to decide on something to eat.. very nice guy but that was odd. The BLT is good here and so are the fries but man I'd rather not be hovered.overall a good meal.
author: Jason L.

description: Found this place after a very long road trip day and a couple of disappointing other stops. We were all tired and hangry. The staff here is fantastic. Top notch service. Even on a Saturday night, everything was very prompt. They were nice to our poor, tired munchkins. The bruschetta was absolutely amazing! The rest of the food was good as well. Nice, solid experience that checked the boxes.
author: Brandi T.

description: Lunch special 3 course meal .....I selected soup with half order of capillini. The soup was very hot and had good flavors. The capillini had unbalanced portion of tomatoes to pasta but was satisfying and good flavors. The bread with tomatoe oil was nice touch. I would try this restaurant again. The desert tasted very good
author: T Z.

description:
This place was on the corner right by our motel. I do not understand the 3 1/2 star review. We ate here twice and everything we ordered was top shelf.
We sat at the bar once and at the bar tables once so we could order off the bar menu as well as the regular menu. I highly recommend doing that.
Tried the crab cakes, Parmesan baked oysters, spaghetti and meatballs, clams and linguine and the sausage pizza. ALL of it was amazing.
We also tried both the sangria options.
author: Emily P.

description:
Food = great. Unfortunately, they decided to screw with my leftovers. 

Tabletop focaccia with sundried tomato and capers tapenade = delicious. 

Caprese salad = heirloom tomatoes, burrata (need I say more) and basil.  Tangy, sweet and refreshing. $16.00.

Spaghetti with meatballs = moist, flavorful meatballs with al dente pasta.  Hearty portion.  He enjoyed this. $26.00.

Chicken Marsala = thin pounded chicken breasts with thinly sliced mushrooms over a bed of spinach and mashed potatoes. Heavenly moat surrounded by a delicious wine sauce. Slightly sweet, tangy, and full of flavor.  So many layers.  I truly loved this dish. Hearty portion. $27.00. SEE NOTE BELOW.

Sweet corn polenta side = good.  He enjoyed it a lot more than I did.  It's a bit coarse with corn kernels throughout and definitely cheese/cream flavor. $7.00.

Gelato trio = vanilla bean, chocolate fudge brownie & butter pecan (flavors vary) were all very good. I preferred the vanilla bean and he loved the butter pecan. However, the gelato was a bit icy--I literally was eating pieces of ice with some bites.  $6.00.

Service = good. They were a bit pushy about drinks...we stuck with ice water. And my water glass was empty for a while before someone finally refilled it. 

Prices = moderate to expensive. Dinner for two came out to $92.53.  However, we had an $80-dinner-for-2 Living Social voucher to use.  So we paid $12.53 in taxes and SF mandate fees.  

Seating = plentiful.  

Note: I am LIVID that they packed the leftover chicken marsala and did NOT include the sauce. What the hell is the point of having this dish without the marsala sauce?!! The dish was $27.00 and they kept the sauce for some reason?  UNBELIEVABLE. (If the excuse is because it would leak, that does NOT fly with me. You should ask the customer who is PAYING for the food if they want everything on their PLATE that was LEFTOVER to take home.)
author: Fannie S.

description:
I don't even know if someone can call this place ITALIAN ! The hostess is a fat Mexican (sorry but no prejudice) who was too lazy /awful when she saw that I had a dog ( a service dog) daaaaaa! She was moving like on space ship slow motion mode and a very unhappy face !
Then I was seated in a a 'balcony' table looking over some other empty tables where the waiter hang around !
From the look of the menu and the prices and the place and the whole ambiance I wish I could run away ! 
I finally took a seat in a corner watching the waiters and ordered a proseco (dry) and some fried calamari.... I mean how can you go wrong with that ! 
Yes you can lol ! 
The calamari sauce (supposed to be a cocktail sauce was sour, it must have been served over and over again)
The calamari where deeped fried for sure but in oil bread pepper and whatever heavy mixture that was! 
The 'complimentary' Italian bread was cold and served with a dip that has been way too deep! 
And of course not to forget the hair in the plate and the dirty floor .... I mean if they worry about hygiene and having a dog in the restaurant they better start cleaning it first.
And last but not least when the check arrived and I made all my comments to the waiter he didn't seem to care he just whispered a : I will make sure to let the management know !!!! As if !!! 
And to say with more assurance : the tip is not included !
Oh my god if I could scream I would have done it.
Too sad I have been passing by that place and was really excited to try it as it looks lovely from the outside... but I should have stayed out of for sure.
author: Myriam N.

description: Yummmm! Fine upscale Italian cuisines! The food was good but the service by Amy made the night even better. Fun drinks with a great Italian twist on the Margarita, loved the basil influence. Great ambience and lovely presentation. Highly recommend this place and ask for Amy because she's the best server there! :)
author: Pragnesh P.

description:
When we walked in here at lunchtime, it was completely empty. And for good reason! 

The food here doesn't taste fresh or tasty by any means; the fritto misto was very off and the prosciutto panini was just a meld of strange flavors. Everything was extremely expensive for what it was. Service was not good at all - our water was stumbling over our order and kept forgetting what we had asked for.
author: Shelley K.

description:
This was the perfect spot for a quick getaway to the city or a great meal before a night out! We came to have a nice meal, overnight stay in SF on a nice little getaway w/ my wife! Everything was perfect, we had a late reservation and got there 20 min early and was quickly greeted and promptly seated. Immediately our drink order was taken then our starters which we ordered, calamari and bruscheta. Both were very, very good not the very best I've had but solid! Then we ordered the bisteca and risotto both were great. Again, not the best risotto I've had but still solid. The 10oz NY steak was perfect absolutely grilled perfect, seasoned well not overdone, and the herb butter was a great touch on top.  
Overall, this restaurant was a heat solid option,  not a bunch of trendy menu choices just great, solid Italian restaurant w/ no gimmicks just a great, solid dining experience! Not the best restaurant ever but there not trying to be, hence 4 stars & not 5, and that's why it is a great option!
author: Roman G.

description:
Our party of 8 had reservations. Host and server weren't too friendly but got the job done.

Brunch menu items unfortunately didn't please our group. It was limited vegetarians and vegans. Minestrone soup was bland and watery; warm spinach salad was sad and weren't impressive. Unchopped caesar salad had a strange taste and was left untouched by my friend. The chicken and waffle received a thumbs up! 

I wouldn't recommend this to my vegetarian and non vegetarian friends. Prices were steep for mediocre food. I felt terrible for spending $$$ here.
author: Pam P.

description: Great food and great service. Food was serve super fast too. Try appetizer seafood and main course. I will definitely come back again
author: Ray K.

description:
Super convenient location! Right across our hotel during our stay. Place looked very nice from the outside and it was actually pretty busy. Our server, Amanda, was the sweetest person ever! Very attentive and not pushy for us to order everything at once. 

After reading prior reviews, we ordered the bruschetta and their tomato basil soup. Both were okay. Bruschetta came with several slices of bread glazed with their balsamic vinegar. Tomatoes weren't freshly chopped; it was more like a chunky tomato paste with more balsamic vinegar on top. Long story short, it tasted better than it looked. By the looks of other plates around us, portions are big! We got full with those two apps so we didn't order any entrees.

To end our experience, we had their chocolate truffle cake. The 10 minute wait was well worth it. I'm not a chocolate fan but this was GOOD!! BEWARE of the bowl it comes in.. it's extremely HOT!!
author: Amanda P.

description:
I was in the mood for pasta Alfredo with clams and shrimp. I looked up the closet place that looked good and found Puccini & Pinetti so I ventured on a few blocks and saw a lively semi-upscale local restaurant that drew me in from the warm atmosphere with hard wood tables at the bar and patrons having a good time. I prefer eating at the bar and this place seemed perfect. It wasn't too crowded and I sat down right away. 

Jessica my perfectly wonderful waitress greeted me with a genuine smile and was just what I needed to smooth out the work day. I ordered a local Anchor Steam stout and proceeded to review the menu. The didn't have a pasta Alfredo so I ordered the linguini with clams. Perfect choice since it was late in the evening. The linguini and clams was great. The wine sauce and capers tasted authentic and the clams although small were very satisfying. 

I topped the meal off with the Creme Brûlée and Wow!!! The topped caramel cracked like glass and had a Smokey flavor that made every bite truly an exception end of my meal. It reminded me of a slightly burnt marshmallow from a raging camp fire. 

Great meal. 

Thanks Jessica for being the perfect waitress.
author: G S.

description: Italian restaurant with great service but poorly food, I had minestrone and mashed potatoes which it had no flavor at all.... my friend ordered arugula salad with chicken and it was better. Maybe I should just try other plate but I'll give it another try for sure. Great location and ambiance.
author: Valderrama A.

description: One star is too much for this place. Firstly, the server kept trying to upsell us a bottle of wine when we had declined multiple times. Secondly, as we were leaving, the server had the audacity to ask us for more money for his tip. I personally work in food and beverage as a server and I've never, ever asked for something like this. Completely ruined the dinner and made me want to ask for the tip we gave him back. Absolutely rude, unacceptable and uncomfortable. I can't even begin to imagine how he was able to ask us this question as we were leaving. TERRIBLE service. TERRIBLE place to eat. Unless you want to feel extremely awkward, please don't go. I've never had someone ask me for more money before. Ever. Unclassy. Sad.
author: Gauri K.

description:
I was there around 5:00 pm and I was lucky to find a seat at the bar for happy hour . It was very pack on Friday night . I have the red wines for 6 dollars . The bartender was nice and she pour a lot of wine into my glasses . 
I order the sausage pizza and garlic fries . The portion was big and I love the pizza . 
The environment is nice for happy hours
author: Isabelle L.

description: A great Italian restaurant that my family and I love coming to each time we visit the city. Simple foods yet bold flavors, and lets not forget outstanding service. Amy, this is for you! Amazing service from our waitress Amy, cracking jokes and smiles right along with my mom and I. We had a fantastic time as always but Amy gave us a fantastic wine recommendation along with delivering a delicious tiramisu for us to end the night with. If you're looking for a simple but delicious Italian place, this is the one.
author: Libby M.

description:
Puccini & Pinetti is distinctively an Italian Trattoria that meets a California Conservatory:  An authentic attitude falls in with locally grown plants and herbs. 
Brunch ( weekends only ) was very good - bold offerings and fresh flavors.

The Breakfast Pizza - combining Fennel sausage, Mozzarella ( light as requested ), house-made pesto and poached eggs - a new favorite!  The "Take It Easy" are two over-easy eggs ( perfectly fried ) on creamy polenta, sautéed pancetta and peperonata. The "Fried Egg Panini" is another savory selection, combining perfectly fried-eggs, fontina cheese, arugula, and tomato aioli - all served between house-baked focaccia bread. Bravo.

The Brunch Menu also lists "Freelance Bubbles Unlimited" ( bottomless served in a carafe ) mixed with with an impressive assortment of juices:  Sampling orange; blackberry; passion fruit; raspberry; and mango. Then there is "All About ( Bloody ) Mary.

We found this gem of a restaurant, just off Union Square but on opentable.com
author: Dino D.

description: Don't come here unless you enjoy slow service, and plain food. The servers are questionable at best
author: Jay B.

description:
Had to move down my score.  The service - for the bar- has gotten terrible. They are shortTake this review with the caveat that we have only eaten in the bar.  Our fav is the sausage bar pizza. We had a fav bartender is John but I haven't seen him for a while. We order the sausage goat hill pepper pizza.  It is the best thin ever.  Sometimes you have to ask if they can make it.  Their service is over the top attentive and pleasant.   This is my go to place for sure. 

Aug 16 update. Sad to report I have retract stars.   I think there has been staff change because service was sub par.  Found out head chef made-what was my favorite pizza-  cold in the middle and blah how does that come from head chef.  If I come back it will be for my favorite pizza makers, early in the day AND he always found the Goathill peppers.  Beware of mid day happy hour- they don't have enough staff I watch a guy wait literally 15 minutes to get a drink.  I am so sad
author: Sandy N.

description: We went to Puccini for a brunch. The brunch was really delicious but the service was not as good as the food, they were too slow, took a long time to sit when 80% of the tables were vacant... maybe we give it another chance in future
author: Babak G.

description:
We stopped in to get a last meal before leaving the city. I wish now that I had found this place sooner. One of the best spaghetti and meatballs in the city. 
   Service was excellent. Pleasant greeting, seated right away and our orders were taken without rushing.  Our waiter was very attentive and answered any questions we had and made sure we were happy. We definitely were.  
   Puccini & Pinetti are on the list of places to visit again the next I'm in SF.
author: Doug H.

description: Amazing brunch spot.  Food was delicious.  Bottomless mimosas for 20.   Great service.  Wonderful spot for brunch. Would highly recommend this restaurant
author: Lisa M.

description: I went with my boyfriend after a long day walking around the city and we decided to try this restaurant I was amazed how good the pasta tasted and I loved the service by our waiter, Elvis!
author: Odalys M.

description: uneatable food!! The meatballs was pile of really bad ground beef! On the bright side the waitress was nice.
author: Kia J.

description: I don't understand why they said close @ 10pm. When I show up there to eat dinner and then they tell me oh we're close already. And it's only 9:30. Then they said out last Seating was @ 9pm.
author: Luis A.

description: I had the butter lettuce salad and capellini. My wife had pepperadelle (sp?). My daughter had the linguini with clams. All great!
author: Bill H.

description: Highly recommend! Made reservations ahead of time but showed up an hour early. The staff was busy but very accommodating. Our server was very pleasant and friendly (Taylor, I think?), and all of her other tables seemed to love her too. The menu looked great, as did the specials. My friends and I ended up ordering from the apps section, selecting the White Pizza (heavy garlic, but not overpowering and absolutely delicious), the Mussels (cooked perfectly, sauce was great!) and the Bruschetta (looked good, tasted amazing!). For dessert we got the strawberry cheesecake, the sorbetto, and the creme brulee. Everything was spectacular! If you're looking for something decently priced, cozy with delicious food, go here! I'll be back next time I'm in the area.
author: Christopher T.

description: The food was okay. More expensive than it should be I feel. I came during lunch and the pasta I ordered, the waiter charged me a full plate when I asked for half . The waiter himself was very very friendly . My sister practically fell in love with him lol . They were able to work with me on my meal when I informed them I did not want any pork product in my meal . So four stars for that .
author: Brittany B.

description: One star for the service. I never got a chance to rate the food. The place was nowhere near to being busy, but when I walked in you'd think I was invisible. I stood just inside the front door waiting to be seated but I got ZERO acknowledgement from nearby employees, including the bar tender. Just a high sign of some sort would have been sufficient for me to wait a little longer to be seated but after three straight minutes of ZERO courtesy, I left to spend my money elsewhere. But you know what? I'm SO GLAD I didn't get to eat here because I went down the street to John's Grill and had an absolutely awesome meal. On top of that, I was immediately greeted by smiling hostess who just made my day. FIVE stars for John's!
author: Kevin F.

description: Excellent food, service, drinks, and location! I filled up on the giant meatballs and spaghetti with yummy meat & tomato sauce with fresh parmigiana, my husband loved the Frutti de Mare with its variety of seafood, and our friend loved her clams and linguini. Beautifully decorated and only a block from Market! We will be back.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Overpriced, mediocre food, bad service, limited/boring menu.

We went in on Saturday night and there was absolutely no wait - oh, well, except for the wait for the hostess to come back up to the the front from whatever she was doing for 5-10 minutes while we stood ignored by all of the servers who passed by. 

Puccini has a large wine list, but they are unwelcoming of giving tastes.  I ended up ordering a Rose that I didn't like very much, just because I felt uninvited to have a second taste after I didn't like the first wine I tasted. Our server knew absolutely nothing about the wine list - so huge list, no offers of tastes and servers with no ability to recommend wines makes for an unsuccessful wine program. 

What's more, our server (Amy B.) was so awkward.  First, she carded my girlfriend, who is over 2 years older than I, but didn't card me.  When you are serving a table with only two people and they are obviously similar in age - you don't card one person and not the other.  My friend exclaimed, "she's YOUNGER than I am!" because she was insulted for me, so the server awkwardly was like "alright, gotta see yours too that's just the way it is" or something weird like that. I almost objected to being further insulted by her pretending to scrutinize my ID, but handed it over with discomfort written all over my face.  Yes, my friend does present as really young because she is tiny and shy.  But I'm in my 20's and get carded ALL the time.  I was recently carded to enter an 18-and-over establishment. This was just rude and thoughtless: Server 101. 

Other tables were being brought table bread, but our server didn't bring it to us.  I'm not convinced that she didn't like us, rather, she was preoccupied with standing at the computer in the middle of the restaurant texting on her phone and talking to her co-workers the entire night. 

Nothing on the menu sounded good to me.  The decor, service and ambiance were unrefined, so why do they have $9 olives on their menu?  My friend ordered a pizza listed on starters section, so I followed suit because literally nothing sounded good. The only item that was slightly appealing was a mushroom risotto, but I'm glad I didn't get it because knowing what I know now, it wouldn't have been good and certainly not worth the almost-$30 price tag. 

The Margarita pizza ($15) was floppy and soggy and had literally 3 shreds of basil and barely any cheese.  The liquid from the skimpy-even-for-a-margarita-pizza amount of cheese mixed into the tomato sauce and made it a soggy flaccid round of dough with a pool of milky tomato sauce.  No dice. 

The Persimmon pizza ($18) was just OK.  It had too many sweet components (caramelized onions, balsamic and persimmons) and WAY too many persimmons on it  The pancetta was the perfect salty reprieve, but there were only about 5 tiny chunks of it on the whole pizza.  We asked for to-go boxes for the leftovers (she had half left and I had three-fourths left) so they brought us two extra-large size pizza boxes.  I asked if they had smaller to-go boxes and they said they didn't.  So we consolidated our leftovers in one box, but then we had to take turns carrying around the huge box.   

Our 2 water glasses and 2 wine glasses were empty and our food untouched for over 30 minutes so I kept turning around to look for our server and she was still standing at the computer, chatting away. I finally had to get up and approach her to ask for boxes and the check.  We put down two credit cards and she brought them back with one pen. It's just these little things that make you think: "have you EVER dined out before?" Why make us take turns using the pen?  

I left a 10% tip which I would never do, but she honestly deserved way less in my opinion. Not because of the pen, the ID debacle, the lack of wine knowledge, never coming to check on us, and my having to go fetch our check - but because of ALL of those things combined with zero redeeming factors.
author: Emma H.

description:
My favorite place to go when I'm in San Fran. Their happy hour is amazing and so are all the menu items that I've tried!

Gets busy during happy hour but well worth the wait.
author: madina a.

description: I love this place! I call it P&P. It's a cool Italian restaurant in the heart of union square in SF. I've had many lunches, dinners, happy hours here. Great food, drinks, vibe, and the staff is amazing.
author: Kim H.

description:
I came here with a group.  They accommodated us well, but also announced we could not split checks which was a little bit of a problem.

The place is comfortable, but a little loud.  It has a good wine list.

The food overall was very good.  We started with bruschetta.  It was excellent, perhaps the best I have had.  The bread was just  perfect and crunchy and the mozzarella was heavenly.

Next I had the warm spinach salad.  It was nicely prepared with a generous portion of caramelized onions.

For the main dish I had saffron risotto.  It came with shrimp there were small and without much taste, but the risotto was nice and buttery.

Service was very good, although it took awhile to get the main course.   Worth visiting.
author: Edward S.

description: Great food at this place. I went with the special which was Cavatelli pasta and also included garlic, corn, mozzarella, Roma tomatoes, fennel sausage and browned butter. One of the best pasta dishes I can recall! Wife had the Chicken Marsala which was fantastic. we split a delicious warm spinach salad. This is a very tasty place!!
author: KC L.

description: Quick and delicious (service and food)- my daughter, an authority on all things spaghetti, rates this spaghetti and meatballs as BEST!  Approachable, elegant menu and great atmosphere...
author: Jennifer D.

description: Food is okay. Service was not the best. The waitress wasn't so attentive and not so flexible on what I can substitute for my young child for her side dish..... it's a quite an experience in downtown SF.
author: Amiee D.

description: The worst restaurant i've ever been to. I ate an afogato with valrhona chocolate truffle cake and I had a terrible food poisoning and was puking all night. I strongly recommend you not to go to this place
author: Farbod J.

description: I've never been so thoroughly disgusted dinning before. My wife and I have been coming to this restaurant for years and have always had an excellent experience. My wife and I took my daughter and one of her friends here to dine for her 16th birthday. As I was sitting there eating my salad a small cockroach was climbing up the outside of my pant leg. I flicked it off onto the floor where it remained. I immediately got up and pointed it out to the manager. As I pointed it out to him he didn't seem too concerned. He at least picked it up from the floor with a napkin. No real apology and the remaining time I couldn't enjoy my food with the thought of a cockroach climbing onto or up my pant leg. Gross. This my have been the last time we'll dine here. Thanks for the concern. I only wish I hadpayed more attention to get the managers name.
author: Steve M.

description: This restaurant was great and they accommodated my dairy and gluten allergy and the seafood was delicious!  We ate off of the brunch menu and had a Bloody Mary too. It was delicious.
author: Stephanie C.

description: The one star is for the waitress, food is 0.  It's one of the very top worst meal I've ever had. We had a party of 8 at so called Sunday brunch.  If you ordered the over easy eggs brunch , it can't go too wrong.  But costs $15.  It's 2 eggs after all + a couple pieces of bread and a small patch of greens.  Everything else are overly salty.  Wow, No thanks!
author: Mei L.

description: It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good.  Disappointed they only had the brunch menu available on Saturday afternoon.   Would have been better off at a nearby food truck.
author: Jessica S.

description:
One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had in San Francisco. I trusted the Yelp reviews when making a Christmas Eve reservation for my visiting family--we were dining after a day in the city before heading home. When I called almost a month ahead of time, they suggested there'd be specials.

When we arrived, we were seated near the kitchen. No specials. And the usual menu was doubled in price. Our waiter screwed up our drink order. And then screwed up our dinner order. And whenever we needed something, we had to walk around and try to find someone to place the order. Multiple times.

The food wasn't even average. It was sub par. And it made it even worse that my niece didn't get even get her food until the rest of us had finished. $40 for a basic bowl of pasta? Without even offering parmesan? What is wrong with you people?

I'll never go here again, and I'll be sure to tell others to stay away. What an awful experience.
author: Clay H.

description: Love this place, it's just around the corner from my work. Just hanging out at the bar is great, bartender knows how to make a really good drink when you need one. Service gives great suggestions and the food is prepared just in time for another round of drinks. I use to just walk past this place and be that person who looks from the outside in just to wonder..."is this place any good?!" Well I'm glad my coworker invited me to have a drink and from there I've been here 3 times this week. You should give this place a try!
author: Randy A.

description: Dessert was good. Tiramisu and creme brule. Everything else was overpriced. Overall, not too bad linguine.
author: Kay K.

description: This place has a great location. Easy to catch while walking around Union Square. Had dinner in the lounge on a Wednesday. Server was really friendly. Not the hostess so much though. Got a few things off of the regular menu as well as the bar menu. Short ribs were so tender and the sauce was amazing. The Shrimp off of the bar menu were the best!  Cooked perfectly and the sauce was flawless. Crab cakes were ok. Meaty but weird texture with what I think were carrots inside. Will certainly go back based on this experience.
author: Andre P.

description: Pretty good Italian restaurant in San Francisco. Kind of high end atmosphere and not a huge selection on the menu. I got the chicken marsala though I usually get veal, but chicken was the only option. It wasn't bad. It's not cheap, but there aren't too many Italian places in this area unless you go to North Beach. And this neighborhood is starting to get a little sketchy.
author: Peter K.

description:
Was staying in Abri Hotel and out of convenience I decided to try out this restaurant considering they gave us $10 vouchers to dine in.

Checked Yelp and the review looks pretty good..so that sealed the deal...or I thought..

Was pretty disappointed with the food quality... it started ok with the Bruschetta, Calamari(they had a fancy name for it) and Truffle Fries but those were pretty hard to screw up for any half decent restaurant.

I ordered the Meatball Spaghetti and Marsala Chicken based on recommendation that it's the restaurants specialty. Meatball Spaghetti was blend...nothing special in flavor. Marsala Chicken was a let down...understand it's the flavor from Marsala wine but I'm an Asian and this dish really tasted like some Oyster sauce chicken..paired with the spinach it felt and tasted even more so.
author: Jive O.

description:
Quite a delicious meal. Angel our waiter was attentive but definitely not overbearing. Portions are huge! My husband and I split s salad and main course and still couldn't finish. Started with gem salad.  They split it for us and I was sure a mistake was made. Both were so large: delicious with tasty light salad dressing. The vegetarian lasagne was a giant hockey puck size - couldn't finish it. We added a meat sauce which was a nice addition. 
Sorry couldn't do dessert - 
would recommend restaurant.
author: Peggy O.

description: Friendly staff, very attentive and food was delivered quickly. I enjoyed the meal but wouldn't say it took me away.
author: Michael X.

description: They were able to get us in for reservations on the same day we called, within about an hour and half. We arrived early so we waited at the bar area. It took about 10 minutes to have someone talk to us while waiting there. Our waiter was friendly but probably checked on us once? At the end of our dinner we sat with our food in front of us without touching it for awhile until he asked if we were done. The food is good and the portions are huge! You could probably share with someone. I probably wouldn't go back if I was in SF again.
author: Ashley M.

description: Bummer just stopped by at 9:25pm to have dinner and was turned away! Didnt even get a chance although they close at 10pm
author: Daniela C.

description: I will definitely go here again due to its proximity to the hotels. I had the spaghetti and meatballs with meat sauce. Generous portion; but I thought it needed more S&P but didn't think to get it in my to-go order.   I talked to someone order a beet salad with chicken in that looked excellent.  It's good to know I can be creative and they will adjust.   I look forward to trying some other dishes to find my favorite.
author: K W.

description: I have been here twice and have gotten the Chicken Marsala both times. Honestly, I don't think I will ever order anything else because it is just that good. The food comes out quickly, and it is very fresh. The wait staff are nice but not anything to write home about. I think the only downside to this place is the price. But I understand why they have to keep their prices high. I am definitely planning to come here again soon!
author: Brittani Elyse C.

description:
I was in town for work. My friend and I decided to get away from the convention center for a quiet dinner. We happened upon this place and the menu looked ok so we decided to give it a try. 

The food was very good. We weren't that hungry so we split a salad and the spaghetti and meatballs. That was the perfect amount. I especially enjoyed the bolognese sauce on the pasta. We each had the creme brûlée (I suggested we should each get our own dessert and she agreed.) The brûlée was great and the restaurant gets bonus points for a very nice espresso. 

I also want to point out the service which was above average. Our server Angel (a dude) was good with our questions and made solid recommendations. 

I would not be opposed to coming back here the next time I'm in SF.
author: Dave C.

description:
Let's start with service ... beyond expectation. Our server (Angel) was professional and kid friendly all at the same time! 

When we entered I was skeptical at best ... pizza type joint in a hotel. My thoughts were WEONG. This place is bustling,  lively and fun! The servers are well trained to help make wise decisions without feeling like you've been up sold. 

Apps were well portioned and the arugula salad was plenty to split! One in the party had the seafood pasta, one had the chicken Marsala and others shared salads. Service was crisp, attentive and focused. 

Desert was great and the coffee was good (not cheap Sisco crap) 

Overall worth stopping at and can be a good option if you just have that need for Italian! 

Ask for Angel as he is a great server.
author: Nombre O.

description: This is probably my favorite Italian place in town. The service was great and the food was fantastic! I highly reccomend the Grilled Salmon - yum! Overall, awesome restaurant. Would eat here again.
author: Catherine B.

description: Just went in for the first time. Waited at the host stand for ten minutes. No one came. The bartender looked straight at me several times, nothing. A couple came in and waited. I told them no one had come to seat me. The boyfriend went to the bar to ask if they could be seated, and the bartender said they weren't serving lunch at that time. He looked at me SEVERAL times. Why couldn't he have just told me that? Why else would I stand at a host stand for ten minutes? I read terrible reviews of this place but decided to give it a shot since I was staying at Hotel Abri, but I'm bothered by this. Can't tell you about the food. I couldn't try it. I wouldn't, either.
author: M T.

description:
I was in invited to a dinner at this location while visiting for a night in San Francisco. Very nice location. Service was slow. But they have a great menu. 

Since I couldn't make my mind up. I went with the classic Spaghetti and Meatballs. Not bad but not good. Very dull sauce and I had to put a lot of fresh cheese on top to make it more flavorful. It's alright but would not recommend this place to a friend.
author: Dean D.

description: Happy Hour everyday 3pm to 6pm with $5 drinks  had a delicious dinner with calamari, bruschetta, pizza and carpaccio. And followed by the delicious gelato trio!! (Definitely gotta get that!!). Food came out really fast and waiters were really nice. Happy to come back!
author: Lala T.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant on Thanksgiving when everything else was closed, and how lovely it was.Few months later,we went again after making a reservation.The food,service and ambience everything was great, though it can get a little noisy. Husband and I specially loved the olive oil they give with their complimentary bread.I still think about it.We are vegetarians so ordered the bruschetta,one pasta with red sauce(i think it was spaghetti) and one pizza.We realized we ordered way too much and then took our leftover food to go which heated up well.The price point is high but can make for a lovely dinner on occasions like thanksgiving or date-night.Overall i loved going here and would visit again.You should too and not just because everything else is closed.
author: Nikita S.

description:
I stayed at the Axiom Hotel for the weekend and I am very picky when it comes to having close to a home cooked Italian meal. I asked the front desk for recommendations and off the bat, both reps said Puccini & Pinetti. 

Got there a little past 7p on a Friday and there was no wait.  Got seated right away with water at our table instantly. Waiter was very friendly and attentive.
author: Jay G.

description: Expected more authentic Italian but was disappointed with a not very flavorful meal, all 4 people at the table agreed. Service was slow and not memorable.
author: Julia M.

description:
Came here with some friends and we shared a variety of appetizers. There's a separate bar menu so make sure you ask for bar seating if you want that menu. From the dining room menu we had calamari, margherita pizza, and caprese salad. We were able to try a meatball trio from the bar menu since we saw it pass by.

Pros:
-Food for the most part was decent. So-so really for the price overall. 
-The caprese salad was our favorite. The choice of cheese and tomatoes they use are different but flavorful. 

Cons:
-Service was good, but not from our waitress. The assistant staff kept our drinks full and cleared the table as plates were emptied. We saw our waitress when we ordered and then had to wave her down for the check. Even then, she dropped it on the table and never said thanks, good night, or anything. 

Overall it's not a bad place but with all the other places to try, I won't be back.
author: Susan G.

description:
After work I met up with my friend in SF near Powell Bart to get dinner/drinks. After looking at what was nearby on yelp, we picked Puccini and Pinetti.  It had a decent amount of stars and Italian sounded lovely.  

SF has been full of customers and diners recently due to the Giants games, so we were hoping that it wasn't booked up.  Though it looked busy, we were able to get a table near the window.  This restaurant is very bright and has nice paintings on the wall.  From the pictures, it looked higher end with their plates and drinks, however it has more of a fancier-version-of-Olive-Garden feel.  Not to put that down, I still had a nice time, but don't expect something out of haute cuisine magazine (is that a real thing?).

The bread was fantastic! It was a focaccia-like bread that was super soft.  The dip was also full of flavor -- it tasted like sun dried tomatoes, olive oil, olives, garlic and other misc herbs.  I really enjoyed the bread. 

The prices are a little high, so we decided to split the Chicken Marsala dish and ordered two beers.  I had the Amber and it was pretty good.  Nothing to blow me away, but I really enjoyed that beer after a long day of work.  This place also seemed more of a cocktail and wine kind of restaurant anyways.  The waiters were very nice and the wait for the food was neither too long, nor too short.

Splitting one dish does not give you much.  I had also hit the gym after work and could have used some more grub.   The chicken was relatively thin over a decent portion of mashed potatoes and spinach with mushrooms spread on top.  The sauce was savory, but it had a strong sweet flavor.  The chicken was a little dry to be honest, but I really enjoyed the mushrooms and potatoes.  Seeing that these items weren't the star of the dish, I would give it a 2/5.  I think I enjoyed the bread more.

In the end, we had an ok time.  Though it was a bit disappointing, it was nice to grab dinner in the city.  The area is also not great.  I do understand that SF has some not so nice areas, but this restaurant was located in a more rowdy sort of neighborhood (at least from what I know of - and I've lived in DTLA and Oakland.. just sayin'). At nighttime we felt a little uneasy walking to the car.  

I probably wouldn't recommend to a friend or return. The food is bit overpriced for the quality. It wasn't terrible, but it also wasn't great.

Ambiance: 3.75/5
Food: 3/5
Service: 4/5
Overall Experience: 3/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Located in the heart of Union Square, Puccini and Pinetti is unsurprisingly located within a hotel.  Due to this location, this establishment caters to out of town guests.  

When we (local SF city dwellers) visited it was pretty apparent that the restaurant was filled with business travelers and families visiting out of town.  Now, of course there is no problem whatsoever with that, it's just a fact that should be stated to depict the "vibe".  The dining and bar area isn't decorated in artsy or trendy decor like most SF restaurants, in fact, I made a statement while sitting down that it reminding me of "a very upscale Midwestern Chili's".  

The wine menu was more than sufficient and the dining menu is sweet and succinct, offering appetizers, pastas, and main dishes.  We ordered a little gem salad, truffle fries, and chicken marsala.  Our food came out very quick-- not once did we feel as though we were waiting.  The salad was very fresh and tasted like a warm summer day.  The fries were excellent and also contained a fair amount of garlic-- I appreciated that!  Also, we were impressed with the very generous portion here.  Our main dish was good, but nothing too notable.  

Overall, Puccini & Pinetti got the job done.  If I were a guest at a nearby hotel, or in need of a family-friendly dining experience, I would certainly visit again.  However, I'm a local who is constantly seeking dining "experiences", not a dining place with road warriors chugging away at their laptop working on presentation slides and spreadsheets while spending a per diem.  Other than that, this is a great place to relax after a long business trip workday or a family excursion in the city!
author: Andrea H.

description:
As far as pizza and pasta is concerned it was good. A little pricy, but what isn't in SF.... Right?

The spare ribs were yummy, the spaghetti and meatballs were good and the service was adequate.
author: Deano G.

description: I echo the previous post.  Not sure why people gave this place an average rating.  I was traveling out of town from the chicago area and just needed a good old Italian meal. This fit the bill. I had a great minestrone and then the bucatini with its chuncky pancetta and just enormous gah red peppers was great.  Additionally the meal didn't break the bank considering how expensive dining in this area could be.  I would come again
author: Jessica H.

description: The apps were ok, wine list decent but the mains were AWFUL. The potatoes tasted like they were out of a packet as well as the rice. In the end we ended up with a $160 bill for Idaho powdered potatoes and Rice-a-Roni, Absolutely terrible!
author: Racheal C.

description:
My spouse and I showed up at 10:05 pm on Friday night and were seated right away next to the bar and given menus and water. 

15 minutes had passed with no one attending to us. No bread, no drink order.  Plenty of wait staff around, other employees having conversations near the bar....that's unacceptable. 

We have eaten here for lunch a few times with decent service. We walked out. Never again.
author: Aldrian E.

description:
First of all, to come in to an Italian restaurant and get a full gluten free menu? They had me right there. 
One of the best gluten free pizzas I have ever had.
author: Shelly S.

description:
The place is in a hotel and is a great location.  Too bad the food is overpriced and just average. 

Had crab cake benedict and linguini with clams
The crab cake was ok and the eggs were cooked well, but there wasn't any hollandaise sauce.

The linguini and clams  portion was so small it looked like an appetizer. There were only 7 clams. The sauce was tasty. This entree was not filling at all. Was still hungry and went to the SF center to get more food. 
This place is overpriced for the quantity of food. Go to the SF food court instead.
author: Bacon G.

description: Food was bland and tasteless or too salty. Waiter was lost. Way overly priced for the quality of food.  First and last time in this joint.
author: Alice D.

description: Came to this cafe bar for brunch. Had a nice selection of standard breakfast options like eggs, potatoes, and waffles, plus sandwiches. They also had a few things on the fancier side like crab cake benedict and carpaccio. A little on the pricey side for the quality and presentation of food, but the restaurant was clean and the staff friendly and accommodating. Would be open to giving it another shot for lunch or dinner where they have a larger selection of appetizers, sides, and mains.
author: Alison A.

description:
It was Thanksgiving day and not much was open. The concierge from our hotel across the street suggested this place because it was close. We gave it a shot. 

Upon walking in, we were informed they had a special holiday menu and that they were doing something "special for Thanksgiving." As we were hungry, we said that was fine. 

Rather than seeing any items having to do with Thanksgiving, i.e. turkey, stuffing, cranberries or ham (as it was Thanksgiving Day), the menu was a limited version of their regular menu, EXCEPT the prices were COMPLETELY hiked up!!! I guess that's what they meant by "special!" 

Our waiter suggested the spaghetti and meatballs ($35 on this day) and the chicken marsala (also $35). As we were hungry and had not checked Yelp, we went with our waiter's recommendations and the waiter further sold the spaghetti and meatballs by informing us that it was the "family's secret recipe since the restaurant first opened several decades ago". I thought: "Wow! How could anyone go wrong with that?!?!" 

It all went wrong. The spaghetti and meatballs were bland and tasted like hospital food. For $35 and a promise of an old secret family recipe, I expected something special. Nope! It was just a very dry spaghetti and 3 meatballs (with no tomato sauce, garlic or anything one would expect from a "secret family recipe." In hindsight, it was an absolutely absurd statement!!!

The chicken marsala was tastier than the spaghetti, but DEFINITELY not worth $35. In fact, it's not even worth $25. Maybe at $15 it would be worth a shot for what you get, which is just two very very thinly pounded chicken breasts over mash potatoes and drenched in a super sweet brown sauce. Again, nothing "special" about it except for the price that day! Haha. I almost have to laugh to keep my wits... 

My daughter got a cheese pizza from the kids menu for $8. Again, nothing special. 

The overall meal with the two dishes and my daughter's pizza, tax, tip and the "SF Mandate" tax came out to over a $100. 

In all honesty, this meal was worth $50 AT BEST. Stay away from this tourist trap and go to Little Italy for Italian food.
author: Joe M.

description: We came for dinner before the theater and to catch part of a Warriors Finals game.  We were happily seated at a Bar Table so we could see the game and our server Amy gave recommendations on happy hour wine selections--the Chardonnay was delicious.  She was also fantastic at helping select a salad and entrees.  We had the goat cheese salad with strawberries--different and fantastic.  My husband then had the seafood pasta and I ordered the pappardelle carbonara.  Both were perfectly cooked, loaded with ingredients and yummy.  We had a Chianti from their great wine list and all this time Amy made sure we always had water, refilled our wine and was friendly and enjoyable.  It was a terrific time and difficult to leave.
author: Merrilee P.

description: My group of friends and I sat in the bar area during happy hour. We were seated immediately and ordered some drinks. As a group we ordered some of the calamari, garlic fries, Margarita pizza, and ceasar salads. The garlic fries was a large portion and had a lot of fresh garlic on them, they were delicious. We were pleased with all that we ordered it was all delicious! The service was good and the staff was friendly
author: Mackenzie L.

description:
I only came here bc my friend had a random Groupon. Food is really basic and heavy but unsatisfying. I had the crab cake benedict and it was fine but not very special or warm, which I thought was strange considering we were one of two parties at the entire restaurant. Like why isn't my food warm? They do have $20 bottomless mimosas for numbing your palate in hopes of deceiving your mind of their bland flavors.

Connected to a hotel (you have to go through to go it to go the bathroom, lol fyi).
author: Juliana P.

description:
A couple of co-workers and I decided to utilize our $10 off coupon (from staying at Hotel Abri) at this place for breakfast/brunch. The restaurant was pretty empty upon arrival, so we were seated right away. Our waiter was nice, but a bit too soft-spoken and didn't carry much presence whenever he was around. However, the staff that we encountered were pretty nice in general.
The brunch menu here is very limited and the food is over priced to be extremely honest with you. For 3 people, our bill was nearly $80 (prior to them taking the $10 off because of the coupon). The portion sizes are basically a joke here, especially for the amount of money you're paying for. I ordered the $14 Belgian waffle breakfast, thinking I'd have at least two large waffles with the toppings from the description; however, I only got 1 waffle with a sliced banana, toasted walnuts, and butter on top. What a total rip off! The food was decent, but it wasn't delicious, which made me feel like I wasted my time and money at this restaurant.
The food here met the basic need to be satiated, but I would only dine here again if this place were my last resort. My advice is to read the fine print on the menu so you don't get screwed over and charged an arm & a leg like how we were.
author: Paulamertha A.

description:
Reasonable prices. Clever menu. Superb wine list. Good remodel back in 2013. Food is -- above average to good but not superb. 

But please God! When will the truffle fry fad be over? So beyond weary of truffle oil on everything. I know it's an Italian luxury but......

Carpaccio is well flavored and arugula adds a nice bite. 

Arugula salad had great flavor and texture but was overdressed. Greens felt wet - crisp greens and well-flavored dressing but just too much of it. 

Perfectly dressed salad is always my standard gauge of French and Italian fare. 

I was very tempted by the affagato. Next time. 

I'll certainly be back.
author: Tim P.

description: In town for training, hotel recommended this place.  Limited menu, and not much on it excited me, so went easy with calimari and a caesar salad.  Calimari was excellent, great flavor of both breading and the sauce.  Salad was horrible.  Huge long sticks of lettuce with hardly any dressing or parmesan.  So half the meal was good, but waste of money on salad.  Service was good and the atmosphere was relaxed.  Moderate pricing, but not too bad for this area.
author: Chris H.

description:
Really good service the food was good not bad but not great either 
I had fried calamari and shrimp appetizer which was fresh and crispy
A Cesar salad a little over dressed but fresh 
And then Cappallini pasta with meat balls the pasta was cooked well the meatballs a little dry again great service and kind wait staff overall 3.5/5
author: Todd S.

description: So we eat dinner in the city every Christmas Eve. I research quite a bit and try to pick somewhere new every year. Price is always part of the consideration (as there are two growing teenagers in our party). So I try to stay within the two $$ mark. Tonight when we showed up for our reservation we had to wait to be seated because their holiday menus weren't printed yet??? Okay?? I was surprised to see when we were seated that the menu was slimmed down from what was on open table and on their website, less of the regular offerings with the prices jacked way up ($35 for spaghetti and meatballs, really?). The food was good. The service was great, even though our waiter told us it was happy hour and then had to apologize because they weren't honoring it on Christmas Eve. I don't normally complain or review, and I  don't generally mind paying more if I'm getting more or something special, but I was disappointed with this visit..
author: Angela G.

description:
Quick pre-theater dinner.  We were sat right away and our waiter Wawan offered drinks.  We order a large mineral water to start off with.  This was served with cut limes that were cut in 1994.  This lack of detail isn't a great way to start off.

To me, an Italian restaurant that HAS bread plate on the table, should at the very least offer customers bread.

Dinner arrived and it was good, so I can't find fault with the kitchen.

Wawan took no pleasure in being ours or any customers waiter, and this showed brightly with each encounter.  

I'm guessing the kitchen is well managed, the dinning room and bar need some help.
author: EC N.

description:
This is an ok Italian restaurant . Nice vibe indoors but food nothing special . 3 1/2 stars for convenience to Union Square.
Had raw oysters, seafood pasta and children a mediocre Mac n cheese and meatball pasta. 
Service decent .
author: Alex E.

description:
This restaurant excited me when my friend invited me. I had walked by this restaurant before on the way to Kin Khao and thought it looked enticing. I like the atmosphere. The lights are really bright, maybe too bright. The menu is Italian, but also just expensive overpriced American dishes like salmon and pork chop. It reminded me of Nopa, but a more interesting Italian menu. There's also a food menu for the bar with crab cakes and pizza. We got the bruschetta. 

I got the frutti di mare and my friend got the chicken marsala for like the third time. The bruschetta was different. The tomatoes were roasted and had long slices instead of cubes. It came with 2 scoops of goat cheese and 8 toasted bread slices. We had to order more bread slices for a $1 because we had extra tomato and cheese. I liked the frutti di mare, which was a seafood dish with a light serving of pasta. The seafood included fish, clams, shrimp, and mussels. It wasn't the best dish I've ever had, but nice. My friend loves the chicken marsala there and hasn't had any other dish at this restaurant the three times he has been. The chicken marsala reminded me of Cheesecake Factory. 

I also got a lemonade, which came in a jar. There were free refills. We were at the bar waiting and my friend ordered us "bitters and soda" which didn't taste good to me because it wasn't sweet. I had never had that drink. Oh and we had a problem when we got there. A hostess told us that we would have a 5 minute wait and that she would come and find us at the bar. We went back after 5 minutes and the host/ess said that they didn't remember and that our name wasn't on the list...and also that we would have to wait 10-15 minutes. That SUCKS!

Would I come back here? I might come back here to try something else on the menu, but I am not dying to. Our total came to $90 for two including tip.
author: Denise C.

description:
Having walked by on several occasions, we finally decided to check out Puccini and Pinetti for dinner. Located in the Union Square shopping district and across from a major hotel, many of the customers appeared to be tourists/visitors to the area.

Arriving for our reservation, we were promptly seated.  Our waiter, Angel, welcomed us and mentioned the specials of the day. Our order:

House Focaccia Bread: First, the tapenade of sun dried tomatoes, olive oil and herbs was delicious. Too bad the bread was not soft and was on the stale side

Minestrone Soup with seasonal vegetables and ditalini pasta. The soup was on the thin side and it needed more seasoning. At $9, this was pricey. 

Caesar Salad:  Romaine was fresh with a tasty Caesar dressing.  Like the fresh shavings of Parmesan cheese.

Chicken Marsala:  Two thin slices of chicken breast with mushrooms on top of mashed potatoes and some spinach. The sauce was tasty that had a sweet flavor, probably from the marsala wine. Since the chicken was thin, thought it might be dry, but it was not. For $26, this was on the expensive side. 

Saffron Risotto with rock shrimp, frisee with cherry tomatoes and agrumato topped with freshly grated Parmesan.  Had a taste of the risotto and it was tasty. 

Profiteroles and Pistachio Gelato topped with dark chocolate fudge and whipped cream and nuts. This was good but would have been better if the profiteroles were not on the stale side. 

Overall, it might be good restaurant for the Union Square clientele, but there are better options outside this area. Service from Angel and the other servers were good.
author: Al L.

description: We made a reservation here for our party of five, to have dinner before walking to the Orpheum Theatre to see Hamilton. Angel was our server, and he was excellent - we had several questions, about dishes and the best wine pairing, and his knowledgeable suggestions were on point! The service and food was wonderful. We had a lovely dinner. Thank you!
author: Lisa B.

description: Excellent time. Great food. Great wine selection. And Angel was such a great host and so helpful and friendly. Will be back for sure. The chicken Marsala was AWESOME!
author: Priya V.

description:
On a whim, my boyfriend said "lets go get some Italian."  I was shocked because he's told me multiple times that he doesn't like the cuisine, but it turns out that he wanted to give it another shot because we're currently marathoning through the Sopranos (true story.)  

I'm glad we came across this place!  My choosy-at-times boyfriend (see comment above) loved it as well.  For a drink, the acai cocktail was to die for; for an appetizer, we chose the charcuterie board which was pretty good, and for mains, I got the spaghetti and meatballs and he got the cannelloni.  I can safely say that was the best spaghetti and meat balls I've ever had, and now my boyfriend can't believe he never liked Italian food before.
author: Grace P.

description:
One mark off for slightly slow service and lack of attentiveness combined with high prices for the type of restaurant.

However, the food was fantastic. Really enjoyed the two meals I had here.

They have a whole gluten free menu.

I had the meat sauce on pasta with meatballs (mild fennel sausage).

The following day, chicken Madeira with mashed potatoes.

Also tried the cinnamon ice cream.

Would like to go back for the chocolate cake :-)
author: Rachel B.

description: Place is solid on vibe, staff, location, bar, and food.  Can recommend to anyone staying in the immediate area.  Enjoyed the margherita pizza and the pumpkin cheesecake (which was just the best damn stuff ever).
author: Draft M.

description: A fine place for a quick $5 happy hour wine. Gives you that generic, family-friendly Midwestern chain restaurant vibe, smack dab in the middle of the tourist district.
author: Andrew K.

description: Food ok. Parking and downtown traffic terrible. Rude front desk. One of the loudest restaurants ever. Major meh.
author: Alisa G.

description:
Usually a reliable staple of Union Square my most recent visit was a miss. The bartender sucked (slow, unpleasant, and sting--plus there was only four people at the bar!) and the food wasn't great (see the picture of my salad). 
It's a tourists spot so expectations are a little lower but, no referrals/refreshes offered is subpar.
author: Jeff S.

description: Puccini & Pinetti:.we stopped here for a late night munchie attack. We sat at the bar, service was excellent. Bartender made an excellent Cosmopolitan, we ordered a Margherita Pizza. It came out hot, fresh and very good. Even though we just really had one item, I would come back and try it out for dinner.
author: Melody K.

description: This place was right across from our hotel. The food was good, the price was high everything is separate so if you want a salad with your dinner you could spend upward of 45$ a person. If there are no options come here it's satisfying! Nothing to rave about
author: Larae A.

description:
This place is good for groups during a weekday lunch. I came here with about 15 people and even though we had a reservation, there was plenty of seating. 

We started with some apps and I didn't want to fill up on them because I was excited about my entree. I did have some of the bruschetta and even though I'm not a huge tomato fan, the sauce to dip it in was really good and the bread was nice and crunchy.

I got the Frutte de Mare for my entree and half an order was perfect. It came with a decent amount of seafood (fish, shrimp, clam, calamari, etc.) and it was pretty fresh. The soup broth was pretty good as well and it was a good filling meal.

Overall, the food is pretty good here and the service is good.
author: Sophia Y.

description: We came to the City to see "Into the Woods" with about an hour to get something to eat and did not know where to go.  We walked for a bit and found Puccini and Pinetti, and boy were we lucky. We told the hostess that we had a show to go to in an hour and would we be able to fit a meal in by then. She said it should not a problem, informed our server Paco.  Paco not only provided us excellent guidance in the wine selection and dining recommendations, but got our food order in so fast that we had time for a dessert!!!  Well done guys - we had a great time and a delicious meal.  PS - be sure to try the Fruitti di Mare. You will not be disappointed and ask for Paco. Cheers!!!
author: Robert K.

description: Not great. I suspect the Yelp reviewers who gave five stars are infrequent users of cutlery. The food is passable in a shopping mall food court kind of way. Complimentary focaccia was stale and factory-made and the spaghetti and meatballs, while offering plenty of both, featured overcooked meatballs and a sauce which was reduced too much and is memorable only for the acidic/metallic note that tomato paste brings. The spaghetti was cooked correctly, though, which means perhaps the restaurant isn't a total lost cause. The dish could have been recovered into something quite good by even an amateur chef who tasted their work before serving.
author: Pete C.

description:
I came in on a Wednesday afternoon for some lunch and right as I walked in the man at the host station said "There she is!" in the loudest most friendly way ever! I'm not used to eating in restaurants by myself, so I was pleasantly surprised when he turned out to be the bartender and that there were others eating alone at the bar like me. I have to say, he made the bar a really friendly place and got all the tourists to chat with each other. Great hospitality!!!
I got a panini sandwich and it was just ok. A little greasy and not much flavor. Most of the panini had bell peppers in them, of which I am allergic, so I had limited options. 
I'd like to visit again! If for nothing else then for the beautiful ambience and awesome hospitality!
author: Monica C.

description: Had a quick dinner of bruchittia and roasted Brussels sprouts. Both were quite yummy though the sprouts were a bit under seasoned. Nice atmosphere and good service.  Over all a present experience.
author: Ebbonie K.

description: It was so nice to eat at a place where the server was actually polite and cordial. She also gave some nice recommendations. The margherita pizza has some nice mozzarella slices if you're a cheese fan. The highlight, however, was the pork chop; topped with a nice fig sauce, it is so flavorful and moist. I believe it's also a popular happy hour spot. Needless to say, I'll be going back
author: Ashwin B.

description:
My sister and I went yesterday (Sunday) around 5:30 pm. It was busy we chose to sit in bar and found out it was happy hour. So we ordered cocktails .. Vodka 
Not sure what to order we asked waitress  to recommend appetizers for us. We each had caeser salad and margerita pizza. It was plenty for us. Then baileys  coffee and a draft beer. 
Wow. $54 for all that.  Great deals.  Good service. Very prompt and always checked in on us. We left hour later it was packed. We will be back food was delicious.
author: Kelly H.

description:
This isn't an update but rather a second review on an entirely different experience. 

Went here for dinner and we were seated in the back back of the restaurant at a small short and round table that looked completely out of place. Like the table you offer on a packed night saying, it's not our best table but you're welcome to take it if you want. 

I had to go back and ask the host to give us a different table and very nonchalantly he says well you can take the other one that was open. 

Then our waiter comes, he helped us with our order and then became very uninterested in our table. 

Basically the food was the only good thing about the whole night. No service, no attendance and if it was up to me there would have been no tip. But Bear paid so...
author: Melody K.

description:
What's the best way to describe my dinner experiences at Puccini & Pinetti?

Their Italian food tastes just like Olive Garden's Italian food but priced at San Francisco Union Square prices.

been here twice, not impressed.
author: Philip M.

description:
My friend and I stayed in the attached hotel and decided to get a late night snack.

The hostess was really nice. Our server "A McCoy", on the other hand, didn't seem to have time for us. When we ordered only waters and a pizza to split, she rolled her eyes. I think she summed us up, two young girls, with little food, and figured we weren't going to tip well. We heard her tell the couple behind us that, "service is not included" in the bill. I was dumbfounded that she had the nerve to say this! She walked by us multiple times, didn't even finish talking to us before walking away, and didn't actually serve us any food! Our server was right: service wasn't included, in the bill or by her.

Two other servers checked in on us and were both awesome.

Bread and oil were given to us, which was a nice touch. We had the white pizza, which was good and came quickly. It was a bit bland though, and could have used some more sauce and cheese.
author: Meg P.

description: Ordered some wine and the meatball sampler! Yum yum, also had a bunch of oysters that my boyfriend and I enjoyed very much. The truffle fries were so yummy I almost ate them all, but then I got full.
author: Stephanie P.

description: This is the worst restaurant that I've ever been to. I got food poisoning after 5 hours. Awful quality and overpriced.
author: Sadaf P.

description: Food is not great for the price. Pizza is average. Risotto is not cooked properly. We end up left half the food.
author: Chin L.

description: Outstanding I got something that wasn't even on the menu. Being Italian you learn what kinds of stuff you can request an ask for that are not on the menu that are on what we could call a secret menu this is something that they will make but they are not going to advertise it. I will tell you I ordered chicken fettuccine Alfredo with tomatoes. It was out of this world and their bread while you wait is absolutely amazing I will come here again when I visit San Francisco. I also requested a glass of wine they actually have Moscato which was very exciting places usually do not have Moscato on the menu. They usually have white Ziphindal or some other type of white wine the Moscato was absolutely delicious perfectly sweet and went perfect with my meal.
