The waiter was also great except for he never returned to see how we were doing it was just two of us.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Once again, 5 star review. Food is amazing. Service is amazing. It's just all around amazing.

Caesar salad-Perfect, simple but delightful. The dressing has the perfect amount of anchovies pureed in it so you get the flavor but nothing overpowering.

Bruschetta-The goat cheese makes this dish. Best bruschetta I've ever eaten, and I've worked and eaten at multiple Italian restaurants.

Gamberi-The sauce is out of this world, mixed with the tomatos and shrimp. TO DIE FOR. We even asked for some extra crostinis to dip into the sauce because it was that good.

Main course the bf and I shared the Proscuitto Panini with truffle fries. We were kind of surprised to see the fries come just looking like regular fries without the typical herbs and cheese. Well lets just saw it worked,perfect flavor, so simple but out of this world.

Will took care of us in the lounge and was super friendly. Out of all the restaurants we dined at while in San Fran he definitely gave the most warm welcoming and fun experience. You can always tell when people enjoy their job, I recently got into management after hostess, server, and bartender for 6 years and lets just say if I had him as one of my employees, I would be very happy. Thanks for the great service Will!

Definitely a must go to restaurant. Will be back every time for our yearly trip.
author: Andrea S.

description: What a fantastic combo of authentic Italian comfort food and great (and new to me) wines.  Nice combo-environment of the inside sports bar, and the outside traditional semi-casual dining experience.  Easy, very well done and delicious for all.  I might suggest a bit of original local art ;)
author: Caitlin E.

description:
To be honest, I did not have high expectations. A large Italian restaurant, near Union Square, could easily be a tourist trap. However; we did not have all that many options when we finally decided there to go and how wrong can one go with Italian?

It started out quite ok, we had a drink at the bar, whlist waiting for our table. A vibrant setting is great for a Saturday night, although being just three people, we were struggling to hear each other properly.

At the table we all started having a carpaccio, which we all found tasty and delicious. The waiter was nice and helped choosing a bottle of wine to go with our orders. The service was efficient. However; we discussed around the table how we just never get used to the fact that the waiters start clearing the table plate by plate before everyone is done with their dishes. 

For main I had the frutti di mare pasta. It looked good and based on the ingredients, it should have a lot of flavours. It didn't. And concidering the prices, it was straight out disappointing in its overcookedness. A way to big chocolate cake for the dessert did not lift the impression. 

Not recommended if your after food experiences.
author: Hildegunn N.

description:
Great Union Square location and food was fine, although just a bit extra effort with higher quality ingredients would make it great.  I had Caesar Salad and Margarita Pizza.  The salad and dressing were excellent but the croutons seemed from a box.  The Pizza crust tasted great, although could have been a bit lighter in texture, the tomato sauce was weak or from a can, and the cheese was a bit rubbery.
Like I said, a bit more attention to ingredients and this restaurant would be great.
author: David B.

description:
My first happy hour outing with coworkers ever and it was beyond more than 1 happy hour!  We were here for about 3 plus hours and with the whole ambiance, spirited waitress we had and delicious food served, I couldn't have asked for a better place to spend the evening with my lovely coworkers!

Their food and drinks for happy hour was surprisingly delicious!

Champagne and wine was smooth and refreshing after a long day's work!

I think we ordered the majority of the entrees on the happy hour menu list to try!

Dishes I recommend for happy hour - Crab Cakes, Cured Meat, Spicy Boneless Buffalo Chicken, Bruschetta, Nachos and Mussels with Fries!  All of these petite entrees were so yummy!  

Unique presentation and atypical Bruschetta picture - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/puccini-and-pinetti-san-francisco?select=3iinBzi6G-YwsZyQl0Ru5Q#H4AoL5zpnKpEmebyFtoKiA

Dishes I recommend not ordering for happy hour - Fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Meatballs and Trio of (different meat) Meatballs!  These entrees lacked umph, tasty flavor and the raw oyster had a bit of a crunch, which I disliked when I heard it in my mouth.  They were simply average, but I do see room for improvement! 

The Trio of Meatballs do look appetizing to eat - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/puccini-and-pinetti-san-francisco?select=3iinBzi6G-YwsZyQl0Ru5Q#e78yH1zz9AecH9yQ69WoHg

You MUST GET their warmly baked, Chocolate Truffle Cake topped with Vanilla Ice Cream!  It was so rich and fudge-licious!  We also had a birthday girl in the house so the waitress did a very entertaining dance before presenting the Truffle Cake! 

Puccini and Pinetti, thank you for the wonderful 3 "happy hours" of my life!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Food is exquisite in a refined, bustling restaurant that is in the heart of San Francisco. Portions are good, price is very reasonable for the taste, quality and setting.

My wife and I always choose to go here on date nights.

It can get a bit noisy at times but we've never had a problem if we sit away from the bar.
author: Clifton H.

description:
Great service good food and a nice atmosphere .
Service was very attentive and food arrived quickly. We did sit in the bar area where happy hour specials were ongoing. 
Salad and pizza were good and well prepared.
Would recommend if you just want a quick drink or a nice meal. Seems to be good all around at least tonight service was very on point.
author: David S.

description:
I like the service. 
The antipasto and bread was free to start. 
Order the bruschetta...even 1/2 order was very large. 
Carpaccio was ok.
author: Linh L.

description: Absolutely awful experience. I walk in at 10:02pm, told restaurant had last seating. I ask if I can order to go after showing hostess that yelp app shows restaurant closes in 58 minutes at 11pm. Told sorry, it was a long day and they're not taking any more orders, even though they advertise being open until 11pm and several tables are seated. Terrible customer service. I recommend taking business elsewhere.
author: Greg W.

description:
Wife and I went there for dinner on a weekday and it was packed.  Made reservations on Open Table so we got seated right away.  She got the risotto and I the clams and linguine with some grilled shrimp.  Food was tasty, server was prompt but seemed a little rushed.  Good thing for him we knew what we wanted and didn't ask too many questions about the menu. 

We had a good table where we could see the open kitchen.  The place was busy and it sounded like it...very noisy. 

It's a little pricey for what you get...but you should expect that from a place close to Union Square.
author: Kahai D.

description:
If you are in the neighborhood and in the mood for some great, chicken Marsala, seafood pasta or spaghetti and meatballs then this is for you( they are the signature dishes of Puccini and Pinetti).  Another highlight is a full gluten free menu; may not seem like a big deal to most but to those who have an allergy this is HUGE!

My party of four stopped in on a very busy evening but the staff seemed to handle it with grace.  We had attentive service and the food was well executed.  

On this specific evening we tasted two salads, the warm greens salad as well as the seasonal green salad with sliced apples, ricotta and shaved radishes.  For a main course we had the short rib, which was tender and straight comfort food.  The short rib was paired with creamy mashed potatoes and carrots; Delish! 

For dessert my friends and I shared a perfect portion of traditional creme brulee which had a creamy texture and prefectly carmelized outer coating.
author: Karen L.

description: Lovely little respite away from the hoards of tourists on Boxing Day (what were we thinking).  Got a seat right away when other places were booked (2pm lunch) Food is a little overpriced, but generous portions. Loved my persimmon pizza - however the onions should have been cut thinner (julienne?) and carmelized a bit more. I took them off after the first slice. Buccatini was good  - nice sauce with a kick.  Minestrone soup was really enjoyed by my Mum: she ate the whole bowl and that is a rarity!  Very nice staff and waiter.
author: Kai F.

description:
I was staying at the Hotel Abri and had a $10 off coupon.  And I was hungry, so I headed in at 9:00 or so on a Thursday night.  It was still very busy.  I sat at the bar.

Service was very attentive from the nice bartenders.  I got a glass of Malbec for $10 (so, basically, my wine was free) and then I ordered the beef carpaccio from the appetizer menu for $14 and the meatballs from the bar menu for maybe $12 or so.  I thought both the carpaccio and the meatballs were tasty and well portioned.  The meatballs, in particular, were very good - three piping hot medium-sized meatballs with a little bit of tomato sauce and some melted cheese.  Perfect size for a small dinner.

My final bill after tip and discount was around $33, which was probably pricey for what I got (one glass of wine, one appetizer and one bar menu item) but ... This IS San Francisco, you know.  It ain't cheap.
author: Sandra A.

description:
Almost didn't go here because of bad Yelp reviews. Glad we decided to come and try anyway. We came for Saturday lunch, not busy at all. Got seated and serviced right away.

Our server Wawan was great. Asked to try 2 different Zinfandel to choose from and he happily obliged. Calamari tasted great. I ordered Spaghetti with Bolognese as I am such a big fan of that sauce from my first time tasting it in Italy. It didn't fail. I ordered the half order and still too much. It was as how I expected it with lots of flavor. My wife got the linguine with clams. She loved it and finished the entire half order! 

Lesson learned by me and to you, my fellow Yelpers, give a place a try despite of bad reviews. You can't please everyone and SF is such a competitive place for any type of business but more so for restaurants. 

Rate the service but most importantly rate the food! Don't expect to be pampered just because you're paying a lot of money. Everything is relevant. When you come to SF, expect everything to be expensive as SF itself is imposing so much fees from businesses. The servers that work are all just doing their jobs and not necessarily pocketing what you pay off the menu. Be kind! Provide constructive feedback and hope for improvements for the next Yelper!
author: Leleh M.

description:
SF, you're killing me here.  I thought you were the land of good food?  =/

I was on crutches, and the bf and I wanted to make this our last stop for SF food before we had to get on our plane.  It was almost lunch time on a Thursday, but the hostess was able to seat us with no problem.  Once we sat down, our waitress came by, introduced herself.  While we were still deciding, glasses of water and a basket of bread with butter appeared.  Quietly munched on our bread, while waiting for the waitress to come back.  Bf ordered the chicken marsala, while I had the lunch-sized linguine and clams.

Waited probably around 15 minutes for the food to arrive, which wasn't a problem.  It was a little weird that tables that were seated way after us was able to get their food first, but I wasn't sure what they got.  Bf's chicken marsala was around $25 and was as big as my lunch-size portion of linguine and clams, which was not very big.  We were actually still hungry after the meal.  =/  

Taste-wise, the bread was soft, and not bad.  The capers in the marinara sauce for the bread was a bit of a red flag for me.  I mean, I think capers are great and all, but it feels that the restaurant is cheating or being lazy by putting that in their marinara sauce.  Are they trying to hide flavors in the sauce?  For my linguine and clams, it also came with capers, which wasn't bad, but I felt that other spices probably would've made it so much better.  For the bf's chicken marsala, it was edible, but I felt that he could make a better meal.

When considering the high prices of the meal, the bf and I probably won't come back.  I understand that it's downtown SF and the place needs to compete with other restaurants in the area, but it wasn't that great or worth it.  Will try and just do Little Italy for Italian food next time.

Service wasn't bad, but there weren't too many people when we sat down.  Waitress didn't seem very happy to service us, though....
author: Grace C.

description: I got so sick from this place. I came to visit San Fran last weekend with some family and we decided on this place. It looked nice and had good reviews so we thought it would be good. Well no it was way to expensive and the food was horrible, I was violently ill all night after eating there and my last night was ruined in San Fran and I had paid almost 200$ for that! Never again
author: Allie S.

description:
Great spot to eat. Came in on vacation and made a reservation from
Our hotel. 15 minutes later we had an awesome birthday meal. Great customer service, ( Angel E) took care of us and was fast courteous. 

Thank you. 

Ivan G
author: Navi A.

description:
"Are you done" asks the waiter looking at my plate with half of my Caesar salad still there.  "No...I'm taking a break from doing the kitchens job of cutting my lettuce".  $11 for a Caesar salad with nothing on it and it's not even cut up for you?  Eh...no thanks.  
They seem to have a decent gluten free menu...but not for lunch. I'm not paying $32 for gf pasta at noon, bro. 
Overall I'm glad I stopped in and my overpriced-not-chopped-up Caesar salad was good...but you can find a cheaper delicious meal within a few hundred feet.
author: Katie B.

description: Came for dinner.  Awesome service!  Great atmosphere!  Love their baked oysters!! You order by how many you want!  We ordered the calamari,  kinda reminded me of olive garden except they add shrimp..I actually enjoy olive garden's calamari so no complaints there.  We ordered the baked oysters, steak with fries, short ribs, and calamari. I also got their drink that's spicy (forgot  the name), it has cucumber, cayenne pepper?, and basil...it was OK, not strong at all,but refreshing. Don't think I'll order it again though. Wouldn't mind coming back again to try something else..
author: DEBB D.

description: Tired, jet lagged and ready for good eats. A quite Sunday night prior to RSA and we ordered what perhaps could have been the blandest possible choice, spaghetti and meatballs. Paired with a excellent red, and preceded by mussels it made for an amazing meal.
author: Johnny H.

description: We chose Puccini & Pinetti because of its location across from our hotel. Nice ambiance and good food. Family friendly well priced for the city, very friendly staff, thanks Angel for the recommendations.
author: Pamela G.

description:
Starting the first review of 2015 with Puccini & Pinetti! I think over the course of 4 years or so, I've frequented this place enough to be able to give a solid review. Happy hour is one of my favorite activities and let's just say Puccini & Pinetti does not disappoint! I love that their happy hours are 7 days a week, which includes $3 beer and champagne. Ummmm, yes please! Their crab cakes are also amazing and something I highly recommend. I also love how they are located near major stores so it's the perfect spot for a shopping break or just a place to meet/catch up with friends. 

Their bruschetta is good, and comes with spreadable goat cheese and tomato paste (instead of the usual diced tomatoes, etc.) and their calamari makes a great snack as well. You will receive a generous amount of wine, beer, or any other beverage of your likings which is something I really appreciate. I've been here on Tuesdays, Sundays, Thursdays, pretty much at different times and seasons and this place is always packed. I can't say I have anything negative to say about this place, but one thing they could work on might be improving their health score rating-- I think right now it's in the 80-something range, which I was told was considered uncommon for restaurants. But I've never witnessed anything occurring inside the bar/restaurant that made me concerned for sanitary issues. Anyway, this place is great and I will definitely continue my happiest of hours here!
author: Denise L.

description:
At a first glance on the menu, plates look authentic Italian. Average Food in American style. Go if you don't have plans or reservations. 
Although crowded, they managed the good service.
author: Altaf K.

description:
A little pricey, but the food is well worth it.

Ordered some salad, a bottle of wine, and spaghetti with meatballs and I had the chicken marsala.  The salad was excellent- very fresh and tasty. The spaghetti/meatballs was ok.

I really enjoyed the chicken marsala. The sauce they use is tasty and fresh. Makes the whole meal enjoyable. 

Location is on a corner. Wait wasn't too long but we came in a bit late. 

Would recommend this San Francisco Italian spot for a nice dinner- not too fancy, but not too dressed down.
author: Michael T.

description:
This place is always jumping. I've eaten here at least a dozen times in half as many years. Make a reservation when taking any more than 2 people. 

Happy Hour/Friday/Saturday nights(due to proximity to theatres/Union Square) are humming with noise so don't expect the romantic table for two. 

The appetizers are always almost spot on. We try to order their seasonal selections. Their entrees have not disappointed and their cocktails are almost perfect. 

We have brought the entourage (many shortish people who follow us around) and they were equally happy with their selections. 

We have used it as date night for the Mr and myself when we are seeking out the hum of the city noise not found in our lovely suburb across the bridge.
author: Sydney P.

description:
Lol at paying a crapload of money for food that was not that good, super generic, basic-ass Italian food. Did I really just fork over that much for a salad with literally 3 or 4 thin little slices of beet in it? Wow. Beet salad? More like arugula with a slice of beet. Misleading.

Things not to get because it isn't worth the exorbitant price: the linguini with clams, and the beet salad.

Delicious: Calmari and the fresh oysters. The pasta nachos were interesting, too. Other than that, I probably won't be back.

Cool that they have gluten free cider options, though! But overall, way too expensive for no special reason. Going somewhere else next time.
author: Sherilynn M.

description:
Nice lunch very quiet good service at the bar .
Made reservations for same evening , terrible service , asked for the manager that couldn't manage just shuffled off . 
Food very mediocre. So we left and found the north beach restaurant . Wow simply great service and the food  and wine were amazing .
The difference was stunning .
Don't waste your time on Puccini !
author: Robert I.

description:
Overrated. Overhyped. Overpriced. 

Service? Good!
Seating us earlier than our reservation? Excellent!

The pasta had all the right flavors, but for almost $20 for a portion, it was definitely overpriced. I had the penne arrabbiata, he had the spaghetti and meatballs. We also started with the fritto misto, and some minnestrone.

The foccacia that they give you is really good, along with that tomato stuff (don't know how else to describe it).

Fritto misto- calamari and rock shrimp. Good, nothing special. Pretty standard.

Minnestrone? Disappointing. Hubby said Olive Garden's soup tastes better, so there ya go. It was $7 for a bowl of stuff that looked like it was out of a can. The broth was really thin and watery.

Penne- I liked it, but there was a lot of black pepper in it that I didn't care for. The pasta tasted fine, but it was nothing special.

Spaghetti- The meatballs were really good, but like I said, for spaghetti, $20 is a bit much.

Hubby would have enjoyed the  meal more if the prices were in the $10-15 range, as that seemed more appropriate. Fail! This was my birthday dinner too :(
author: Lisa M.

description: I'm only giving 2 stars because the average taste of the food. I came here to eat since it's close to Union Square, I wish I didn't. I enter the restaurant and I see the manager in a conversation with someone and he sees me waiting to get seated but instead of stopping his conversation and seating me, he made me wait for 10-15 min while watching me anxiously wait. Finally I was seated. The prices were fairly high, $14-$20 per dish. There was no appetizer and there were more drinks than food on the menu. My waiter came and took my order but seemed to be more focused on the tv. The plate had scratches all on it. The food was mediocre, not worth the money at all. Very main stream. I ordered a clam linguini which was watered down and super salty. Very disappointed. Go to the grills or something, this restaurant is not worth it, it's a rip off.
author: Zara V.

description: Excellent presentation & good food. The area around union sq. is a bit suspect as far as good eating. This place seemed like one of the best. Prices are a little high. Just a bit!
author: Juan G.

description:
A classy Italian restaurant that has a plethora of happy hour patrons, menu options, and dare I say extremely reasonable in price! With the standard suits getting off work, this place maintains its posh atmosphere.

Try the white wine, oysters, calamari, and pizza!
author: Regina D.

description:
This is the meet up spot for my colleagues and I after work. We even have our usual table and particular chairs we like to sit in. It's so close to work that I can see who's coming in and out of our employee entrance from where I normally sit. I love their baked oysters, calamari and parmesan fries! I honestly haven't ordered anything that's not good. 

They have a great happy hour menu but for some reason, we never order anything from it and end up paying a lot of money a couple of hours later. Reason why we do, is because every time a coworker walks pass the restaurant, we invite them in to the point that we take up at least two or three tables. It's always a good time here. Our service is never rushed and the staff are attentive. 

Our afternoon always starts with, we'll have two drinks, that's it! Hours later, two bottles and a couple of cocktails! Location is so convenient, just a few steps away from the bart station. It's also a good spot to have lunch by yourself, a date or even the whole family with the kiddos!
author: Candice J.

description: Staying at the Parc 55 is interesting because you are basically right next to some sketchy stuff.   I was looking for a spot to watch the game and grab some vino and right across the street was :uccini.  Great by the glass list (over 20 reds and lots of Italians) and a decent menu, I slammed the meatballs sampler which was pretty good.  Live music kicked in around 8, cool jazz quartet which didn't suck at all.  Didn't have a full meal but for the experience this joint gets 4 shiny stars.
author: Jay C.

description: I have had lunch at this restaurant for the past 15 years and over that time have found the food to be food and some cases very good. In particular, the stake wrap is excellent and not to be missed. The bread here is excellent too. Other standouts are the burger and fries.
author: Tony R.

description: Food was salty, not a good menu, was not even worth it with the discount I got from the Hotel. There are plenty of good restaurants near this spot. Service was slow and they were not busy.
author: M D.

description:
Decided to try this place while in San Francisco for Apple's Worldwide Developer Conference '14.  Good rating, gluten-free, "good for kids," and a block from our hotel. 

Upon arriving at 6:45 on a Wednesday, we were given a table for 2 adults and 2 kids, but told that our server might be running a bit behind.  Our host gave us one coloring sheet and said he'd bring another once it was done printing.  Keep in mind, we walked right in and sat down, so while it was busy, it was not packed.  Not once did I see people waiting in the doorway for a table.

Some 15 minutes later, we were finally able to get some attention from our waitress, to ask about the other coloring sheet and ask for a gluten-free menu.  5 more minutes to get these two and we were then asked for drink orders.  My wife couldn't decide which GF option to try first, and said we might have to come back to try more.  I got an e-mail at 7:12 and that was when the waitress came back to take our food order.  Grilled salmon, a gluten-free burger, kid's grilled cheese, kid's cheese pizza.  

I took a sip of my son's lemonade, it tasted funny.  There was something fizzy mixed in, and it had a bit of an alcoholic taste to me.  My wife took a sip and and agreed that it tasted a bit like champagne.  Now, to be honest, I'm not positive that it was champagne or anything more than some kind of spritzer, but there was definitely more than lemonade in there.  We set it aside, no rush, because we try to avoid letting the kids drink anything but water before the meal anyway, so they don't fill up.  Somewhere in the next 30 minutes, our waitress replaced it.

At 7:55, our waitress stopped by to tell us the kitchen got backed up but our food was coming.  She said they had a bunch of "pork chops" come through and it slowed things down.  Our food arrived at our table at 8:04.  52 minutes after we ordered it.

Now I can understand the gluten-free burger or salmon could maybe get backed up. But you mean to tell me they can't cook a f*cking pizza in the wood oven and slap a f*cking grilled cheese on the grill for a minute so the kids can eat in under an hour of walking in the f*cking door and being seated immediately?  Seriously?

The manager stopped by to ask how it was.  I told him that we just waited 52 minutes to get our food, and with hungry tired kids that is not a pleasant experience.  "I'll check on it," he said.  I saw him strolling around the bar, but after a few minutes he was back to standing near the entrance to welcome guests.

Meanwhile, one of my kids fell asleep in the f*cking chair (I'll attach a pic to this review if I can).  I foolishly threw down the $45 we had between us so I could carry my sleeping kid back to the hotel.  He went to bed hungry, but too tired to eat.  Thanks, a$$ hole.  I should have just walked out but some of us have a little integrity.  Hopefully this review will cost them a lot more than that.

F*cking horrible.
author: Matt H.

description:
Super helpful waiters, wonderful food and it was gluten free.  Made a same day reservation ( lets be honest i made the reservation at 720 for 8 pm) and was quickly seated.  I was informed that the prawn special could be made gluten free and i jumped at the chance.   The prawns were well cooked, the gluten free penne was delectably soft/ perfectly cooked, and you can tell they hold their food to a high standard.
Special should out to Angel who new the menu backward and forward and defs created a great experience.
author: Candice B.

description: I love this restaurant but when I came in with my sister birthday cake they tried charging us after the dinner to celebrate with our own cake. Which no body told us that it would cost us more money to celebrate with our own cake! How rude? Other then that they have great food and service!
author: Victoria S.

description:
This restaurant was pretty good. What I was impressed the most about was its connection with real Italian food. While I wasn't blown away by my experience it was still pretty good. 

While not an Italian dish I ordered the New York Strip Steak which I felt, along with their other dishes, was overpriced for the quality. However, I asked for rare and they hit it on the nose. My steak was served with potatoes which were cooked PERFECTLY (nice crispy skin and soft inside) and a side of broccoli which was also cooked well. 

My favorite part of the whole meal though was the bruschetta. It was served with warm tomato marinara-esque sauce and goat cheese, and the bread was drizzled with balsamic vinaigrette. YUM. I would go here again, but preferably on someone else's dime.
author: Christopher S.

description:
After several hours of starvation this spot was my very first meal in San Francisco. It's located on a busy corner of downtown. The interior has a hip look too it. Luckily I had made reservations and avoided the long wait, otherwise I would have passed out.

The host quickly seated us at a booth. The ambiance of the joint is quite alive. The waitress handed me a wine menu. Odd, no food first, got it drink first then eat.

They had a good variety of wines available, started off with resiling. Then ordered a spinach salad, the taste was savory. Enjoyed the sauce used mixed in with the greens.

As for the entree, it was a pasta dish that reminded me allot of lasagna. Yet it had a little spice that gave it a different taste. The flavor was good. 

Finally dessert, you can never go wrong with creme brûlée. They added a bit of citrus, different but digged it. Why the mediocre rating, well as much as I love Italian food, the food was alright. Maybe it was the notion of spending over $100 per couple. But much expected in this part of town, would give it another try if in the area.
author: Enrique G.

description:
This is a fabulous restaurant! I was looking for an Italian restaurant close to Union Square. It met my expectation! I had the citrus olive appetizer and there were plenty of tasty olives of all varieties! The capellini  
 Papodora  with basil was excellent, there was enough to take home for dinner. The Cesar's salad had just enough dressing and it wasn't to overwhelming. The spread for the bread was excellent with tomatoes and capers and the tiramisu was light and perfect. The coffee was a bit weak but I like my coffee strong. Last but not least, Angel, the server, was the best!  Very professional; he waited with perfect timing to serve my different dishes and thought of everything. He asked me what I needed often, but not to often and immediately brought whatever I asked for! Excellent! The other server/bus person was helpful also! A real gem of a restaurant in San Francisco, and moderately priced! I didn't have wine, but the drink and wine menu looked extensive!
Go visit, I highly recommend it!!!
author: Tina W.

description: Egg and bacon panini was served on regular wheat bread and did not have any bacon. My friend ordered a margarita pizza which had a nice crispy  crust however the sauce was soupy. Very underwhelmed. Do not plan to re
author: Kim K.

description:
We made a reservation & got seated right away. Cool. No wait time to get a table. 

After we ordered, we waited a long time to get our food. So annoying. Service was okay. I guess they were nice. 

When we finally got our food, it wasn't what I was expecting. It tasted blah & totally not worth paying $25 for a plate of simple pasta. I was supposed to get the Capellini but I got angel hair in red sauce with one piece of dry chicken breast. Okay. No. Not cutting it for me. 

Not once did the waitress come to check on us. After we paid, I noticed the table who got there way after us got their food within 15 min. Yeah, I timed it. And? 
 
My friends liked the baked oysters they have. So I'll give them the 1 star.
author: Rebecca P.

description: Gluten-free menu, including beer and liquor! I would not recommend that you make a special journey to this restaurant, but if you are at Union Square, this is a great option for parties that include gluten and non-gluten eating people! Plus, they utilize OpenTable reservations!
author: Jane L.

description: Gluten free pasta which was perfect for my son, delicious fritto misto and caprese salad. I would have given this place five stars if not for the excessively high prices ($7.50 for a side of broccoli).
author: Suzanne B.

description: the Hot Molly! Very nice uptown atmosphere, with baseball playing on the tv's! So fancy sports bar!
author: Alli B.

description: Need to update menu food is good atmosphere is good with the exception of the unlikely unruly drunks for a Italian restaurant. But it's nice to watch the Chefs cook the food so you know it's made to order. Need to update the app for the reservation system doesn't work! Luckily I stayed right across the street and was able to get a table. Prices are a bit steep if you're frugal prepare to spend some change but that's San Francisco in a nutshell all I can say is happy dining.
author: John R.

description:
To be honest I wasn't totally thrilled with this place. I made a reservation February 13th Saturday before Valentine's Day I expected it to be a little quieter than having dinner on vday. When we got to the restaurant
  we were 30 mins before our reservation time the lady who seated us informed us that is was no problem to be seated early we asked for a booth which was available across from where we were sitting and she informed us it was reserved for a party of 4. We sat by a wall at a very small uncomfortable table with no view of anything. 2 minutes later a couple was seated at the exact table I had requested hmm I wonder why they got the table. Whatever though. We were brought waters that were shoved onto our tiny table with no straws. I requested a straw my parter didn't mind not having one. I thought this was a simple requested 20 mins pass no straw she checked every other table but ours I finally had to ask a second time as though we had been forgotten about. All in all food was mediocre service was shitty and the bus boys were the most hospitable out of the whole experience. Will I eat here agin? No. For reason being a paying customer I expect decent service not the same service I receive at Denny's.
author: Jesi A.

description: I was excited to try the brunch here but unfortunately the food was extremely overpriced for the quality and it was very bland. When I ordered the smoked salmon bagel, my dish came with no bagel... Just a plate of arugula and smoked salmon. Very disappointed with my experience here! I had to add hot sauce and salt on my food and ended up not finishing most of it.
author: Allison H.

description:
This place is great. A friend and I were just looking for some place to have a drink and chat and this place had some open seats at the bar. Nice atmosphere, service was great. The guys at the bar were very nice, and very fast. Drinks were good, and like I said, fast. 

I was really impressed how fast the food came out. I ordered a small Caesar salad and got it within 5 minutes and then ordered a pasta dish later and got it within 10 minutes. Both tasted really good with good flavor and nice presentation. The pasta had fresh thick slices of fresh mozzarella on top, it was really tasty and I haven't seen it like that before. 

The thing that most impressed me about this restaurant and made me want to write a review was their closing procedures. Like I said, we were sitting at the bar and the amount of cleaning they do at the end of the night is unlike what I've seen before. They cleaned everything, from every rubber drink mat to each tap, to covering every liquor bottle, everything was cleaned and then wiped down, and everything was sealed for the next day. They were cleaning for a very long time and were extremely thorough. I even asked them if this was a Sunday cleaning to start the next week and they said no they go through this every night. 

When you watch shows like Bar Rescue or anything like that on Food Network, you assume anyone cleaning twice a week would suffice compared to how bad some of these other places are, but the amount of effort the staff puts into cleaning every night made me feel great and very confident about returning and about recommending it to others. Good service, good food, good drinks, and very thorough cleaning and staff.
author: Nicole M.

description: I must say the server and staff were excellent!!! I lived in Italy and my Frutti di Mare was really not up to par for the price. I know this area of San Francisco has high rents and overhead but seriously, I've had better Italian for a fraction of the price. A glass of wine is $13-it really is crazy. The staff get 5 stars though-not their fault.
author: Alexis D.

description: Absolutely delicious al dente spaghetti and homemade meatballs. The Best! Steve the bartender was awesome, very knowledgeable of wines. The restaurant has a lot of character. I really enjoyed my lunch.
author: Jules L.

description:
This eatery is just across the street from Parc 55, our temporary home for the last 2 weeks, we decided we'd go ahead and try them for breakfast. They tend to serve it until 10:30 am every day of the week.  

Outside, they have a delightfully staggered menu, and so we were drawn in. It took about 4 minutes for us to be seated, even though there were only three visible tables that were currently being waited on.  AKA not busy at 9:45 am.  

We were offered a lovely window seat and that was fine, I enjoy watching the people and traffic go by, however the fly in the window was quite annoying, I know, that's not the location's fault, but this fly was huge, so I took care of him. He won't bother anyone now. Muahahahah!  Ahem..  Our waiter, a cute fellow with a double snakebite piercing in his lip took our order, answering the few questions I had, letting me know that the fruit of the day for the waffle was cranberries... CRANBERRIES (Seasonal?) for spring? Interesting. No thanks.  

Both the husband and I ordered the American breakfast, 2 eggs, bacon and toast with potatoes, and I ordered a bowl of seasonal fruits for us.  The only difference between our plates was the way our eggs were done. Mine would be scrambled, his.. sunnyside up.  About 8 minutes later, the plates were brought out... both sunny side up. No.  No thank you, please bring me mine corrected. And they did, but by then the husbeast was nearly done.. Sigh. 

I know they wanted to finish breakfast service, but PLEASE.. Please pay attention to the order you're taking. The food, overall was very good. The bacon COULD have been cooked just a touch more, but it was very tasty, Applewood smoked is my guess.  The eggs, when they came out right were delicious and fluffy and the seasonal fruit bowl was good as well.  We were happy but the service was what I found lacking. 

OH! And try the coffee.. SO GOOD!
author: Dianna B.

description:
Simple spaghetti and meatballs, veggie lasagna, mussels, ask for Alfredo and they'll make it and the bread and oily dip they give u is delish! 

Ask to sit on the barstools with view of the kitchen its really fun to watch every dish thrown together! 

Great service*
author: Jessica B.

description:
Mediocre food and unsatisfying menu choices. I really enjoy Italian food and I felt like there was very little on the menu that appealed to me in part because of certain ingredients that I want to avoid. You know how you go to a restaurant and they insert peppers into 80% of their dishes or use a spicy sausage in most of their dishes? That's how this menu was for me. Fried and I were neither wowed by our different red sauces. 

Verdict: convenient location for convention goers/visitors, but there are so many better options. Find those better options.
author: Amy S.

description: Possibly the best Italian I have ever had. The goat cheese in the bruschetta and ravioli is smooth and rich, and all of their tomato and basil is very fresh. The service is warm and welcoming, very fast as well.
author: John W.

description:
I came looking for breakfast on a Saturday morning. Little did I know that they had a special brunch menu on the weekends. The brunch menu is very unbalanced, having a lot more lunch items than breakfast. 

Nobody is going to want clams and pizza at 9am. At least I certainly did not. I ended up being somewhat forced into ordering the Belgian waffle with eggs on the side. The waffle was dry and not crispy, it was meh. Not enough strawberries too! 

PS: No wifi here!
author: Michelle L.

description: My husband and I went her today for brunch.  We had a $60 Groupon.  I ordered the crab Benedict which was very good.  My husband ordered the omelet which wasn't anything to rave about.  The side order of bacon I ordered was very undercooked and soggy.  All in all I thought this place was just ok and a bit overpriced.
author: Terry S.

description: Worst place ever!!  We waited 45 minutes to get coffee, our food didn't come until after we complained twice.  Never again!  Don't go you will be disappointed
author: Tina M.

description: Came here today with my family and was seated immediately . We waited forever to get our order bc it seems as though they only had one server working. Our food was okay, nothing too special. The only reason I'm writing a review on this place is to warn other patrons of their bills. We were charged a $1 extra on two of our entrees. I showed the Mgr the menu and our bill. He laughed and said it was a typo. Seriously? If I hadn't looked it over , no ones the wiser. He gave me a look as though I was a cheapo. Um two adults and three kids bill equaling $135 plus SF mandate. So here's my warning about this place.As a reminder always check your bill.
author: T P.

description: Decided to eat here because it's connected to the hotel I stayed at. I've been to many Italian restaurants (in Chicago they're a dime a dozen) and this one didn't strike my fancy. Overall, the food was good, but 27 dollars for a baked parm eggplant over noodles was a set back. I understand that SF isn't a cheap city, but seriously... The aesthetics of this place did not even match the jaw dropping prices on the menu. Unless their prices drop a bit, just go to Olive Garden.
author: Amy H.

description: The restaurant was busy and we did not have reservations. It was a 30 minute wait but we were offered an immediate table in the bar. However, we could only order from the bar menu, which was limited. I don't mind sitting in the bar but they should offer the full menu. We decided to go elsewhere.
author: Terry J.

description:
Went here for dinner last night. I had been before, years ago for lunch, but thought we should have dinner. I learned that the restaurant had changed hands about a year ago, and I will say, the new hands are treating it very very well.

They started us with some house made Focaccia an absolutely delicious tampenade. Did I say delicious?  For our first course we had the  Carpaccio ($14.00) a great start. Perfectly presented with a lovely dressed arugula salad in the middle. Second course was the Grilled Asparagus Salad ($13.00). Perfectly done warm asparagus, set on top of proscuitto with an aged balsamic drizzle. So good. On to the mains the hubs had the Frutti Di Mare ($28.00) and let me say, the broth is one of the best I've ever tasted; plenty of seafood as well, I had the Linguine with Clams ($28.00) a great sauce on perfectly cooked linguine with an ample amount of clams. The only semi fail was dessert which was an cheesecake thats crust was just soggy. It should have been crisp, but felt like it had sat around for a little too long. But the top was tasty.

LindySez: If you are looking for some nice Italian inspired foods, i would recommend Puccini & Pinetti .
author: Lindy B.

description: I'm not sure if the dinner is better but the lunch was bland to say the least I had a steak sandwich which tasted so plain salt and pepper didn't save it and the spaghetti tasted like the water it was cooked in and the meatballs just tasted like unflavored meat and out of the 4 staff members that helped us only 1 was polite
author: Josh T.

description: Great service, very kind, food was great not all Italian food is very good. The check in girl was a little bit rude the space is a little bit cramped  but I loved it!.
author: Brianna C.

description: The restaurants has great service. They have entertainment for the kids to draw while you eat. Prices is a bit to high for what the food really is.
author: Ivan C.

description: Staying @ Parc 55.. Asked front desk where to eat near by.. Recommended this restaurant. I ordered spaghetti & meatballs... Mediocre @ best. Salty, meatballs were lacking flavor. Hubby had linguini & clams & said it was "tasteless." $92 for whaaaaat? Service was very good!The place looked like it needed a good cleaning & had that "old" building smell. I would find another restaurant people!!
author: Jan S.

description: Good meal after a long day... Sat at the bar, friendly and helpful staff. Enrique was very helpful with deciding what would suit my appetite. Had a white wine and the seafood pasta! Great!!! Ended with a Crème Brulèe very delicious.  Good meal and fast service!
author: Cinnamon S.

description:
Great food - good service - great location.
Best lunch for $20 including salad- soup-wine-meal and dessert!!!
Dinner is slightly higher but equally good.
House wine is great - too bad they do not serve it with dinner except at the bar. That was the biggest error they make.
We eat there on vacation for lunch and no one could do better. Not so busy and very attentive. All that food and a great house wine too. Food was fresh - good and plentiful.

Dinner was super busy - we used open table for reservations - great choice. Food was very good but they don't serve the house wine at dinner - very strange policy.

Had the Capellini - great dish
Shrimp - so tastily
Fish - to die for
Chicken Marsella - really good and lots of mushrooms
author: M. B.

description:
I really liked the food here and the service was good. 

The focaccia bread was very deelish.

Got the steak wrap with perfect, baked fries.
author: Amy M.

description:
This review is only for the happy hour.

After arriving at our hotel in Union Square, my friend and I walked around to see what places we could go to for a quick bite since dinner was almost upon us. That's how we ended up at P&P and their happy hour had just started.

Order:
- Anchor steam beer - delicious
- Pasta nachos - tastes like it sounds, not a bad thing either!
- Crab cakes - very good, but on the small side... you get two
- Mussells and fries - if it were all mussells, that would have been better... the fries seemed like it didn't belong, and got soggy from sitting on top of the mussells
- Sausage/fennel pizza - great, four slices... lots of herbs

This was all pretty affordable from what I recall, and I definitely left there happy = a good happy hour. Check it out!
author: James L.

description:
I made a reservation for dessert and drinks/coffee after a show on Saturday Night, for 945. We show up and ask for our table, and the host tells me that we have to sit in the bar area, on the high stools if we are only getting dessert. Well, why would I have made a reservation if I wanted walk-in seating? You already have the table set apart for me, PER MY RESERVATION and I like sitting in booths. If the table is already spoken for, where does this obnoxious segregation come from? He insisted we could not have our booth - strike 1. My friend pointed to a smaller halflike booth right next to the door (probably where people wait for their seats). We sat there and then the worst service I have ever encountered began. 

Some irritated waiter came up and took our order, but not before offhandedly sighing at our comment that we were only here for dessert. Some minutes later, a different person brought over a single espresso. We thanked them and reminded that we had ordered two. She hurried away, not speaking. The waiter never came over again until the bill was being dropped. I had to ask the host for water and napkins, which they only brought one of each. Casual dismissive and rude service, and I fought not to leave a tip at all but the blonde man who cleaned our table was very sweet. One of like 7 people who rotated our twilight zone table. 

Dessert was ok - gelato was half melted and the tiramisu was bland. Espresso was good though. 

Will never return, will definitely recommend against this restaurant and their crap-for-brains service team.
author: R K.

description: You know, an OK spot.  Great for happy hour.  In a prime location.  Great bar staff.  But they cannot make a decent pizza.  Thin crust but something not right between the oven and the cook.  Always soggy except around the crust.  Not the way it should be.
author: Scott S.

description: Perfect place to go, when you are starving! I had the Chicken Marsala and it was delicious!
author: Alla T.

description: We just went for appetizers for an afternoon snack. Service and food was good. They were also accommodating with my dairy allergy. It was not busy when we went but it was around 4pm.
author: Renee L.

description: Excelent food, friendly staff and fair prices. Olives are delicious and so is the minestrone soup. We also tried the bolognese pasta and some sorbet and creme brule for desert, all wonderfull. All accompanied with a fine sauvignon blanc from Napa. Very good dinner in a very good company.
author: Judith F.

description: I went to Puccini and Pinetti with 3 friends for brunch. I ordered the "Take It Easy" and that was the first time I have ever had polenta, which was different but good, in my opinion. My 3 friends and I were all very satisfied with the food. However, we ordered 2 mochas, 1 latte, and 1 cappuccino and they were not great. The coffees that we ordered were not served to us hot but rather lukewarm. The waitress that attended to us was very nice and I would not mind coming back to this restaurant again.
author: Junisa V.

description:
A big-ass plate for a lil' bb serving & a cherry tomato on the side doesn't justify your prices, P&P... Ridiculous. 

P.S. They're going to slap on additional 20% gratuity to your obscenely-marked-up total~
author: J. S.

description: Fab service...Thank you, Paco! Salads, and pizza were delicious. Buzzing atmosphere but still easy to have conversation. The truffle filled chocolate (first on the dessert menu) was amazing!!
author: Pj H.

description:
I think I died and went to Italian restaurant heaven on Saturday night when I walked into the doors here.  My friend who booked the reservation made sure they offer some gluten free options, but who would have thought it was an entire menu of options.  I know this doesn't sound like a big deal to all the gluten eaters out there, but let me tell you that when I can order several options from one place it feels like I am the Queen of England.  Seriously, crazy as it sounds.

My friend and I opted to split the seasonal green salad with sliced apples, spring mix, ricotta salata, shaved radish and a champagne vinaigrette.  It was lovely that the restaurant split the salad before bringing it to the table.  It is a small effort but one I appreciate so much when restaurants pay attention to details like that.

The specials here that are the tried and true's and what they are famous for is the spaghetti and meatballs, chicken marsala, fruitti di mare (seafood medley pasta).  I was on the fence to try the seafood medley with a saffron broth, but I instead opted for one of my favorite dishes - the classic pork chop.  It was served with roasted brussel sprouts and butternut squash, and creamy corn polenta with a mustard vinaigrette.  Overall my chop was cooked beautifully medium, but it was lacking sauce.  While the chop was juicy the dish felt dry next to the polenta and veggies.  Personally I am a pork chops and apple sauce kinda gal, so I'm used to a sauce to accompany my chop.  

The girls I was dining with ordered the chicken marsala, meatballs, and short ribs.  Everyone ate their dishes with no complaints and happy bellies at the end.  We closed our meal with the crème brulee.  It was huge and plenty for the four of us to share and not be left wanting more.  

The restaurant is just off the main drag of Union Square, but still in perfect walking distance to the excitement of everything.  I look forward to coming back here again.
author: Mandy L.

description:
6/23/13 Late Lunch

A friend is in town to shop. After scouting Macy's for hours, we needed a late lunch spot. Even though Union Square is horrible in terms of food selection, restaurants have long wait because of the high volume of foot traffic. So I found a table at Puccini & Pinetti on OpenTable and jumped at it. 

It's part of the Albri Hotel. Upon entry we were informed that happy hour is served all day but only at the bar and the few tables up front in the lounge. We needed to eat so badly so we passed the HH and were seated in the dining room. Boy we were wrong.

*The Working Lunch set ($18) allows you a choice of soup or salad, a main course and a dessert. Nothing was really bad nor was it impressive. Minestrone soup was lukewarm. Chicken Marsala is okay, the sauce is a bit too sweet.  The best part of the meal was the tiramisu. Two of us got this set and we both agreed that portion is small. That piece of chicken is like a deli slice.

*Asparagus Salad with Shrimps ($19): Crispy asparagus with five sauteed prawns. My partner was underwhelmed by this skimpy portion. He thought it's a bowl of salad with mixed greens topped with asparagus and shrimps. It's small even for an appetizer.

Overall I am not impressed. Food is just not amazing for what you pay. I settle for mediocre food if it's diner price. However, the Happy Hour is the catch here with $3 wine and $4 pizzas. Come here for a nosh and forget about a full meal.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Hotel suggested this for a family dinner last night. What a mistake and a wasted opportunity for a great meal in such a foodie town.  $80 for a cup of minestrone,  a kids mac n cheese and a dry chicken marsala,  a Draft pint and a $14 glass of Rodney Strong chard (which at $7 a bottle retail is a ridiculous 600 percent mark up).  Tourist trap with no seasoning to their food.  My 8 year old called it out on his own.

Small portion entrées and food with no imagination.  

Next time we will read yelp over the suggestions of a front desk clerk.  Our bad.
author: Grant L.

description:
So I had no plans on eating here, but the jazz quartet caught near and brought me in the door. Being alone I meandered over to the bar and perused a nice list of alcohols priced rather modestly.  Considering this is San Francisco after all. 

Offered some bread and it was pretty good with a nice spicy dipping item. Looking over the dinner menu I found two items I could live with. Fruitti di Mare or linguini with clams. I gave the choice to the bartender and he did not hesitate to punch in the fruitti di Mare. It did not disappoint. Nicely flavored and sufficiently messy enough to splatter my shirt and give me something to clean when I get home. 

All in all, one of the best experiences for dinner I have had in the couple of weeks I have been in San Francisco.
author: Christopher S.

description:
The BEST Chicken Marsala I've EVER had. Chicken breast sliced in half was grilled to perfection, and was so succulent. It was presented on a bed of light, creamy mashed potato, all smothered in a rich, mushroom Marsala sauce. By the way, upon arrival, I scoffed down the complimentary focaccia bread and the accompanying relish(?) that (I think) comprised finely chopped capsicum, capers and balsamic. To be honest, I could have made a meal of just that focaccia and relishHearty!
The service was OUTSTANDING. Have to say, one cannot go wrong with an authentic Italian restaurant. You KNOW you'll be served a lovingly prepared, more than decent portioned meal, and you'll walk away feeling completely satisfied. AND...there'll be no 'add-ons' to bulk up or disguise the food on your plate.
author: Bev C.

description: Quick service, friendly and good food.  though I do prefer hard crust Italian bread over focaccia slices. They served the later. Minestrone was potato based not bean based.  Enjoy!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Good food quality, atmosphere comfortable and relaxing. Food portion was a bit small for the price, $18 for chicken waffle, standard waffle size with small popcorn style chicken bites (about 10 pieces). We used a Groupon which made it worthwhile. Service is ok, staff seems tired when we were there at around 1 pm for brunch.
author: Cat Rox L.

description:
We had dinner here, I had the special Rigatoni with Sausage..FABULOUS, my
Wife had the margarita Pizza..LOVED IT!
author: JOSEPH A.

description:
I was hopeful we'd have found a really good meal on a busy night. With an hour's wait it had to be good, right?  

Yikes - what a miss. Food was cold, service sub-par (delivered drinks 15 minutes after we ordered, never came back to check on us until food arrive then only again to hand over the grossly overpriced bill), not good dishes (Caesar salad dressing was 'house-made' but tasted very watery and was insipid). 

Bill was $85 with the kids - geez. Won't be back here ever again. Look elsewhere and do a better job of planning ahead (unlike us).
author: Scott ..

description: Oh, my goodness...the wine-braised short ribs. Get them. Just get them.
author: Valeria R.

description: The turkey panini was not panini and Contained no bacon. It was a turkey sandwich on wheat bread toasted. The cheeseburger also did not have any bacon. The margarita pizza was goopy. The service was slow, but we got $4 off for no bacon. We would not go back.
author: Lucy A.

description:
One of my favorite Italian restaraunts I had the pleasure of going to! Late review but their mussel appetizers were delicious and they had a great selection of entrees. The waiters knew there menu really well and was able to help me pick out the right dish. 
I went with the Bistecca, medium rare of course. Everything even to the texture of the cartelized onions was made to perfection and the seasoning and juices just oozing out of the thing was amazing. A place me and my friends always talk about, we have to go again! Great service and tasty food! A bit on the pricey side (especially for me because it was my treat). It was pretty packed, so calling ahead or even reserving would be something I would recommend. Right by union square, tons to do around! :) can't wait to go back!
author: Krystal L.

description:
I'm giving P&P 3 stars for their awesome pizza minus 1 star for the rest of this ridiculous meal, which equals 2 stars and I can't go any higher.... I just can't!

I ordered a margarita pizza, side of brussels sprouts, bowl of soup and tiramisu but the only thing this joint has going for it is the pizza.

I had a $7 minestrone soup that was completely tasteless extremely watery and the fact that the "bowl" of soup looked like it was half eaten did not help. The brussels sprouts were beyond under cooked, not tender at all like they should be and it was very difficult to finish. 

The only thing I really enjoyed was their super cheesy thin crust pizza.The last thing I had was a tiramisu that was just okay, nothing fantastic. The staff seemed to not really be taking care of business the way they should but it wasn't horrible but it just wasn't great. I believe the servers are the ones who set the mood of the establishment and the mood here was like everyone was bored out of their minds.

Anywho I highly recommend the pizza here but that's about it and since I already had a taste test I'm glad I did but won't be coming back. At this point this place needs  some major improvements in some major areas.
author: V W.

description: Excellent food and reasonably priced for touristy SF venues. The calamari is perfectly cooked and flavorful with a great creme sauce. The margherita pizza is fresh with big chunks of mozzarella. TRY THE SORBETS OR THE LEMON CHEESECAKE!!! You will not be disappointed
author: Carey B.

description:
This place was across the street from Parc55 (where I was staying). I ran into a couple that happened to be staying at the Hilton (also nearby). I'm guessing they get a lot of hotel traffic and deal with many tourists.

Food: I had a full order of the Capellini with the add on of grilled chicken. I was surprised that it was actually quite good (I don't know -- maybe my expectation for touristy areas is just that low). Loved the fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomatoes. The portion was generous (leftovers!) and I only regret not going back to try other dishes.

Price: It is, however, on the very pricey side or maybe I'm just so used to cooking that I know how much that dish should have cost. Either way, when I'm back in that part of town, I don't mind stopping by again if I'm too lazy to look up more affordable options open late at night.
author: Sheryl D.

description:
Great personnel giving #1 customer service, delicious food, we shared the arugula salad and each devoured the meatballs...so much meat! Had a glass of red, "earthquake" yummm!
Our server, Angel, perfectly named. He gave us the best service since we visited on this trip. Thank you Angel for ending our trip to SFO, wonderful!
author: Lynne K.

description: The food was so good and healthy.  I was in SF to run the half marathon. I wanted something substantial but not too rich. The chicken Marsala was perfect.
author: Debbie C.

description:
Total tourist trap near Union Square.

We came here because it was close to my cousin's hotel and he was craving some good ol' SF ciopinno.  Yeah, don't come here for that. 

It does get packed for dinner but we came at around 5pm, so we were seated almost right away. Bread came first. It was foccacia with olive tapenade. Tapenade was good but they took away the bread and tapenade before our entrees came. When we asked for more bread, they said they had to charge us $2 for more bread and tapenade. Well, if that's the policy, don't take away the bread when you patrons are not done with it! 

Appetizer: mussels w/ white wine sauce ($15). Mussels were so TINY. Like they literally disintegrated while cooking. It was pretty much all shells.

Entrees: Frutti de mare ($28). Sooo watered down. Lost the seafood taste. Really disappointing. The seafood was cooked well and the shrimp sizes were generous but the dish was just so bland.

Bistecca ($32) - New York strip steak. This was ok. My cousin commented that the steak wasn't cooked as he would like and the meat was fatty. But really, for the price point, this dish was just so simplistic. No intricate flavors. Came with a side of fingerling potatoes and broccolini. 

Service was pretty efficient. One of the waiters was pretty candid about their bread. We asked to take the leftover bread to-go since we paid the extra $2 and he said he wouldn't recommend it because the bread gets ROCK HARD after 3 hours. What?! Why would you serve this type of bread to customers? We took it anyways and I can't confirm if this is true since my cousin took it home, however this comment was so weird!
author: Julie L.

description: Found this place via a deal on Groupon. The Linguini and Clams are amazing, it definitely met my craving expectations! However, this place is more on the pricier side (go figure, it's around the touristy area), not sure if I'd pay full price for it. But if you're looking for a cute place and are craving some real L&C, then this is your go to place! The staff, waiter/waitress, and hostess are all really friendly and professional! Also, waiters/waitress is very proficient in the wine selection, a definite must, especially in a fancy Italian restaurant!
author: Shela D.

description: pretty solid food.  tasty Italian pasta dishes and a good deal of wine options
author: Jonathan O.

description:
Had dinner here tonight with my GF and my mother and grandma. Food was good but a little bit too salty for us. Would recommend the spinach salad, clam chowder, and short ribs. The grill salmon was the most expensive plate but it didn't surprise us, pasta was ok just little bit too salty. 
Over all food was okay, waitress was kinda hurrying us to made the order, she asked us 5 times if we were ready to order within 3 mins. My grandma doesn't know English at all, we had to explain every dish to her so we took a little bit longer time to make the decision, the waitress saw that but just keeper hurrying us to order so we had to pick one for my grandma without her opinions. 
4 stars for the food and kind waiter, -1 for hurrying us to order.
author: Johnson Z.

description: The pork chop is best I've had anywhere. The warm spinach and balsamic salad was delicious too! Bread and oil is different than the usual- we loved it! Service was superb! Will be back during our stay here in San Fransisco!
author: Kayla G.

description:
Good place for lunch when you want to escape the noise and crowds of Union Square.

I had the grilled chicken sandwich and it was very good.
author: Bill S.

description: I took my family here tonight looking for a place in Union Square that is family friendly yet still a nice dining experience. This place completely over shot our expectations. The whole staff was more than accommodating, we brought a huge stroller with us, we were shopping so we needed the storage space, the staff without any hesitation took the stroller, stowed it for us, got us right to a nice booth with kids menus for our 11 and 7 year old and a high chair ready for our 1yr old. Our waiter, Angel was steller. A great person to begin with but also a great server who although juggled many tables, made us feel like we were all he cared about. The food was perfect and the atmosphere exactly what you'd hope for when you go out to dine with your family. We will be back over and over and over. Thank you :)
author: Gary D.

description:
I went here for happy hour, which is all night from on Mondays and Fridays. The fritto misto calamari was crispy and went well with the aioli. The risotto fried balls were moist and interesting. The pizza wasn't that good. I felt the sausage overpowered everything else. The pasta nachos were interesting but tasted more like pizza nachos. I really liked the chips which were crispy. 
The drinks were offered at a decent price but the cocktails weren't the best.
author: Kristy K.

description: I am pretty sure this restaurant survives by tourism in the city. I really doubt that they have much repeat business. We ordered the chicken Marsala and the Capellini with gluten free pasta. We also ordered olives and truffle fries. I think the only thing tasted good was the truffle fries. The chicken Marsala was dry like many others have complained about. The capellini tasted very canned. The tomatoes were not fresh. When you serve capellini it absolutely needs to be fresh. After all this food the total price was outrageous for the quality. We spent almost $100 for barely hospital quality cafe food. My suggestion would be to pick anything other than this restaurant.
author: Paul D.

description: Tried this restaurant during a trip to explore San Francisco.  They were very close to our hotel in Union Square and we noticed that they were busy every night.  The pasta dishes were delicious. We tried the spaghetti bolognese and meatballs and chicken Marsala. Both were sizeable portions. It came with complimentary focaccia and a tapenade. That was my only complaint - the bread was not at all fresh. So disappointing. But I'd still recommend this place.
author: S. S.

description: Stopped by just after arriving in town.  Had a few appetizers and drinks before heading out for a walk.  Pizzas were amazing!  They have a happy hour menu that is with checking out in the city.  :) coming back with the family in a few weeks and already jonesing for one of their pizzas.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
OK chef came over and apologized to me.  He went to go taste the pizza sauce. 

Oysters were amazing! OMG their meatballs - - to die by.    I will be back because of the amazing customer service and food. 

Margarito pizza worst I've ever had - think they use Campbell's tomato CANNED soup as sauce.  Tried to tell chef who didn't care.
author: Jeanne J.

description: Brought my family here... Seated in the bar. Sat for 10 minutes wasn't greeted or offered any water. We just left. I was appalled at how many waiters walked by and did not say a word. Wow.
author: Melissa Y.

description: The sausage pizza was really good and cheese the happy hour is great! The service is awesome we had a really great time.
author: Andrea C.

description: This restaurant was across from the hotel I was staying, we wanted pizza and couldn't find one open within walking distance. It has a nice ambiance, but that's were the "nice" ends. Hostess was not overly welcoming and our server, Amanda was exactly the same way. It could have been that all we ordered , (because it was late night and we were headed to bed shortly after), was the Margherita pizza and two waters. I guess, she felt like we should be ordering more to increase our bill which in turn would increase her tip. The pizza was okay, it came out hot and was enough for two, but I've had MUCH better.
author: Holly R.

description: Never come to this establishment. I was forced against my will to order off of their ridiculously expensive menu. I asked to order off of the kids menu, because I am allergic to most of the other items. I was refused this service so i ordered the simplest item: butter....and...fucking...noodles. After consuming this mediocre dish, I was charged the absurd price of $25. My party was forced into a borderline bankrupting tax and tip. All in all, I payed $30 for a bowl of starch. Never coming to this shithole again!!!!!!!!!
author: Anna D.

description: Great food. Nice Italian restaurant I would definitely recommend splitting the dishes with someone.
author: Zack G.

description:
Their Happy Hour is amaze-balls!  I didn't try anything else on the regular menu, but just about everything on the happy hour menu.  

$3/glass of wine during Happy Hour.  Amazing.

The crab cakes were good, but they're veeerrryy tiny (and made mostly with bread stuffing). 

The oysters were also veerrrryy small at $2/each 

The trio of meatballs were tasty, or so my boss says.  I'm a non-meat eater.

Calamari is yummy, even as a combination with shrimp. 

Overall, a very good Happy Hour spot for the value, and in this location area. 

**Beware: The Happy Hour gets suuuper crowded, so be prepared to wait.  Also, Happy Hour menu is only offered to those sitting in the bar, and not at a bar table close to the bar.  Weird, right?  If they were smart, they'd offer it to the entire restaurant instead of making potential clients wait, and possibly take their business elsewhere.
author: Kristin H.

description: Probably the slowest most inefficient service i have ever had in a restaurant including fast food
author: Paul M.

description: Overall we had a very good experience. The calamari and bruschetta were very good. My wife freaked out about the special (vegetable lasagna).  Probably one of the best Italian dishes we have had in a long time. We ended the meal sharing a creme brûlée that was also very good. The atmosphere is busy and a bit crowded but nothing out of the ordinary for a happening San Francisco restaurant at night. We would come back again.
author: David T.

description: I went here a handful of times years ago, but it was always for happy hour.  They have decent prices on food and drink, especially in the heart of the city where almost everything is $$$.  The Bruschetta and Baked Parmesan Oysters are sooo good!
author: Lynessa R.

description:
This review has been weeks overdue! But I've finally gotten to it! 

This restaurant has a great ambiance especially during the weekend! It's really busy most of the time. It's casual yet full of life. They have a full bar and bar area that has a different menu from the dining area. 
My girlfriend and I dined in the bar area after some drinks earlier. We had a very nice time and received great service! 

Their regular oysters and baked oysters (with cheese) were delicious and fresh! 
We also ordered the pasta nachos which were also yummy. The sauce/meat in the nachos was a bolognese and the "chips" were super thin, crunchy and delicious!  
We also really enjoyed the mussels and fries here! Very simple dish that I've tried countless times at other restaurants with variation of sauces. They did not mess this one up. Their garlic fries are epic. 

We also ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and the bruschetta. Carb overload but it was worth every bite.

Definitely a sweet spot in downtown San Francisco you should check out. Make sure you check out both bar and dinner menu. Friends of mine say that they have a pretty awesome happy hour too!
author: Hayden H.

description:
Like Shari M, this was the first place I had dinner after arriving this time. We drove straight from the airport to the Best Western Hotel California and decided to go for a quick walk to see what had changed since our last trip, keep ourselves awake (jet lag sucks) and find some dinner even though we weren't hungry. 

When we got here there was a twenty minute wait so we headed to Union square quickly and then came back for our table. What struck me about Puccini & Pinetti was the romantic ambience and the yummy looking menu which is very different from menu's at Italian restaurants back in the Netherlands. Also, risotto. I love risotto.
So anyway, I obviously ordered the mushroom risotto (which I think was that day's special??) and le boyfriend ordered the chicken Marsala. 

The dishes came with a bit of a size difference with the chicken Marsala being too much for le boyfriend to finish and the risotto being just the perfect size to still have room for dessert. Keeping that in mind we ordered just one dessert: the Valrhona truffle cake. That comes with a short wait, but that's to be expected with what's basically a chocolate fondant and it's well worth the ten or so minutes that you have to wait for it. And it's worth coming back for!

As for that, during the rest of our trip I tried to get le boyfriend to come back here so we could try some appetizers and more desserts (I also secretly craved the risotto. Ssshhhh...) but I couldn't convince him. While I liked the place and we both loved the dessert, something had put him off this place. Thus culminating in a 3.5 star judgement. Next trip to San Francisco, I'm dragging him here again for cocktails and dessert though because I'd give Puccini & Pinetti four stars! Although, it is a bit expensive. Too expensive actually...
author: Bekkah R.

description: Great happy hour wine for $5 and bar menu has many choices. Vibe is nice, location is great, service is friendly but sometimes a bit slow. I like coming here.
author: Lisa S.

description:
We celebrated a bachelorette party here. We had coordinated a pre-fix menu and brought a bottle of wine and champagne. Working with the event coordinator was seamless and quite pleasant. All of the food options were delicious and the service was excellent, just the right amount of attentive. We were running a bit late and told our server and he was able to pay attention to the time and get us to our next event on time.

I would definitely host another event here!
author: La Tache T.

description: This restaurant was close to our hotel, so we decided to give it a try for dinner.  I made reservations and we were surprised to see open tables when we arrived (it was New Year's Day evening and most of the restaurants were pretty crowded).  We were sat at a very small table in the corner, it almost felt a little too small for 2 people.  We were promptly greeted by our server and ordered drinks.  I chose the Cappelini with grilled chicken, my boyfriend had the Chicken Marsala.  Our server brought us some focaccia bread...it was a little hard and very cold.  Our food arrived pretty quickly.  My boyfriend really enjoyed the Chicken Marsala and said it was very good.  My Cappellini was ok, it had a rather large pile of tomatoes on top, it was a little overwhelming.  The chicken was kind of dry too...but I was hungry and it was edible.  Definitely not worth almost $28 for some pasta and a few pieces of chicken.  Don't think we'll be coming back here.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Old folks talking about their Facebook relations and activity, but the reason they were really there was National meatball day! 
It gave me a reason to come here. I worked 2 blocks away for over 4 years, never made it over from the other side of market.

This place has a super chill vibe, no snobby better than you attitude at all. Older people, younger people all chillin together in one restaurant happily. 
The drink menu looks simply smashing. 
Got the meatball special 5 Giant meatballs and a draft beer (one day only for National Meatball Day) I found the draft selection a bit o the tame side but it was "good enough"
We Got the Fritto Mitso, got the kid some mac and cheese and my wife got the prosciutto pannini 
The Fritto Misto: perfection in every bite and the tomato dipping sauce was smooth and creamy, not like some red cocktail sauces that are all to common It was so refreshing.
The meatballs were so decadent. Full of flavor and juicy. As I press down on the meatball with my fork I could see the juices oozing out under the pressure. Five giant meatballs, eating all of them would have killed the rest of the day forcing me to go home and fall into a deep recovery nap. so i didn't eat them all but instead took some to go.

Looking around at the people as I was wrapping up I noticed that this place has classic and classy all bundled up at a extra decent price, its not over the top and the people who come her have a true appreciation for what they offer.. So it's the clientele for the most part make this place so great.

The servers are nice.
The foods great.
Drinks are amazing
author: Ben M.

description:
Really great food! Casual / Relaxed atmosphere. attentive service! 

Ordered (for two people) the:
- Bruschetta 
- Green Salad
- Spaghetti & Meatballs 

Walkable distance within Union Square, SF.
author: L A.

description: We went for dinner during our stay in SFO.  It was very close to the hotel where we stayed. They have limited selection. We ordered pizza, fried chicken, calamari, and chicken pasta. Fried chicken was good .Calamari and pasta was average and pizza below average. It was pricy and service was not good at all. Never going back again. Check the menu before going in.
author: Foodlover V.

description:
I was surprised at the fact that this restaurant was rated only stars three and a half. All 6 of my family ordered different ones, but they all enjoyed their foods. I ordered the Margherita pizza. It came out in 6 pieces and it was very average amount to eat. Our family like tomato or marinara sauce, so all we ordered was like pasta with pomodoro, but still it was very good. The hostess was very kind and pleasing to us. She asked us about the San Francisco trip and what we saw. We were happy to answer her. Foods came out early and quick, and there were few people in the restaurant. I really like here.
But I don't know why the chairs vivrated. It was kinda uncomfortable and was not delightful at all. It was a small vibration but it disturbed me. But the restaurant is really good! I really recommend here. :)
author: Anna Y.

description:
