This review is for Happy Hour only - specifically the OYSTERS 

We came in to watch a game and for a "snack." We had tried to come before but this place gets pretty crowded during HH. For drinks we had mojito ($6) beer ($4) and bubbles ($3). All pretty standard. We ended up getting  two dozen parmesan crusted oysters and six raw ones. Parmesan crusted is like a party in your mouth!  A bit salty but so so so addicting. 

We'll definitely be back for......

~(M)ore!
author: Brilissa T.

description:
I am sure Puccini and Pinetti continues to surprise many a guest who happens to walk in to try the place just as it did with a friend of mine who was visiting from NYC did one time several years ago. We've loved the place ever since.

It's surprising to find a nice restaurant with good food and drink in the touristy Union Square area where you can still get some really good deals.

Their happy hour is amazing and it is available for a significant amount of time throughout the entire week. for example you can get happy hour stuff all day on Saturday and Sunday (contact restaurant or walk by to see the posted hours) They have an excellent assortment of appetizers, best of which is the Pasta Nachos. This is a must try!

The service is always friendly and attentive and the food is great. I can't really think of more to say than that. Worth trying out at least once because after that, you'll likely keep it in your arsenal of places to go when in the neighborhood.
author: Thomas K.

description:
We dined here last week when at a conference in San Francisco.  The food was outstanding we ordered the Fig Pizza, a pasta dish and stuffed shells it was all delicious; I just wish I was more hungry or I would have eaten more!!  

It would be 5 star experience except they tried to put us at a table int he back.  After some negotiation we were able to sit at a booth near a window.
author: Lisa I.

description:
We were out of town guests, and had seen the restaurant several times, but hadn't been able to stop in to eat.  It's always been packed, and we hadn't made a reservation.  This time we made a reservation for 6 @ 7:30.  They take your name and cell number.  Due to the uncertain nature of trolley car waits, as luck would have it we were stuck at Hyde and Beach for well over an hour, missing our reservation time.  Not only did they call, they kept bumping our time, calling twice to follow up.  (The last time we were on the trolley).  

When we arrived at the restaurant it was quite busy, with people waiting.  Imagine my surprise when we were promptly seated, at our table that they had been saving for over 30 minutes on a busy Saturday!  That's service.

The food is outstanding.  We ordered the bruschetta, and margarita pizza as an appetizer.  Both were excellent, the pie was hot, thin and delicious.    Strongly recommend.

For dinner we had the Chicken Marsala, Scallops, and Spaghetti and  Meatballs.  The last seems rather simple, but don't be fooled.  It was incredible, as well as the others.

We didn't think we had room for desert until they brought the menu back out...we did.  I had the Cheesecake w/peach, we also ordered the crème brule, and the chocolate panache.  

All in all the food was outstanding.  In a city filled with awesome restaurants, I would certainly dine there again.
author: Collin M.

description: Definitely go for the bar menu over the lunch menu... FYI. Had the sautéed shrimp, Caesar salad and the pasta nachos.... All were pretty good...! We couldn't decide which dessert to get so we got wine instead.. Smh. The host/waiter was stiff and not very friendly. But Will from the bar was super friendly.. Very nice and was genuine.
author: Mal M.

description:
I haven't been here in a number of years, but decided--why shouldn't I review the place that has still, to date, served me the best plate of risotto I've ever eaten?! 
I adore Italian food, choose it over most other options, and have visited Italy--so am not a pushover when it comes to impressing me. I ordered a tuna risotto, by far the most perfectly composed dish. 
Too bad the great food & lovely company (SF locals, who made a good choice choosing P&P; which I fully expected because they are big foodies) are all I recall; I'll have to leave the comments on ambiance or service to other reviewers until I visit again!
author: Patti C.

description: Went here for a business lunch and there was something in my client's food. NOT a good place to make a good impression. Also, the food was mediocre but on the pricey side. Safe to say, I won't be back.
author: Priya B.

description:
Teetering between a 2 and a 3 here...

Host fine. Server fine. Manager/owner (?) made her rounds throughout the restaurant to greet diners which I appreciated. However I can't ignore the fact that their risotto wasn't just al dente, it was waaaaay undercooked! It wasn't soft like it's supposed to be, it was actually quite rough. However I'll admit their broth was decent. The hubs didn't mind his short ribs but at $26 at this restaurant he expected slightly better. 

Well, I gave it a shot after passing by a bazillion times. I never felt the desire to try however we were in the area one evening after Christmas shopping and it started pouring out. We were hungry but knowing the area is lacking of great eateries and restaurants we weren't expecting much for dinner and pretty much chose P&P purely out of convenience.

This restaurant is fine as a standard "tourist restaurant" where the majority of the patrons probably still refer to the servers as "waitresses" and "waiters" in this day and age. With hiked up prices to reflect the Union Square locale for mediocre (in my case undercooked) Americanized Italian fare I think I can safely say I won't be returning. Just not my cup of tea.
author: Esther A.

description: We waited too long time for pasta, but they are not good as the pictures! Food taste bad, we ordered mussels and they're not fresh! Try once is enough, never come back again!
author: Xiefei D.

description:
What happened to the food here. ?! So disappointing ! Service was great but the food was below average ! We ordered the New York steak- terrible and dry . My husband ordered the veal- so small and the potatoes tasted straight from the box! Money down the drain!
Hope you guys improve your food..please!
author: Em C.

description: My husband and I met friends for brunch here and both had some of the worst sandwiches of our lives. I could not believe what I received after ordering a $15 grilled cheese with prosciutto...barely toasted white bread with ham, random spinach leaves stuck in mayonnaise, and cold onions mysteriously next to semi-melted cheese. It was just so bad.
author: Franny B.

description:
Minestrone soup was very bland and under seasoned. They forgot the candied walnuts on our salad. Bagel wasn't even toasted properly for our lox and bagel. 

Won't be back!
author: Joel A.

description:
Came for my birthday dinner. I was looking forward to Thai food, but somewhere along the way, we ended up here.

The New York steak was superbly prepared - nicely seared on the outside, reddish pink on the inside - and the seasoning was delicate and subtle, but definitely there. I ended up sharing almost half of it with everyone.

Calamari is good, comes with shrimp, too. 

Overall I liked the dining experience, and the food was good, though the place was very noisy, but this time I was able to tune out the noise and enjoy my food.

It was an expensive meal, but I guess that goes with eating in SF!
author: Jason W.

description:
Came in for Dine About Town only to be told they were not participating in the program. They were listed on the DAT website but apparently, P&P has had a change of ownership since then. Uh, oh. We should have walked out but ....

We were already here and we were hungry so we decided to stay and eat. The menu was decent if unimaginative. The kind of food that Oliver Platt's food critic character in the movie, Chef, criticized Jon Favreau's chef character for cooking, technically OK but with no soul.

We experienced drive-by service. It seemed like our server only stopped by our table on the way to another. Only the busboy exhibited some vestige of personality. I don't expect obsequious service but I also don't want to feel like part of a faceless crowd. 

Drinks:
Ace Pear Cider: similar to a wine cooler.

Freebies:
Foccacia bread with red bell pepper and caper tapenade: bread was soft but cold. The strange thing was that our bread was cleared along with our appetizers. We didn't say anything since we thought we were getting more bread with our entrees. 

Appetizers:
Frito Misto: calamari and rock shrimp battered and fried was OK but nothing to write home about.

White Pizza: pancetta, feta, arugula, parmesan cheese. Dough was yeasty and pancetta was chewy rather than crispy.

Grilled Asparagus Salad: asparagus, proscuitto, balsamic vinegar reduction. OK but I don't know how they got food that sounds like it should pack a flavor punch taste so bland.

Entrees:
Grilled Salmon: salmon, asparagus, wild rice, aioli. I've enjoyed wild rice in a pilaf, a soup, a pancake, etc. but can you honestly tell me of anyone who enjoys eating plain wild rice with no seasonings, mire poix or anything else added to it? 

Veal Piccata with plain mashed potatoes, capers and shaved asparagus: I will say the server allowed my friend to substitute her sides since she was allergic to some of the ingredients. Veal was very tender, if a bit too lemony.

Dessert:
Valrhona Truffle Cake warm chocolate truffle center, topped with vanilla gelato: I don't care what Oliver Platt's character said about molten lava cakes. They're delicious if done right. There was certainly enough gooey chocolate in this cake. Yummy.

Crème Brulée with Tahitian vanilla bean: dialed in

Cherry Cheesecake: also dialed in

Five star prices for two and a half star hotel food. We were so unenthused about our current meal, we were more interested in discussing the upcoming Giants game and trying to figure out where to eat in a couple of days. With so many other great places to eat in the city, skip P&P.
author: Cece E.

description: Me and my husband popped into Puccini and Pinetti this evening to grab a quick bite to eat after a long day of shopping. The food and drinks were decent, but a little overpriced in my opinion. The 2 stars is because of an awkward encounter we watched unfold with management and our waitress. An Asian American looking woman came around the bar and yelled at our waitress apparently for some kind of food order mistake she made. We felt the manager was being very unprofessional in dealing with the situation, and it kind of ruined the ambiance of our evening. It looked like the other tables around us were feeling uncomfortable as well... It wasn't a good enough experience to come back again.
author: Meagan M.

description: Went to Puccini & Pinetti for dinner one evening while visiting San Francisco. They were relatively crowded, but the service was still attentive. They have a full bar here and a decent selection of wines. Had a penne arrabiata dish, which was good and had an excellent sauce, however the pasta itself should've been a little more al dente. The food here, unfortunately, is overpriced. There are better Italian dining options in San Francisco that will cost you less.
author: Matthew S.

description:
This review is for the room service breakfast ONLY.

Pretty standard fare, and quick delivery - especially considering that they are simply partnering with the Hotel Abri to provide this convenient (and necessary) feature for hotel guests. The omelette was not an omelette in the formal sense - it was more like lightly scrambled eggs with veggies. The toast was rather delicious, perhaps due to the sweet, soft butter, and the potatoes were well fried & crisp, though not oily whatsoever. Served with peppers and onions, they actually were quite scrumptious. Generous juice portions, as the orange was delicious and fresh squeezed. Otherwise, their bagel and eggs benedict were pedestrian, but to provide room service to clients that aren't even directly yours is a big boon for both the restaurant and the hotel. Good for them. Prices are reasonable for room service - around $15 per breakfast entree.
author: Evan L.

description: Great drink selection. The Wagyu steak & truffle fries were super. Great - friendly service to boot. Highly recommend!
author: Troy E.

description: Had reservations on a busy Saturday night. We were seated on time and had order taken timely. Starters were great, but entrees mediocre. It was so hot in the restaurant we couldn't stay for dessert. Very loud so don't plan on conversation.
author: Carin S.

description:
All you need to know is come early for Happy Hour which starts at 3 ends at 6.

Get you a heavy pour of red, white, or bubbly for 3 dollars.

Then order up some bruschetta.

Everything's gonna be alright.
author: R J.

description: Very good chicken Marsala and great leak and parsnip soup. Waitress was super friendly.  Biggest drawback is the notice level.  It was very noisy    The food made up for the noise.  Right by hotel. Service was great
author: Chris B.

description:
Boy was the food bad here! 
I ordered one of the pastas...one with some sausage etc. unfortunately I cannot remember the name. Anyways, it was so salty I was not able to eat it, left it untouched, finished my drink and went to Burger King instead. None of the waiters bothered to ask whether the food was ok...especially considering my company had finished their food to the plate, whereas I had not touched mine.

The restaurant is on top of this incredibly noisy. I will never return here, and would rather have all my future meals at Burger King than at this place.
author: Adriana S.

description: Very good meatballs (and capellini) within a classy / casual atmosphere. I like this place. Next door to Hotel Abri.
author: Cheyne M.

description: The food was very good. My friend ordered the Bucatini Arrabiata and I ordered the Linguine and Clams. The dinner portions were just right for us. The free bread with the tomato-caper dip was awesome.  I wanted to give it 3.5 stars because while the staff was attentive,one waiter kept hovering around to take our plates back even though we were not done. It was not like the place was packed and they needed us to get out. Also, a bit on the pricey side though.
author: Vidya K.

description: Over priced mediocre Italian food!! Could not eat my dish!! My kid order the kids pizza and was terrible! Would never recommend this restaurant!
author: Gina L.

description: Called 2 minutes to make a reservation and was told wait was 45 minutes and could get us in for a 9:00 pm reservation but we had to be there in person. When we got there we were told a hour to 1.5 hour wait and we would be put on a wait list. I would not recommend this place because they are dishonest and wasted our time
author: Navjot C.

description: Amazing service, a stellar gluten free menu. This place is busy, no surprise: but the service is spot on. Food? Wonderful old world flavor in the pasta combined with new world options. Love it!
author: Diana C.

description: Late night drink and appetizers. Service was good. Olives were perfectly marinated, truffle fries tasted like truffles (not like places that don't infuse the fries with flavor), and raw oysters were fresh. I'd definitely return.
author: Jesse S.

description: We went here because we're craving Italian and it was across the street. I ordered the linguine and clams and it bomb! My boyfriend ordered a chicken panini and it was okay. The in laws ordered a steak wrap and that was okay too. However the fries were awesome! Service was slow and it took a while to get our food. If you go here, order the pasta dishes.
author: Winnie M.

description: Pumpkin cheesecake was delish! Warmed spinach salad was the perfect size. A little pricey for the portion but nothing out of control. Great service and awesome staff!
author: C P.

description:
Pretty nice restaurant, but the food was pretty typical and way overpriced.

I ordered the bucatini arrabiata, which ended up being pretty chewy (more undercooked than al dente) and very salty. The portion size was pretty small too. I can't believe it was 25$!

The service, on the other hand, was phenomenal! The waiters were very prompt with taking our orders and the serving time. I never even had to ask for a water refill because they were always one step ahead!

 It's a nice place to eat if you're out late and are pretty hungry, just beware the price - everything is $20+!
author: Michael T.

description:
Service none existent, had to grab manager as she too was going wide open past just to get a drink order. 8 min later waiter shows up, sweating like methhead, not a word just " what do you want to drink " the manager never got the wine so now we have to wait another 5 min for the wine.  Place was Not busy, and the tables that were there were not eating.  We contemplated leaving but we're very tired from walking so stayed put.  Linguini with clams was $2.00 worth of food for $28.00
Pasta with basil and tomatoes good flavor WAY over priced, small portions.
Never offered more water or wine, got check and left. BTW. The SF Mandate is on most bills, it is a heart care tax.  Deduct from Bill and don't pay.  The king already gives out free heath care.
Wish I had my money and time back.
Is there a zero star?
author: B R.

description:
I came here with a group of friends, we planned a night out in the city and wanted to eat at a place that was close to our entertainment.  The restaurant has a nice ambiance and was very busy., but this restaurant was nothing special.  You pay mostly for location, as there were many tourists sitting around us.  I had read the reviews prior to coming here and was eager to try their crab cakes.  We had dinner reservations, and upon reading over the menu, the crab cakes were not listed.  I asked our waiter about them and he told me that they only serve them at the bar.  When I asked if we could have two orders of them, he told me that he had to ask the manager first....This totally threw me off, I mean why wouldn't we be able to order them?  He came back promptly and said it was fine.  However, after that my opinion of the restaurant just kept dropping.

I ordered the capellini and added grilled shrimp.  The shrimp were small, and it seemed like they were not cooked with my meal because the shrimp were lukewarm and my pasta was hot.  Flavor was ok, but nothing to remember.  My bf ordered the chicken marsala and it was smothered in gravy.  He said it was good, but again nothing special.  I probably wouldn't come here again, and I would choose a higher rated restaurant outside of union square and suffer the cab fair back to our entertainment planned.
author: Annie E.

description:
I've been going here for a while, now. P&P is one of the go-to spots for the servers at the restaurant I work for... usually for the happy hour. 

This is a fantastic place to take someone who's new to SF -- it's central, downtown... great for a bite and a drink at any time. The actual restaurant portion is very nice; Would be a GREAT place for a date that wont cost an arm and the leg.

Anyway, I'm mostly here to talk about the happy hour. $3 Red, $3 White, $3 Champagne. $4 Beers, $5 Well drinks. Laughably tasty food (try the bruscetta, the meatballs, and all the desserts.) The servers are super cool, friendly, and know their menu.

ONLY one gripe. Seriously, ONLY one. I love you guys to death, but sometimes paying the check can take a loooong time. I get it, sometimes it looks like the bar area is a mite understaffed -- just sayin, from a guest's perspective.
author: Taylor S.

description: Place is very chill with a nice happy hour prices haha. Ordered some variety of entrees and the food was very delicious but the house wine wasn't so great.
author: Erik P.

description: Loved the make your own pizza option as a kid, and love the diversity of the menu now. My family and I go here every time we stay at the Parc 55 across the street and while the place has changed a bit everything has just gotten better. Very accommodating for my dad with dietary limitations.
author: Gabrielle L.

description:
I have been here a few different times and each visit I leave happy.

My favorite item is the grilled ceaser salad, the flavour is fantastic. 

The service is always friendly even on a busy night.
author: Meghan L.

description: Absolutely delicious! I had the frutti di mare and the saffron broth was amazing. The portion size was perfect for dinner.  My husband had the bucatini arrabiata and he said the pasta was perfectly al dente and the sauce was a great balance of garlic, cheese and lemon. It was crowded for 8 pm on a Tuesday but I can see why we had to wait 15 minutes for a table. We will definitely be returning if we come back to San Francisco to visit in the future.
author: Mae W.

description:
We walked all over Union Square and this place was the first to have a table open so we took it! They were a bit expensive...the food was definitely good but I didn't feel that the food was worth the prices that they were charging for it. I feel like they were getting away with their pricing because of their location and the fact that it was filled with a ton of tourists.
I've had better italian food, but it was still pretty yummy...but then again it's Italian food and Italian food is inherently delicious. Though I must give them this, the service was great. Even though they were packed, they got our food to us in a timely manner and kept stopping by to make sure we were okay.
author: Kay G.
Joelle K.

description: The best thing here is the bruschetta.  So different from anywhere else!  I come here every time I'm in town.  Bar top seating or make a reservation.  Ask about any special lasagna.
author: Emily M.

description: Took my husband here for Father's Day lunch.  I made a reservation because I figured the place would be packed due to the holiday.  We arrived ten minutes late and the place was empty. There were maybe two other couples.  They only offered a brunch menu today which was kind of a bummer but we both ended up getting really good food. I had a prosciutto grilled cheese and my husband had a steak wrap. I ordered by 18 month old cheese pizza and we were all satisfied. My husband also had two bloody Mary's at brunch.  Although the food was good and service was as well price was steep. I would recommend to people in the area but won't go out of my way to go there again.
author: Jenell C.

description: My family and I enjoyed Puccini and Pinetti for Sunday dinner and loved it! Amanda and Mariza were very attentive and friendly and tended to every detail. My son had the chicken cappellini, hubby had the veal picatta, and I had the chicken Marsala, all of which were very flavorful and delish! Dessert was the best-having the tiramisu and the chocolate torte and coffee. Will definitely be back and would recommend to friends! Thank you Puccini and Pinetti for such great service!
author: Nina B.

description: I have been here twice and both times I have had amazing service, excellent drinks, and tasty food. The happy hour has a wide variety of drinks and appetizers. The calamari and fennel sausage pizza  is amazing! The staff is also very welcoming. A must for me when I am in the city.
author: Jazmin M.

description:
I've been many times and each time I've really enjoy this place. Sort of my go-to place for friends and family that are visiting from out of town after shopping in Union Square and after making a reservation. 

We started with the bruschetta (excellent) and the lightly fried calamari and shrimp (a tad chewy but still good).  Even a picky eater in the group loved the bruschetta.  The menu had several options for pasta and meats and fish and everyone had to decide between at least two choices.  And after the meal I noticed everyone's plate was completely empty.  And if you need to go into sugar overload try the warm chocolate truffle dessert with vanilla gelato - yum!

The service is great here and our server had a wonderful sense of humor, even entertaining the kids in our group.  Yes they have a kids menu as well.  Appetizers and entrees were spaced out but just enough so that you didn't feel rush or you were waiting.

Interior is softly lit in darker tone with lots of windows, but this place is LOUD...and I do mean loud as in shouting at your table mate because the sound from the bar and other patrons is right up there in level with the sound of a plane taking off.  Kids love it because they get to scream indoors - adults not so much.  

I'll continue to bring visitors here for sure but hope next time the noise level is a little less.
author: Keith S.

description:
Overly underwhelmed!!!

Ordered Chicken Marsala...sauce was watery and flavorless, mashed potatoes tasted like instant box potatoes...overall, BLAH!!!

Ordered Spaghetti & Meatballs...just BLAND - no amount of salt could fix that dish!!!

Ordered drink 'There She Is'...drink was more grapefruit juice than a cocktail...simply put - paid cocktail price for grapefruit juice!!!
author: Rogilan A.

description:
I visited Piccini and Pinetti with 2 friends after seeing a play up the street. I had made reservations based on yelp reviews for restaurants in the area. In this case i may have mis-read yelp.

The soups were mediocre, the risotto less than average, the mashed potatoes just "ok," and something about the salmon just wasn't right.

The upside? They seated us well before our reservation time (maybe this should have been a clue). The warm spinach salad was very good and the beer, Beer Republic Racer 5 (a local favorite of mine), was GREAT.

Just not enough for me to recommend the restaurant or return with so many other options in the area.
author: Gary O.

description:
We had reservations, so the wait was non-existent.  This is a great location close to Union square and local theaters.  Don't come expecting to have quiet conversation, the place is buzzing.

The waiter, Mike, was excellent and attentive.
I had the salmon main entree and my dining companion had fruitti di mare.  The food had a nice presentation, however the flavoring of the food was not what you would expect from such a reputable restaurant.The salmon was cooked to perfection however, and the mussels, clams, fish in my companions plate didn't swim off...
author: Michelle J.

description:
We had a lovely meal, lots of variety with Spaghetti & Meatballs, pork, steak, pizza app and a bottle of wine called freak show ;-).  Everything was lovely, the flavors were rich and inviting. Definitely worth stopping in, especially with so many choices in the area. 

The staff was also very friendly, held oil and accommodating when we arrived an hour earlier than our reservation.
author: K H.

description:
I love this place!

I was pleasently surprised when I found myself in Union Square and looking for an Italian place. I went with a friend of mine and we were promptly seated by the window. The ambiance was warm and inviting and was further enhanced by the delectable wine we had. The bartender had a good pour so what more could you ask for? Speedy service? ...yea...it came with that as well.

 I had the red wine braised boneless short rib with mashed potato and baby carrots. Elegantly presented and robust in flavor, this dish satisfied my every need that evening. Potatoes were amazing, meat was tender, and the sauce paired well with both. I would have licked the plate had my mother not taught me any manners. 

For desert I finished with a glass of moscato and the Walnut Chocolate Torte. Absolutely divine! I couldnt have been more pleased with my experience that evening. Fast service, amazing food, well poured wine...heaven perhaps?

I would give this place 4.5 if i could. The only reason its not a 5 is because parking is not that easy. The service, food, drinks, & atmosphere all get a 5.

Please...do yourself a favor, stop in and enjoy an intimate meal the way its supposed to be.
author: Derek F.

description: The inside of this place looks like a Panera bread on steroids, which should have been my first hint that we shouldn't eat here. We were looking for a quick dinner before a show, and Italian sounded good, so we decided to give it a try. It definitely caters to out of towners, and I wouldn't be surprised if we were the only locals in there that night. We ordered the bruschetta to start, which was good but nothing special. We also shared a caprese salad which was mediocre. We then shared the saffron shrimp risotto. I was actually impressed by how they were able to create a risotto with so little flavor. Usually when you put shrimp, rice, and saffron together good things happen. But this risotto was so bland that if my mouth wasn't moving I wouldn't have known there was food in there. It was also about $30, which is outrageous for the amount of food we received. I definitely won't be back.
author: Diana G.

description:
My experience here was not so good.  Our actual time in the restaurant was not bad, but that part that followed was not so good.  We had a group of 7 people on a Tuesday night in early September.   We had some appetizers, some meals, and some beers.  Normal night, nothing special.  However 4 of the 7 people had scallops.  I puked my guts out, and two of the other scallop eaters spent the night on the toilet.  Net, the three of us were really sick for about 24 hours.  Coincidence? You be the judge.  We had one thing in common ... the scallops. We didn't drink a lot.  As you look at other reviews, you'll see I'm not the only one that has had this experience.  

BTW, this is not necessarily a nice, quiet restaurant.  It is very alive, loud and not a great place for conversation.  There are lots of good restaurants like that.  I'm just sharing so you take that into consideration when you are choosing a place to eat.  It is like a Friday's or Chili's or other similar chain type of restaurant.  I wouldn't consider it a special place to go in San Francisco.
author: Leo Q.

description:
Great service
Nice environment - good place to mingle for lunch
Good food 
Fair pricing

Good experience
author: Tony Bao C.

description:
Had a great meal here over the holidays! The service was AMAZING and the food surprisingly good for the price point. We even got a complimentary appetizer with fresh mozz bruschetta. The olive tapenade and bread given at the beginning of the meal was great and the pasta dish we ordered was light and clearly made with fresh ingredients. 

The location can't be beat--union square right off of market and easy to get to. It wasn't too crowded when I went so maybe the food is hit or miss but I thought it was a hit and will be back!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Have not been to this restaurant for a few years.

Linguine and Clams = $29
for that price you should have gotten a lot or we thought
(ten fresh clams and a little bit of pasta)

Pork Chop = $28
wasn't too bad
author: D L.

description:
As an Assistant to a very discriminating traveler, who was one of the many participants at this year's JP Morgan Conference.  I interacted with several local restaurants, to plan a week of client development meetings.  I found the folks at Puccini and Pinetti, the very accommodating and friendly to deal with.
 
Without knowing the restaurant, food, or atmosphere, I was very pleased at my boss' compliments about the restaurant, service and food.  Too, her dinner partner, whose company is there in the San Francisco area - he, too, will remember Puccini and Pinetti.
 
Choosing restaurants, from a distance, is difficult.  They made my job easy and successful.
author: Ray C.

description: The complimentary bread and spread was delicious!!!! Definitely give it a try, you'll be asking for the recipe like I did! Their margarita pizza was devine as well!! The service was also  outstanding! Definitely would come back here when we're in town again!!
author: Tanya K.

description:
One of the friendly front desk folks at the Hotel G recommended this place to my wife and myself when we asked for a casual place to go for dinner around the 7:30pm hour last night. 

It was a short walk from the G where we were staying and it was located at the bottom of the Hotel Abri.

The staff was friendly and the food was great. 

We ordered the Butter Lettuce salad, the Fritto Misto (calamari and shrimp app), the Spaghetti w/Meatballs and a side of green beans. The tapenade they serve your with focaccia bread was so good!

We topped it off with the creme brûlée for dessert. They even accommodates us by adding fresh strawberries to it since it came just plain.

My wife must eat gluten-free for health reasons and they had a great menu for that. We split the entree and it didn't even taste like gluten-free. I'm picky because I've had to sometimes adjust for her needs and usually it tastes terrible. 

The spag/mtbls were very flavorful and a great sized portion that we were able to share.

Jessica the Mgr was great and very nice as was our server, Amanda.

They were very attentive and pleasant even on a busy night as were the bussers. 

Great spot and next time we're in SF, I'd come back...
author: Vincent M.

description:
My boyfriend and I had stayed in Hotel Abri, and decided to use some vouchers for this restaurant on our last night there. 

The bread brought before our meals was plain but very soft and the sauce with it was amazing. We ordered the gnocchi and the chicken marsala for our entrees, and they were to DIE for! 

Our server made a recommendation on dessert, and while I don't remember what it was called, it was essentially a liquified chocolate cake topped with vanilla gelato (though a little more gelato would have helped counteract the sweetness of it all). It was a very rich dessert that I would love to have again. 

Overall impression: Fantastic!
author: Shaylyn O.

description: Services tonight was amazing. Friendly and great group of bartenders!!!!! A definite reunion back here next year for my annual trip! Thanks Nash!!!!
author: Wesley S.

description:
Loved the food! I ordered the ravioli but worried it would be super heavy. It was so delicious and very light. Just enough on the plate so it wasn't so much food. I are every single bite and was not overstuffed.

We also ordered the calamari and it was definitely interesting. The sauce was good but the calamar could have been meatier. But overall was good.

The oil dip thy serve with the amazing bread is lethal! So garlicky so be warned!

Will definitely go back to try another dish!
author: Jessie F.

description:
SUPER great and friendly service.

Food tastes good too.

Right across from Parc 55.

I will return if life permits.
author: Phil Y.

description: Went here for dinner last night before the Nike race... I liked the food, it wasn't anything too amazing but it was well crafted... The service was nice, the people that refilled our waters (all 13 times) were super kind. There was homeless people banging on the Windows which is why it gets 4 stars from me
author: Erica M.

description: Don't bother stopping at this place! Asked to sit at a table to have a drink and kicked out for not buying dinner!  Wow! It makes sense why it was empty on a busy day.
author: Dwayne K.

description: We ate here tonight for dinner and chose it because it's a stone's throw from the Hotel Nikko where we're staying. It got mixed reviews, so we decided to try it. For the price, PASS! For $100 for dinner, I'd like my money back. We ordered the salmon which came with a lentil & squash pairing and it wasn't good. The salmon was fine, but I asked to have another side, instead, and was told I couldn't have the asparagus which was reserved for the special of the night (I get it) so I asked for broccoli and the waiter looked perturbed. He then came back and said "we're going to give you spinach," to which I said "no thanks" and he was annoyed with me. I don't like when a server or chef tells me what I'm getting. The customer should be asked, not told. Tried to fill up on bread, but it was just "meh" so we asked for the check and left. Cute and old school restaurant with nice decor and the hostess was very pleasant, but other than that, I wish we had gone somewhere else.
author: Roma B.

description:
Used to come here with my bf for happy hours and loved it.. One night i ordered a pasta dish and the second it came out something was off. I remember sitting at the bar area and thinking should I eat or no but I was starving ! Had about two bites and had to send it back.. Fast forward to a day or two... Yep majorly sick from the food that have been food poisoning ?? Not cool because I did enjoy this place I haven't been back since the incident but would love to come back for drinks someday 
Happy hour deals are awesome though
author: Nessa H.

description:
I have to update, the bar menu has changed, the prices have been raised, they no longer offer the cheese plate or charcuturie plate anymore. Me and a friend ordered the Pizza Margarita and frankly it was bad. The center had caved in, so the tomato sauce which reminded me of Campbell's Tomato soup had puddled and made it very limp and soggy. both pizzas came out that way. For the price the menu before was great before raised the prices and the quality went down, it's not worth it. Many people I work with said the same. 

 Also we encountered this asshole sitting next to us who was smoking a glass pipe and he wasn't a bum, patrons next to his party were leaving because of it. I pointed it out to the waiter that it is against the law to smoke and he just hemed and hawed. Finally after 20 minutes they said something the jerk started to go off in Arabic, insulted my girlfriend who then in turn called him some obscenities, it just wasn't pretty all around.

My girlfriend and I won't be going back. My work friends agreed. I think they got new owners so it's not the same. it was fun while it lasted.
author: .James A.

description:
Was in town traveling for business and this place was across from my hotel. Super friendly host and hostess. Amazing waitress. Sat in the cooks corner and had fun talking with the chefs. They were all very nice. 

Ambience: not sure I would recommend as a first date location. Pretty bright and kinda loud.

Ordered the short ribs and they were out of this world amazing! I would eat here every night of my life if I could. I highly recommend you go here and order the short ribs.
author: Rico R.

description:
Went to Puccini & Pinetti with some visitors to San Francisco that were staying close to Moscone Center.   This was walking distance with Parking across the street so I thought it would be a good place for a family dinner.  I read the mixed bag of reviews on Yelp and thought it was still our best bet.  We had seven people and they set up a nice table towards the back near a street window.  We had some wine and a cocktail.  The waiter was on us and made sure we all had drinks when we came in (not all got there at the same time).  He was very attentive as were the support staff.  I had read how poor the service was, but I didn't see any of this on our visit.  Our table ordered a myriad of dishes and salads, soup.  I think everyone seemed pleased with their meal, and my son go a special dish (plain pasta with chicken) which thy had no problem doing for him.  I had the Chicken Marsala.  And as noted in other reviews the chicken was dry and the plate was $25 dollars.  It was served with mashed potatoes and vegetables.  My cup of minestrone was very good to start, but the meal was a bit off.  The chicken is cut very thin (makes for fast prep, but can be over cooked as seems to be their issue here) and served with a dark marsala sauce.  Although I did enjoy the sauce, it was very heavy and maybe a bit overburdened making overly rich than I prefer.  Plates were picked up promptly, almost overly eager at times (so don't stop and chat with a ¾ quarter completed plate in front of you), but they tended to the table well which I like.  The restroom is in the adjoining hotel next door.  You meander through a long hall until you enter the small lobby that had well maintained, clean, and rather posh restroom.  Changing tables available for those that need them (in both his and hers).  
The prices are high.  The glasses of wine were $12 and up a glass and plates around $25 to $30.  But, you are in San Francisco, and near Union Square where everything is expensive.  Not to mention the generous tip they add on, and SF Mandate fees to pay for whatever dole that that's for.  Anyway, the net net is a good location, nice vibe, close parking, good for informal family dining, adequate food.  The negatives, were cost, and value for the dollar, noisey.
author: Jim M.

description: Came in to meet a coworker after traveling all day. We stopped in during happy hour and got club soda with vodka and some appetizers. Fast service, attentive staff.
author: Cyn N.

description: I love this place!  Service is excellent and the food just the same!  One of my favorite places when I visit San Francisco!  A must eat place when in town!  My Server, Katie, was the bomb!  Loved her!
author: Glen M.

description: The ambiance was nice, but it was a bit loud. Service was good, but prices were high. I had the linguini & clams & was disappointed at the small serving. My friend had the frutti do mare which was basically the same as my order but with a bigger serving for $1 more.
author: Sean S.

description:
Nice Italian restaurant located just a couple of blocks from the Powell Street cable car turnaround at Cyril Magnin St.  It's nice enough inside, and large, so that it does have the feel of a nice upscale chain restaurant.  But I'm not sure it is a chain.  Certainly popular enough in that it was packed on a Friday night.

I had the build it yourself bruschetta appetizer which was OK.  The Caesar salad was good, but the pieces of romaine were chopped just small enough to make it kind of difficult to eat with a fork.  The spaghetti and meat balls dish was a pretty decent size and a bit spicy for my tastes, but I liked it.  I had the cherry cheesecake for dessert and it was quite good.  

Service was very good.  I'd eat here again.
author: Doctor G.

description: Food is great but service at the high tops is awful. Waited 10 min for them to acknowledge me as they served the tables around me. Then it took another 15 minutes to get a glass of water. This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF when I travel but this experience has been terrible. Don't sit at the high tops as a single I guess.
author: Brad M.

description: First time in San Francisco and decided to stop in here for happy hour. Everything was amazing! Tried the spaghetti & meatballs, as well as the Bruschetta, and  both were delicious! I definitely recommend this spot if your in the area. I also want to thank the very attentive and friendly staff for their service!
author: Erick S.

description: I got lured in by the pasta nachos - yummy. I also got the fettucini with preserved lemon alfredo, italian bacon, garlic and peas - also yummy. The lemon in the alfredo was subtle but not invisible. My fiance had the spaghetti and meatballs - too few meatballs, and the sauce tasted diluted. We would return to try the pizza (which we've heard is really good), but their prices do exceed reasonable... with just one appetizer, two entrees and two drinks, after tax/tip we paid $90.... I dunno, for a pasta dinner? You tell me.
author: Andrea L.

description: Went back again for HH and this time tried the Carpaccio.  It was a good time, my advice: ask for more sauce.  The sauce gives it a little kick and really rounds it out.  The service continues to be excellent.
author: Shaun W.

description:
The mussels and fries was very good, small, but its only 9$. The calamari is also good. A bit too greasy for me, and the sauce could be better, but again,
its 6$!! The marinara pizza is ok. The pasta nachos has a special taste. Its good though. Have to try!
author: Patrick D.

description:
My 67-year old Dad and I were having a nice time enjoying this great city, until we made a fateful decision....

The P&P management needs a refresher course, let's start there. The sense of welcome is akin to what you'd find in an Abercrombie & Fitch - present but vacuously insincere and readily abandoned. Drink ETA ~ 20 minutes, and let me mention the calamari, ordered at the same time, made it out 5-10 minutes earlier. Prior to the arrival of our drinks, the young, nice waitress obliviously asked if we wanted to order main courses - DERP! "Yes, but are our drinks on the way?"

No prob, I'm a chill Austin dude, the drinks arrived 5 minutes later and were strong, if not well-mixed.

But then the mains showed up. Oh, wait, rewind, forgot the super-chewy calamari! Chewperb!

Dump a Trump-Class-Yuuuge pile of Chachere-seasoned ground beef on a couple meatballs and some Costco pasta, et voila!

HEB-grade Linguine w/ clams? Guhhhh...kayyy. 

Awful service. Mediocre food. "I can't wait for you to leave" atmosphere. 

-Puccini & Pinetti -
author: Thomas S.

description:
The bread they serve at the beginning is delicious. 

Ordered the Frutti di Mare (seasonal fish, clams, mussels, calamari, shrimp, saffron broth, linguine, crostin) and friend had the Grilled Salmon (eggplant peperonata, plum tomatoes, basil, garlic, dill aioli.) Both were cooked to perfection. Salmon was like butter with a dash of lemon.

My only qualm is that the portions were a bit smaller than expected. But the waiters/waiteresses were super nice.
author: Z C.

description:
how funny. never knew this place existed. my buddy and i even did the restaurant owner's refinance! 

we decided to come here for a late lunch after we glanced at the menu posted outside. there was about 2 other tables at the time, so it was pretty quiet. i guess it gets pretty packed here during happy hour. 

he ordered 2 stella's and the grilled chicken panini and i ordered the steak panini. however, i wanted ciabatta - not flatbread. guess i should've paid attention to the description. also, i asked for no onions and no gorgonzola. what happened? it came with both. i also told the waiter i wanted medium. the steak came out well done. luckily, their fries won me over. i ended up pulling out the steak. i pretty much had steak and fries. lol. 

we were stuffed at this point and could no longer go for dessert. i must say.. prices are a bit steep for lunch. but we'll probably come back during hh or even dinner to try out the different dishes.
author: Ann T.

description:
I've only had their happy hour so I can't comment on their dinner menu.
Crab cakes - yummy!  Love that you can actually see and taste the crab.  Most places these days use way too much breading.
Burrata - my BFF's favorite.  Fresh mozzarella with garlic crostini.  Really fresh and light tasting.  Definitely a must have.
Mussels - these were ok.  Not bad, not great.

Service was great.  Not too noisy in here to hold a decent conversation.  I'll be coming here again :)
author: Michele S.

description:
A-OK!  Free WI-FI, love that, especially when my hotel across the street charges $14.00 a day!  

Came here for happy hour - friendly service and the appetizers were good.  We ordered the Burrata but they were out so we had the Bruschetta with goat cheese.  The tomatoes were really ripe and the grilled bread was great.  I was surprised at the freshness.  Very good.

Came for free Wi-FI, I mean breakfast the next day.  Service was a bit slow but very nice servers.  Had the traditional eggs, bacon and toast - again very good.
author: Laura G.

description: The reviews of Puccini & Pinetti are so interesting, and despite them.....we did eat here during a recent trip.  We wanted Italian food and needed a restaurant near the Hilton, so Puccini & Pinetti fit the bill.  The inside of the restaurant reminded me of a coffee shop/diner, but the noise level was manageable.  Our waiter seemed to be covering a lot of tables (or maybe was just inefficient) and he had limited interaction with us.  It's telling that they give you a small bottle of water so you can refill your glasses yourself and he didn't ask about refills for our other drinks.  I was surprised at the limited pasta offerings on the menu and can't ever remember being in an Italian restaurant where there were no specials.  Considering, then, that the menu is fixed, we were especially disappointed with the quality and taste of our entrees (but did like the complimentary olive spread, even though the bread that came with it was stale).
author: NA0795 0.

description:
I typically like this place but the last time I was here they really messed up. I ordered the Chicken Marsala - it was terrible! Rubbery and too sweet. I didn't want mashed potatoes so I asked for Angel hair - bad choice and I should have been worned. It really did not go with the meal. 

The waiter totally abandoned us once there was a problem. I don't like to send meals back. In fact, I usually don't but my sister insisted. He sent it back then would not give any eye contact, walked by the table a couple times and didn't ask how the new dish was AT ALL. The next time he came back was when he dropped the check.  Not ok. 

Bad experience. I like this place and will try again, but will make sure I do t have that same waiter. (Tall blonde, short-haired male)
author: Leslie E.

description:
The staff were nice enough, but scattered and hard to track down. But the food is AWFUL. This is a tourist trap. Think of an Italian-themed Denny's, multiply the price tag by 10, and you get the idea. 

The calamari  is frozen and bland, and the pasta dishes are so SALTY to the point of being inedible. Others have mentioned the stale bread (brought in, not fresh.) 

HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE. We will never go back.

UPDATE: 

Not only was the food HORRIBLE, but apparently they didn't even bother to check-us in at the front desk and listed us a a "no show" on Open Table. Nope. Unfortunately WE WERE THERE. The hostess took our name and pretended to look us up on their system. 

NEVER AGAIN.
author: J D.

description: Good service and selection at the bar, good desserts. Didn't try the rest of the menu, but the Bar experience for the drinks and dessert was good.Steven at the bar was good with service.
author: Sam A.

description: I was in San Francisco for the Nike Woman's 1/2 Marathon and stopped in here for a quick bite to eat.  I had the Capellini with Plum tomatoes, garlic, basil, and marinated fresh mozzarella.  I was really good and I loved how the mozzarella added flavor and texture to the dish.   The service was great and very accommodating.  The food came out fast and the atmosphere was relaxing.  It's a nice stop in for a comforting little meal.
author: JoAnne F.

description:
The food is very good actually and that's why we tried this restaurant for the second time.
But the servers don't seem to be happy. They do their job, but when you are paying $200 for a table for two, you expect friendlier and more energetic manners. Also they charged us $14 for a double vodka bloody mary in the first time, but only three weeks later we ended up paying $22 for each, which does not make any sense at all!!!
author: Aidin T.

description: We came here on a Groupon for our first anniversary. It was amazing. The service was excellent (Nicolette was the BEST) and the food was served quickly.  I had the NY steak done perfectly to mid rare and she had the risotto with a shrimp in every bite. Highly recommend, we would be regulars if we lived here.
author: Dan W.

description: Really nice service and the food was awesome! The value for money was perfect as well!
author: Lisa B.

description: Food was fresh and flavored. Location: very easy to be accessed just 2 or 3 blocks from BART/MUNI station Restaurant located in at the AbRi hotel but you cannot tell... Service (Kyle - manager and Stephen - waiter) very professional and friendly.  Had a nice time...
author: Cicero B.

description:
Horrible experience, assistant manager was rude and hostile , my salmon was raw. We will never be back. 
I manager did try to make it right, however the asst. manager needs to go,
author: Alicia C.

description: convenient location, nice atmosphere, good food. standard italian american style. kale salad is delicious.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Came here for breakfast.  Basically empty, it wasn't anything special.  Wanted to give it 4 stars but the chicken apple sausage I had was burnt into charcoal bits.  It's basically regular american breakfasts but other than that nothing special.  

Service was great, got us in and out quickly. Very attentitive.
author: Toby I.

description: Great location! We made reservations on OpenTable.  We did arrive 30 minutes early but they got us right in.  The only downside was that they erased our reservation which affected our app.  Not completely sure why they had to do that. The place looks nice enough but the smell inside was less than desirable.  We were seated at a window and the smell was almost like one of the homeless folk had been sitting in the window.  I don't mean that to sound insensitive but there is no other way to describe that smell.  We ordered a simple enough meal.  My husband and I were both craving spaghetti with meatballs.  My husband got a salad.  All was very tasty and filling.  We each ordered a glass of wine.  The bill came to $100 (before tip).  Again the food was very good...but $25/plate for spaghetti?  $11 for a salad and $14/glass of wine. For as good as the food was I don't think it was worth that price no matter city you are in.
author: Amy C.

description:
Terrific meal!  Ordered spaghetti and meatballs - Split the order with my wife and it was just the right amount.

Service from Angel was excellent!
author: Thomas P.

description: Nice place, pretty good meals. I enjoyed Italian ;) there are a line out there sometimes.
author: Lisa S.

description: Ambience is great, situated on the street corner. We were able to get right in, table at 7:00. Old school drink menu was fabulous, wide variety of classic cocktails. Portions were large, service was great. Special of shell and pesto with lamb meatballs was delicious. Would recommend to others for classic Italian.
author: Derek F.

description: Well...I ordered take out - .. which I hate to do because I feel like your food is not made with the same love as it is when you dine in... I ordered the mussels and the spaghetti and meat balls. My mussels were great but the majority of them were empty BIG disappointment :-( The meat balls and sauce were good, but not enough for the spaghetti so that was upsetting it was really dry.. Oh well guess I should have asked for extra sauce..
author: Frenchie B.

description: Good Italian in SF is hard to come by and from the best I sampled, this would be up there. The service was a bit defensive, commenting on the yelp reviews which was slightly off putting; the service was quick however. The atmosphere seems a bit to casual/dinnery for the price of the dishes. I had short rib and pasta w/meatballs and it was delicious, slightly overpriced but not underwhelming. A good go if your craving Italian. Also has good desserts and appetizers.
author: Matt E.

description: Puccini was our back-up plan on Valentine's Day because we could not get through the crowd at The Cheesecake Factory. We were immediately seated when we got there by a friendly host which really turned my evening around. After the frustration with the last restaurant, it was nice to find an open table elsewhere with great service! The server was also nice and quick. She gave us recommendations and we ended up ordering the Frutti de Mare and the Baked Crab Ravioli as our entrees. My pasta dish was good but it was not great. The seafood was fresh but the sauce was a bit bland for my liking. My bf's dish was good though! I did not finish my dish because I wanted to save room for dessert lol. It was Valentine's Day and dessert was a must! We ordered the Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee and it was delicious! Overall, we had a nice dinner here but the food needs some work. For the price that we paid, I believe the food should have tasted better!
author: Angel N.

description: I am a tourist and this place is great! Do not listen to cheapskates (locals). The steak w/ hollindase sauce was great! I am offended by the low reviews from locals who seem to not want to pay for good food. Service excellent. Enviroment is loud chatter yet it's all part of the ambiance. Definitely try this place.
author: Chris C.

description: I really like this place.  Their Margherita Pizza is super good.  My mom and I split that and a Cesar Salad for lunch and it was just the right amount of food.  It also came with bread and some super delish tapenade.   While the food is not cheap, the happy hour Cabernet wasn't bad at all, especially for $3!  All in all, the prices are quite in line for the location.
author: Jessica J.

description: The service was good enough but the food was very disappointing. I had the risotto with rock shrimp. The rock shrimp were just regular tiny shrimp that tasted like they had been microwaved. My wife had spaghetti with red sauce that tasted like they were straight out of the can. My kid had a pizza that was overloaded wit cheese. All that for over $120. STAY AWAY!!!
author: Milan S.

description:
The staff were very nice  BUT I did not like my food.  The Caesar salad had NO flavor and my linguini with clams was also tasteless.  I took it home and worked on it.  My friends calamari was good and she like her chicken marsala.

I would not go again.
author: Melanie P.

description: While there are numerous places to dine in San Francisco there are few places that seem reasonable and are solid for the price. When I stay in Union Square I usually dine here and it has been very consistent. It's worthwhile if you are in the area. The seafood is good and the Italian food is pretty good as well.
author: John D.

description:
Came here on Saturday night, and thank goodness we had reservations bc the restaurant was probably 100% full (not overly crowded, though...just no empty tables).  Though the vibe here is relaxed and casual, there were tons of people dressed up, as well.

Our server, Kirk, was extremely friendly and attentive.  He offered suggestions for his favorite dishes and even helped us when we were going back and forth between options.  What I also liked was that I didn't have to flag someone down once to clear our table or refill our drinks--the servers were on it. 

We couldn't decide on our appetizer so we ended up ordering half portions of carpaccio and mussels.  I have to admit, I loved these 2 dishes more than my entree!  This was my first time having carpaccio; so for those of you who do not know what it is, it's basically thin and raw beef, mixed with parmesan cheese and arugula...Mmmm!!  I was really craving salami and they didn't have that on the menu...this was a great alternative!!  As for the mussels...they were the best tasting mussels I have ever tried in my life--plump and juicy goodness!!  

My entree was a half portion of spaghetti and meatballs.  The noodles were a little too al dente for my liking.  The sauce, however, was light, flavor and tasty.  My boyfriend had the prime rib cooked medium rare.  He said it was good but some parts of it were cooked more medium than rare.  

Overall, I'd definitely come back...perhaps, to try out the happy hour that many of the previous Yelpers rave about!
author: Lisa Marie R.

description: Very bad quality and service. We ordered kids pasta for two, one come with regular portion but wrong source, and another one come very tiny portion!!! I asked service to see the difference of portion. He said he gonna add some more! But what he did is he take the wrong source plate one back and wash away the source and give it back to us!!!! We can tell coz the paste is extremely white, very soft!!! I can't believed it. Don't never ever go this restaurant!!!
author: Audrey K.

description:
Wish I could give this 3.5.  It was solid, but didn't wow.  Would definitely return if I'm staying in Union Sq again.  

The bruschetta stole the show.  Amazing.  

Good wine list though they were out of my first two choices (blame it on Dreamforce week).  

Had the penne arrabiatta which again was solid but I would probably try something different on a return trip.
author: Jay E.

description: Extremely poor service from the management. They advertise "Happy Hour" on the doors and menus. When the bill showed up it was at the menu rate. I asked about it and the manager said his policy is that it only applied to the bar. He showed me a menu that said nothing about it but then sayed it was his policy regardless. Pick a different restaurant.
author: Alfred D.

description:
Outstanding Frutti di Mare pared with a nice Sauvignon Blanc from Cakebread Cellars.  Thank you Evyn for the recommendation and great service. 

I will definitely be back on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: From T.

description:
I was in town for a work meeting & went here with some co-workers for dinner. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. We had 6 pm dinner reservations and were in and out within an hour! Surprising considering the other comments about slow service. 

People in my group had the Chicken Marsala, the short ribs, Fruti di Mare; I ordered the Grilled Salmon and a house salad. Though my salmon had great flavor, it was a little overly salted for my taste. The salad, also had great flavor, but just a touch too much dressing (I like very light dressing) The rest of the group devoured their food and gave it a thumbs up.  Go in hungry because portions are pretty large!

For me the real star of the night was the dessert. I ordered the pumpkin cheesecake to share; others ordered the sorbet trio and dark chocolate bread pudding. Though all desserts were good, the cheesecake was fantastic! Light, creamy, great pumpkin flavor topped with fresh whipped cream and roasted slivered almonds. It was the table's favorite! I'd probably come back just for that one night!

Oh, one more tip...Monday is Happy Hour at the bar ALL DAY LONG!
author: Ixiim F.

description:
One of the best Happy hour spot to grab drinks and taste delicious appetizers  in SF downtown!!  

- HH **3PM-Close**  Sun-Tue. Wish it was all days of week!!

- Go early to grab a place at the bar as it gets crowded after office hours.

- Drinks are ridiculous cheap,  wines for $3, Anchor steam on draft $4!! Options on the HH drinks menu is impressive with mix of wines, beer and cocktails. Well, for a change NOT just limited to well and beer unlike other places!!

- Great appetizers at $5-$7!!! 
Best of the lot :  fritto misto - light battered calamari served with delicious tomato aioli, crab cakes, bruchetta, Sausage/fennel pizza, meatballs. Try them ALL!!

Great affordable rates for drinks and nibbles.
Our tab came to just $26 for 2 wines, 3 beer, 1 appetizer... I love this place!
author: Payal B.

description:
I came here once before and had a decent time with an old friend.  Came back here the night before Nike Women's Half Marathon 2012.  My reservation was at 8:30, because that was the earliest that they had an opening.  I called the day of the reservation and asked if she could give us a call if they could fit us in earlier.  I was told by the hostess that their "policy doesn't work like that."  Fair enough...well, imagine my dismay and irritation when we walk in at 8:30 expecting a full restaurant and saw at least 3 tables that could had seat five open in a half empty restaurant.  Our experience only went downhill from there.

Atmosphere: 
 The reason I keep choosing this restaurant is because I really like its atmosphere.  It's dimly lit with cozy booths and tables.  

Service:  
I waited tables for 11 years of my life and can confirm that our waiter was a jerk.  Things he did I thought were rude:  Upon asking if we could have 3 separate checks, he answered "If I'm not too busy."  Seriously, guy?  Either yes or no would have been sufficed.  While taking our order he cut one of our friends off in the middle of an order, and just walked away.  We had to hunt him down to give the rest of her order.  We got the wrong salad.  No apologies were made.  Gratuity was put on a party of 5.  Perhaps because he usually gets crappy tips because he's a crappy waiter?  

Food:  
Complimentary focaccia bread with olive tapenade: Good, but the bread was cold and slightly stale.

Chicken Marsala:  Our friend seemed to like it.

Lasagna with sausage:  A carnivorous male actually said there was way too much meat in the lasagna.  Where he was tired of tasting just meat.

Fig pizza without bacon:  Our friend enjoyed it.

Beet Salad:  Very very good, with golden and red beets.

Margherita Pizza:  Maybe we're spoiled with the pizza we usually get, but the dough was like cardboard.  Charred cardboard.  Bf stated it tasted worse than frozen grocery store pizza.  The cheese just tasted like bland goop.  There were about 3 ribbons of basil on the pizza.  It was like a cheap $5 frozen cheese pizza.  Ew.

Risotto:  It was supposed to be butternut squash, pureed cauliflower, and arugula.  It tasted like under cooked rice a roni with hard bits of squash.  It was gross.

Overall:  I was displeased with the bad service we got here, and most of the food was so poor in quality, taste, and preparation that I can't justify ever coming back.  I am only embarrassed that I recommended this restaurant to my bf and friends.  Save your money and go elsewhere.  Then tell me where I can find some decent Italian next time I'm in town.
author: Matty K.

description: Came here for a bday dinner for my second mom and this restaurant is fabulous. A few people in the group are gluten free and not only was our server Amanda McCoy well informed but so were the other staff. The meal, the wine, the apps, and the bday dessert was incredible. Wonderful food and even better staff. Next time we are in sf we will definitely be back here!!!
author: Marissa B.

description:
4-stars for the happy hour value.
3.5-stars for the quality of the food.
3-stars for service.

As the overall rating of this restaurant indicates, it is really more of a 3.5-star place but I'll be nice and round up since nothing except the service was "mediocre" or below.  The server wasn't bad, just not as attentive as I'd like.

First of all, $3 beer, wine, and champagne?  Nice.  The happy hour drinks special ends at 6pm, but not the food specials.  Those are good too.  It makes for the perfect sampling of quite a variety of dishes...ribs, ravioli, bruchetta, meatballs, turkey sausage, salads, etc...those are all good.  The meatballs were so good we ordered 2 and I could've honestly eaten another by myself, had I the room.
author: Dylan T.

description:
I wanted to experience Italian food, i.e. not only eat Italian food but also feel like the Godfather could walk in any minute. As soon as I entered, it was obvious the latter was not going to happen. The place is a nondescript bar that happens to serve Italian food. If you're looking for ambiance, not so much.

I sat at the bar, and ordered the spaghetti meatballs and the chicken Marsala, both highly recommended by other Yelp members. I was served promptly by a very courteous bartender.

The spaghetti came with 3 humongous meatballs that caused my neighbors to giggle, so I pointed out to them there was one too many to really be funny. The pasta was perfectly cooked, al dente, with a great tomato sauce. I was not as impressed with the meatballs unfortunately. Very dense, and quite tasteless. Not bad at all, just no taste. Maybe too much fat.

The Marsala was also really good. The chicken was moist, the sauce was rich and flavorful. But the mashed potato that came with it was blend. I would still recommend it but maybe switch the mashed potato for a side of pasta.
author: David A.

description: Very good service the staff for my visit was incredibly friendly.  The food was pretty good but say for the price. I had spaghetti and meatballs and I would definitely split which I did and there plenty. The Kids menu could use a little work. In the end I would not hesitate in going back.
author: Mark B.

description:
Food is good but not worth the price. 

I was glad to have been seated far earlier than our reservation time after arriving early. The service was pretty good aside from the bar: we had a bartender while waiting for our table that was a little huffy and not keen on giving recommendations- she seemed preoccupied. 

The atmosphere is family-friendly but did make for a loud dinner setting.

Restrooms are not in the restaurant. Seems like a silly complaint, but the restrooms are located in the hotel it is connected to- I almost got lost on my way back to the table.
author: Lauren A.

description: Such a great little spot! Happy hour every day is a plus as well as the great bar menu.  The crowds during the week definitely confirm the power of a good happy hour menu.
author: Katherine E.

description:
I have no clue how this place has even a decent rating. 

Yes the service was satisfactory. No there wasn't hair in my food. BUT there was absolutely nothing special about this place. The food was over priced for what you got and under performing in taste. I added chicken to my pasta for $5 and it came out questionably undercooked. 

Stayed across the street at Parc 55, would have been worth walking farther...
author: Katie K.

description:
A-OK (just like the 3 stars says). 

Pretty decent Itallian food, I'v eaten here several times over the last 8 years or so (it is one of my friend's favorites) and I've never had anything bad. Maybe a bit overpriced, but it is in the Union Spuare area and I guess that just goes with the territory.

The place is nicely decorated and clean (as far as I can see), and the serivce is always friendly. The food can be a little slow to come out if they are busy, but that is to be expected in any eatery. You could definately do worse if you are in the Market shoping district and looking for food. Also, it is a pretty large space and great for big groups (we are usually there for birthday parties)
author: Jill P.

description: I was in town for the ALA conference, and so my roommate and I were trying to find good Italian food near our Union Square hotel. This is within easy walking distance of a bunch of places. The concierge recommended this place, and we were not disappointed. The portion sizes are worth the prices, which is not always true. I had the Seasonal Greens salad and the goat cheese ravioli, which were both very tasty. Plus, they have an excellent drinks menu, and I finally managed to try a Negroni. Service is great, atmosphere was busy but not loud, even on the Saturday night during ALA and before pride. Definitely recommend and would return if I'm in the area.
author: Emma M.

description:
Bad service, food was just ok. I'd say 2.5 stars. Total tourist spot.

The server was good at first but disappeared at the end. Took forever to refill soda and bring the bill.

Minestrone soup was watered down and just had some veggies in it, but no beans. The portion was kind of small too. Definitely not worth $7.

Risotto was too salty and the peas were undercooked but the arugula was good.

Spaghetti and meatballs had lots of meat but lacked taste. This was probably the best dish we had tho.

Overall, it's okay if you're craving Italian, but I'm sure you can find better elsewhere for the same price.
author: Sharon W.

description:
I attended a concert at the Warfield tonight, and came here for dinner. The odd thing was I could make a reservation for 4:45 or 9pm - nothing in between. We arrived at 6pm with no reservation and we were seated within about four minutes. Oh well. I don't understand reservations I guess. Arrived at Morton's ten minutes early for our reservation once and we were asked to wait in the bar. There were only two tables sat in the entire restaurant and no others waiting. But I digress.

Our waitress Veronika was terrific right out of the gate - asked if we'd been there before, explained some things on the menu, the specials, etc, then left us to our devices for a bit, after taking our drink orders (I started with a nice glass of Pinot Noir - quite good - but then I changed gears to a Pinot Grigio, which I prefer with seafood). My Mom had the Frutti di Mare, and I ordered the linguine with clams. Both were passable. Maybe it's just me, but I like a more garlic-y flavor. I'd say that's what was missing - just more flavorful and robust. But again, that might be just me.

Veronika had dessert to us quite quickly (tiiramisu - very good) along with some very good, coffee. I found it to priced well for SF - the Fritti was $23, if memory serves, and the linguine $20. If not for the flavor issue, it'd be top notch.

Bottom line - pretty good food, excellent service (ask for Veronika), and not terribly priced. I'd try them again - but I'll probably try another entree.
author: Otto C.

description: On our final night in San Francisco the boys and I wanted to go out for a nice dinner to celebrate. After searching and searching we decided on Puccini & Pinetti because it was just across the street from the Parc 55 Wyndham hotel where we were staying. We were seated right away and had a very enthusiastic male waiter. Because we were a group of three guys, the waiter immediately started pushing the restaurants' beer selection. I'm sure it was no coincidence that the beers he was suggesting were the most expensive on tap. I guess we fell for it because we went with his suggestions and not one of us liked the flavors. We knew that Puccini & Pinetti was a more upscale place, this is why we chose it, but honestly $9 for a bowl of olives?! What are you, nuts!? I settled on the cannelloni that featured house made sausage, ricotta, corn, basil, tomato & sweet peppers, pomodoro, mozzarella, and grana padano. It was just fine, nothing special, not memorable at all. My friends felt the same about the meals they ordered. We quickly finished up and were happy to get out of there. In the end, Puccini & Pinetti is HIGHLY overpriced for food that is just average at best.
author: Matt P.

description: We had a very great lunch here...on the way to our hotel, and no lunch on the flight...we decided to come back after we checked in and dropped our bags. They were very busy and found a table in the bar.  Had a fantastic server and great lunch....I had the 3 course lunch and the Marsala was really great...loved the overall quality of the food and service, will come back if we get back to SF.
author: Lynda G.

description: This restaurant gets 5 stars because of the combination of good food, friendly staff, reasonable prices, and convenient location. Perfect intro to Italian cuisine for your square-ass relatives from out of of town. Also if you wander West a little they'll get a little "culture" aperitif.
author: Joseph T.

description: This place is awesome!! Such a fun little spot and GREAT food. We ordered the bruschetta and calamari as per usual. Our servers were Johnny and Amanda, they were so friendly and quick even though the place was packed! Another great experience here.
author: Sophia A.

description:
This place is just ok - it's nothing amazing and it's not "bad" it's just ok.
The server seemed overwhelmed; she messed up on one of the orders in our party and she also got my drink refill incorrent and then left it on the bill. I do credit her for recognizing it when we waved her over and took care of it quickly and apologized. I realized when we arrived here to meet friends that I had actualy been here previously but didn't remember based on the name and location until we walked up - this is telling of how the place was on this visit as well "unmemorable" would be the best way to describe it.
author: Kelly M.

description: Stopped in for dessert after circling the area looking for something sweet...settled on the truffle cake- cooked to order, nice server in the bar area, and worth the wait.  Smelled great and has a variety of dishes and desserts.
author: Holland G.

description:
Surprisingly mediocre.

My husband and I came here for our wedding anniversary last week. He being Italian and me growing up on Italian food, we have a lot of experience with this cuisine! We rarely have mediocre Italian food when we are out - which is a lot because I rarely cook.....so we were disappointed to discover that this somewhat upper scale restaurant was just "meh". 

We ordered the antipasto appetizer platter which featured some provolone cheese and assorted sliced meats such as prosciutto and salame. It came with slices of plain, toasted bread and olives. Nothing special about the platter, it's about as Italian as it gets. But I didn't come to a restaurant for what I routinely could put together at home. It would have been nice if they had included some seasoned bread or some kind of special spread..anything to show some effort or make it worth how expensive that plate was.

My husband ordered the spaghetti and meatballs with steak. While the spaghetti was cooked correctly, I was not impressed with the sauce, flavor, and the tough steak. As another Yelper stated, the food is on the bland side. Meatballs were gigantic but flavor didn't really stand out either. The consistency of the meat sauce was just "chunky"... and I mean extremely chunky. Alright I guess but with the steak and the meatballs and the chunky spaghetti sauce (consistency of thick chili) not much of it was able to co-mingle with the spaghetti (cuz it fell right off).

I had the lasagna. It was probably the worst lasagna I've ever had. The proportion was humongous (it better be for $25!), it was cut out of a pan in almost a perfect square which is unusual for lasagna! Why? because it SHOULD be cheesy, and saucy, and slightly sloppy with cheese oozing out from all over the sides. I couldn't believe how dry it was. There was barely any sauce, barely any cheese...just 20+ layers of dry lasagna noodle sitting in a perfect square on my plate. I only had a few bites before I begged my husband for some of his spaghetti sauce. It was a shame because again, the lasagna noodle was cooked perfectly (al dente!) but it was bland and plain.

Perhaps the one thing that I would come here for is the excellent bruschetta and spread that came with our meal. It was RIDICULOUSLY good and tasty. But our server never offered to bring us more. The lasagna, spaghetti, and appetizer cost over $70. Rightfully so, I expected much more for paying $25 a plate. While there, I made a comment to my husband about how the ingredients didn't taste fresh and possibly were frozen as another Yelper also noticed. Perhaps the one thing that saves this restaurant is their happy hour which most people seem to rave about.
author: Carol A.

description: Enjoyed a lovely dinner before going to the theater.  Service was very good.  We tried a variety of appetizers, entree's, desserts, and everyone loved their meals.  Serving sizes were quite large. We were able to get in and out in plenty of time, no rushing.
author: Karen R.

description: I understand this is San Francisco, but this restaurant is overpriced for mediocre food.
author: Garry N.
