description: We always seem to end up here, when hanging out in Union Square, great bar drinks, the Acai Martini is delicious.  Always crowded, the bar area is fun, with street views if you like to people watch.  My dinner here has always been good.
author: Winny S.

description:
Just stand with the mojito, oyster and a charcuterie plate and that was delicious. The grilled bread is excellent and the final dessert : trufle cake is melting my heart !

The whole pace is very lively, clear but cosy ! Next time i ll try the pasta :)
author: Fred T.

description: Please do not go to this restaurant. The bread is stale, the salads are drenched in dressing (not In a good way), their meals are generic and lukewarm, and the pasta is not al dente nor does it have any interesting flavor components. Lastly for what you are receiving, it is very over priced and not worth the money.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
The happy hour is out of this world.

Such quality food for GREAT prices and decent enough deals on drinks. I've only been here for HH but been here about 5 times and it's always such a win. 

Definitely get the mini pizzas and the bruschetta. UFA forever (I hope some of you are on yelp)!!!
author: Raina B.

description: We needed to find a restaurant within a short walk from our hotel in Union Square and I was craving Italian. The lunch menu does not have many traditional Italian options.... Very few pastas, there are more salads and sandwiches. I ended up getting a "grilled cheese with prosciutto" which was more like a toasted (not pressed) panini. My dining partner got the margherita pizza and it was good. It certainly did not satisfy my craving for Italian.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Stopped here one night after an event across the street to grab dinner before heading home. The service was good, all I ordered was a pizza and drink so I was pretty easy to take care of and please. It was a bit pricey for what it was, but I didn't really take a look at the rest of the menu.
author: Candace R.

description:
Been to Puccini & Pinetti a couple of times for dinner after a visit to Union Square. So many places in Union Square, but P&P always is reliable and fun.  Calamari Fritto, Warm Spinach Salad, Pappardelle are favorites. Orecchiette comes in at a close 2nd to Pappardelle I do wish they could figure out how to add just a bit of MEAT in the Orecchiette, but it is tasty as a VEGAN dish, and a hint of meat would incite the vegan crowd !  The Short Ribs make up for the lack of meat in the Orecchiette. While not boasting an extensive menu, all is good. 

Always have found the service to be attentive and competent.

Like sitting near the front windows, makes for good "watching the world go by" (1st , 2nd and 3rd world - "variety is the spice of life" oh yah, but there are some spices that one hopes to never taste.).

Anyhoooo, its a friendly, fun, reliable place to grab a bite.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Across the street from the Parc 55 on a rainy day and after a 5 hour drive up the coast, this place called to us.

Salads were good, especially the caesar's.  The dressing was perfect.  My weakness is always the bread and olive oil at Italian restaurants and P&P did not let me down.  I ordered the pasta with cream sauce, which was more than a generous portion and above average in flavor, taste and firmness of the noodles.  

It was a nice restaurant but not stuffy at all and very family friendly.  Big cities always seem to weed out the bad places and I am sure this one will be around for a while.
author: Ken O.

description: Terrible service. Kept signalling to them to take my order, but they were just busy clearing plates at other tables and serving mojitos to other patrons. Weird given this was off peak at 230 on a sat afternoon.
author: Po M.

description:
I'm going for it and giving P&P the full 5 Stars because our overall experience was FANTASTIC. Our server made all the difference, and it's because of her that I give them my full recommendation. We went here for my wife's birthday (she is Sicilian, so does not suffer poor Italian...) and had one of the best meals we've had in SF in a very long time. The food was great, the ambiance was nice, and the service kicked it.

Pros:
- OUTSTANDING service; fast, friendly, efficient, accurate, accommodating. Wow
- The menu is diverse and interesting -- not too fancy, yet very authentic
- Very nice drinks menu; the Cab I had and the Chard my wife had were both great
- Value: very good; this is NOT a $40 entree restaurant
- Kid Friendly: our two daughters enjoyed their entrees and were "part of the meal"

Cons:
- None, really. The decor is more casual than "5-star" but it was very comfy for us

In truth, I had originally planned to go to Kuleto's, our long time favorite. Not to take away from Kuleto's, but with our kids and wanting to be casual, P&P blew them away. I'll be hard pressed not to choose P&P the next time I'm going for dinner off Union Square.

Highly recommend you give them a try if you are looking for dinner in the area.

Special bonus: since we booked with OpenTable, they gave us a complimentary bruschetta, which, amazingly, was THE best thing on the table. (I've never said that about a bruschetta. Holy moly those were some good tomatoes....)
author: Rick M.

description:
I'm a local and I come here a lot.

Delicious food for an okay price. If you like seafood you will like the Linguini and clams or Frutti de Mare (not sure if that's the right spelling). They also have a great bar and a good wine selection. Service is fast. 

The atmosphere here is casual fun high energy and noisy. If you are looking to propose to someone you can come during lunch when its quieter.
author: K C.

description: I got info about the restaurant from someone who currently works here, and they told me everything that happens. if you complain about the food the servers mess with it or even if you ask them to box it for you, they will eat out of it, lick things, its horrible, the manager EJ knows about it and doesn't do anything. If you tip them 15% they complain. DONT EAT HERE theres a chance your food will be messed with, every manger that you see on the floor are unexperienced. Just have a drink if you do go. Most of the people here should be fired.
author: Edward N.

description: Being married to an Italian, my Italian food standards have gotten quite high. However, we were completely blown away by Puccini & Pinetti! Felt like a New York style Italian joint. Bustling and a little noisy, but a lively atmosphere with great service. I am extremely gluten sensitive and our waiter was very kind to help me find gluten-free options (they even have a gluten-free menu!). I ordered the mussels as an appetizer and the salmon for an entree and was extremely pleased. The mussels were cooked in a white wine butter sauce that was the perfect amount of salty and brothy. It included spinach, garlic, and roasted red peppers as well. The salmon was cooked perfectly and included a delicious aioli on top. My husband went all-in and ordered the margarita pizza to start and the dinner special - fettuccine carbonara - for his entree. The pizza, as he tells me, was perfectly crispy and thin with a great ratio of cheese to sauce. His fettuccine was also extremely flavorful and decadent. All the food was paired with delicious California wines. A fantastic experience all around!
author: Kelly T.

description: We've been twice and will be going again. There's a nice variety of delicious dishes (sunday brunch menu is great), and the service was equally pleasant.
author: Olivier L.

description: I was at a conference nearby and it was raining pretty hard so we decided not to venture out too far.  We arrived at that awkward dead time before lunch really got started so it took a while to place our order and get bread.  They have really great focaccia!  I had the lunch combo that included salad, pannini and tiramisu.  All dishes were tasty.  My only complaint was slow service and then after our meal we were rushed out because people were "waiting."
author: Chris K.

description: Fast service and kid friendly but food was not good and overpriced. My chicken was dry and rubbery for $25! Service was marginal at best. Would not recommend.
author: Amy S.

description:
My first impression was that it was very loud.  I was there with my wife on a Tuesday evening around 8pm.  It was so loud that we had to lean in to hear each other and talk in a bar-volume voice.

My second impression was that it took 20 minutes from the time we sat down to the first course- a small house salad, which my wife said was 4 out of 5.

My third impression was the spaghetti and meatballs I ordered, which I rate as a 3.5 out of 5.  Her salmon was a 3 out of 5.  She said it was nothing special at $27.

We had never been to this place.  Yelp said it was a $$ restaurant.  I would say a $$$ was closer to the mark.  It was  $22 for spaghetti and meatballs- which were average at an above average price.

I don't think I'll go back.
author: robert l.

description:
Food was good, not great. Waiter was awesome, although my friends seem to think it was because he was trying to hit on me. My Jack & gingerale was delicious and on the strong side. 
But the food seemed over-priced. That's what I get for eating in Union Square.
author: Alissa M.

description: Good prices during Happy hour, though the $3 house red wines could be of better quality. The margherita pizza was good, and the service was prompt.
author: Naren V.

description:
Came here just for happy hour where we met up with friends after MacWorld.  Had great appetizers that tasted good but weren't really filling.  You definitely have to try the bruchetta...It's fantastic.  The oysters are cheap and flavorful but really small.  Meatballs are worth a try too. Beer is relatively inexpensive for SF.

Can't really comment on dinner.  But its worth a visit, just get there early as the crowds grow rapidly.
author: Jeff G.

description: Disapponting...unattentive service while the host drinks coffee and is yawning...management is clearly not paying attention to customer service.  Will spend my $$ elsewhere.  And then we have to chase the waiter to get our change..ridiculous!!
author: Lorene B.

description: Just your standard over-priced San Francisco tourist trap restaurant. Only came here because my aunt was staying in the hotel (The Abri) next door.  The menu is extremely minimalistic so don't expect any variety. I had the spaghetti and meatballs which was way too salty.  My mom had the pork chop and agreed with the excessive salt in her dish. Not a lot of need for much more description for the other dishes.  This is not a good meal nor a decent representation of San Francisco cuisine. Go around the corner and get a slice of Blondie's pizza. You'll be better off.
author: Felipe E.

description:
I had a friend come into SF who has just been diagnosed as gluten sensitive.  It's really important during this time that she is especially cautious not to eat any gluten to ensure that this is really what has been ailing her for so long.

Anyhow - after searching for some food options for us to choose from, we decided on this Italian joint.  I was worried that being so close to Union Square that it might be kinda blah - but it was soo good.

Our waiter was adorable - I am sure that had something to do with how much we loved our experience.  He helped us chose a bottle of wine to split and made some great and delicious recommendations.  My friend had the risotto and I had the most amazing veggie lasagna. 

I really enjoyed the food and the service and I definitely recommend this place!
author: Autumn B.

description: Overall a great dinner experience. We were seated quickly and the waiter was there to provide water and take drink orders.  The waiter lacked some personality, but was attentive and on top of things which was good. My salmon was delicious - didn't need the mayo-based sauce because it was so flavorful. Better half's steak was perfectly done with a tasty herb butter and outstanding truffle fries. The atmosphere was casual and a bit loud, but not unexpected for a busy Saturday night. Will return next time we're in town.
author: Michael B.

description:
I heard the happy hour here was decent, so I decided to check it out with my family. It was actually pretty good considering the price.

We ordered several things from the happy hour menu:
- Charcuterie with coppa, finocchiona, soppresseta and proscuitto, $7
- Mussels with fries, $8
- Meatballs in Bolognese sauce, $5
- Fritto Misto, included both fried calamari and shrimp, served with tomato aioli, $6
- House red wine, $3/glass (What a deal!)
- Anchor Steam on draft, $4/pint

As usual, we were first served free focaccia bread and tapenade. It was savory and delicious, plus a great compliment to my glass of red wine. Although the fritto misto and meatballs were forgettable, I really enjoyed the mussels with fries. The mussels were small, but tender and very tasty, steamed in a white wine sauce and topped with tomatoes and capers. The fries were crispy, too. The charcuterie meats were all good, too, but good thing I asked our waiter if we could get some grilled bread to eat with it. There was no accompaniment with the meats (i.e. no fruits, nuts, breads, jam, etc.).

As for the service, our waiter, Kevin, was welcoming and friendly. He stopped by often to get more drink orders or to check on our status. We were in the bar area and I thought his attentiveness was great considering we weren't in the main dining area.

4 stars.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
We are Passport members and make an effort to try a new restaurant in SF each time we visit. This time we tried Puccini & Pinetti and were NOT disappointed, the food and ambiance was great. We were seated at the Chef's counter and I would HIGHLY recommend a couple to sit there! The counter overlooks the Chef's preparing each meal, and perfecting the appearance of each plate. I was sweating just watching them prepare the food... what a great experience though!

Appetizer: we had the Bruschetta which was AMAZING and highly recommend ordering. I have no idea how they get the tomatoes to taste so good, but heavenly!

Entree 1: Chicken Marsala- The BEST entree on the menu, a MUST try! I read previous reviews and everyone said to try it and I was not disappointed ordering it. The chicken was perfectly moist, served over sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes. YUMMY!

Entree 2: Lasagna- It is vegetarian, as that was their only option for Lasagna. It was tasty, but not something we would recommend ordering. 

Overall we enjoyed our meal and would come back again. Great service, management (she even came to check in), great food, and overall a wonderful evening.
author: Tara C.

description: Went as a big group so our order took a while and of course pasta dish didn't seem to be freshly boiled and made. I'm not sure if it's just me but I can tell when pasta is previously cooked and warmed up and mixed with sauce when order comes in. That's how I felt. Looting really was remarkably good but I enjoyed the company.
author: Live Love Laugh D.

description: Went here to meet up with someone for lunch. I had my 2 kids with me. The service was poor. It seemed like they only had one waiter for the whole restaurant.   I ordered the Margarita pizza. It didn't have any flavor. The girls enjoyed their mac n cheese and cheese pizza.
author: Laurie H.

description: A great place to drop by while you're near Union Square, either for happy hour or for dinner. Went with my family and we all had a great time. Their lasagna was perfectly al dente! Make sure not to miss their seasonal pumpkin cheesecake in the fall either.
author: Angela C.

description:
One of the best Italian restaurants in San Fran.
Try the chicken marsala and the risotto just perfect!!
author: Dania A.

description: Enjoyed a late night dinner there after a day of travel. The service and food was great and was right across from the hotel we were staying at. Would return for sure!
author: Jamie O.

description:
BAD: (not their fault) Open at 7:30 even though the schedule says 8 - I ended up there for a breakfast meeting from hell - my meeting showed up late, was on the phone all the time and then told me she had to leave  - without even sitting down. 

BAD: I had ordered a cappuccino - what arrived looked more like a mug with "pretend-coffee" made out of mud and water by kids in the sand box. The dish-washing foam also tasted sour.

THE GREAT: The server immediately replaced the "cappuccino" with standard American coffee and when he saw that my meeting disappeared through the exit - he said "don't worry about the coffee. He may not even be a "waiter" - just a humble server, but he knows marketing. I will be back - despite the sometimes so-so reviews for the Italian food.
author: Flo B.

description: Ceasar salad- terrible. Meatball trio- meh, bruschetta- good. Service: poor management leads to poor performance.  Will I come back...NO
author: Cathy B.

description: Phenomenal food. Homemade ravioli was to die for. Bruschetta was perfect. Setting is casual/elegant and a tad noisy. Great food. Great location
author: Christa H.

description: Food was just okay, but prices were hiiiiiiigh in comparison.  We had the Frutti di Mare, Chicken Marsala, and a sausage pasta dish.  None of us were that impressed with our dishes, although the food did come out fast.  For dessert, we got the truffle cake, which was by far the highlight of the night.  Probably won't return unless it's solely for the cake.
author: Hali A.

description: Great place, great service.  The special not so great, had the spinach gnocchi and it didn't have much flavor and was dry.  Was wishing I would have ordered something else.  Salads and pastas that others had looked great and they said they were wonderful.  The happy hour before our dinner reservation was wonderful, loved their appetizers and great drink prices!  They make a really delicious cosmo!
author: Linda G.

description:
We just dinned her last Sunday evening.  My fiance and I went with another couple from new york.  I want to point out first that I dinned from the Gluten free menu. Delish!  I loved every bite of my meal.  The quality is good, the cheese was fresh and the bread (that others ate) was warm and tasty.  

The waitress and hostess were attentive and flexible.  nice place to dine if you are in the city and want Italian.  i have been here before and they were packed.  this time that i went it was no wait!!  They have a full bar area and window seats.  

I will go back for an bite if i am in that area of the city again!
author: Heather F.

description:
This place was pretty good. We got to the place early but they won't seat you till your reservation time comes around.

We started out with the Margarita pizza, bruscetta, and Fritto Misto (calamari). The pizza was good (a little greasy for my tastes). Bruscetta was very different than how I've had it before but it was good. The cheese & tomatos were a spread along a thinly sliced baguette. Calamari was like all calamari (medium breaded)

My entire table go the Bolognese Lasagna which was fantastic. Very nice layers that stayed intact when cutting with a fork. Evenly distributed tastes (not too much pasta, ricotta cheese, or tomato) every thing fit into place.

If you are having a birthday party (with cake) beware, they charge a $2 cake fee PER PERSON.
author: Ryan R.

description:
When I was a student, I would think about places like this and figuratively press my nose against the proverbial glass separating me from the world inside.  Now, I'm all grad-u-m-educated and no longer forced to follow the draconian schedule of academia.  My schedule is now the ho-hum dull-drums of 9ish-to-5ish.  With exceptionally less pay.  I have to do something about that.

Today I met up with a friend who went to the same school.  We have this once-every-two-week event where we meet up for some opulent-to-us Happy Hour bites, and then we go try on shoes.  There's no harm in just trying them on.  And with shoes, it's ok to eat dinner first and not feel fat.  

I got here around 6pm after trying on a massive failure of a skirt at Forever 21.  From that experience, I learned that I am no-longer-21.  AT ALL.  Especially around the waist area.  The bar was starting to fill up.  There were still a few seats at the counter but the majority of the bar tables were filled with happy people imbibing inexpensive libations whilst the sky opened up the heavens and poured.  It was really loud.  REALLY LOUD.  I could hardly hear my friend.  But the ambiance was really hip and happy.  There was not a grumpy drunk among the crowd.  

My signature drink now is the Virgin Mary.  Yes.  No alcohol.  It's like spicy tomato soup, except cold and tart from the lime juice.  My tongue is salivating just thinking about this drink.  A Virgin Mary costs $3.75.  The bartender made it spicy, just the way I like it.  And there were 2 olives AND a pickled onion!  I love pickled things.  

We ordered the crab cakes, garlic fries, mussels w/fries, bruschetta and ceasar salad.  

The crab cakes looked and tasted like they had not changed since the last time I had them about 2 years ago.  Sized between a golf ball and a tennis ball, these crab cakes had a uniform consistency throughout.  This means there was no lump crab.  Too bad.  I make the best crab cakes.  

The garlic fries were a very decent sized portion.  About the same volume as "large" size fries at McDonalds.  There was some fresh garlic crushed on top.  It could have been more flavorful.  I read somewhere that these used to be garlic-parm-fries.  The parm would have been a much welcomed addition.  

Mussels w/fries was a paltry serving!  for $8, there were 8 mussels in a small soup bowl on top of a kid-serving of fries.  Not worth it.  The broth was decent but not drink-with-a-spoon fantastic.  The mussels at Nordstrom Bistro is much better.  

Bruschetta: the burrata was amazing.  Burrata is the new mozzarella now.  Everyone and their mom's uncle has burrata on the menu.  It was delicious here.  The reduced balsamic drizzle was much too sweet to be taken seriously.  It tasted like it belonged on top of ice cream.  And the stewed tomatoes are a major NO.  I will not order this again.

Ceasar salad: also a skimpy serving.  It was about a cup of romaine served on a bread plate.  It used to be much bigger.  How much can salad cost?  It's just lettuce.  And 4 croutons.  NO ANCHOVY FILET.  I feel cheated.  This was not worth ordering.

Next time I want to try the fritto misto.  And I really wish that they would bring back the fried mozzarella balls.  I love me some hot salty balls.  Please please please bring back the fried mozzarella balls.  

In conclusion: festive, jolly atmosphere.  Very loud so don't try to carry on a conversation.  Delicious Virgin Mary.  Food can be hit or miss.  Don't order the bruschetta, ceasar salad or mussels.
author: Christina C.

description: Prices have gone up. Pastas $25-28 entrees that and more. Pleasant place but food was so-so. Pappardelle was good sized portion but sauce was nothing special. Risotto was very hot and scallops in it were kinda boring. Better places in the area for similar prices
author: Paul D.

description:
Tired and hungry after trying to get off Market for 20 minutes we found this place. Now when I say this place made me so sad, I mean it. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and would you believe canned pasta sauce is better than what they served me and I was expecting something good because it was claimed that it was their signature dish. My boyfriend got the vegetarian lasagna and I've made lasagna only once in my life and it was better than this too! 
The waitress was very nice which I will give this place 2 stars for. I do hope some of their other dishes are good but I will never be coming back. I have a feeling a lot of their stuff is old and frozen because we ordered and the food came out shortly after.
author: Amanda M.

description: Might be the best Chicken Marsala I've ever had. Our waiter was also very attentive but in a way where he wasn't intrusive.  The minestrone and warm spinach salad were also great, overall a good restaurant to check out if you are in the area.  Great happy hour drink deals as well.
author: Chris C.

description:
Situated right across the street from my hotel near Union Square, I was really excited to visit Puccini & Pinetti for their amazing happy hour deals.

It was great that if you sat in the bar area, that you have the option of either the full dinner menu or the happy hour menu or both!  We opted for some tapas and went with the Happy Hour menu.  The $6 Long Island Iced Teas were great, and no shortage of alcohol in them either!  We shared a few appys - Margherita Pizza, Fritto Misto, Crab Cakes and of course, I had some oysters.  

I would recommend definitely getting the Fritto Misto (deep fried squid and rock shrimp).  It was lightly battered, perfectly cooked and the tomato aioli was delish!!!

The oysters were to die for... but then again, I could eat oysters for every meal, every day.  But take it from me, these ones were good.  Served simply with lemon and a spicy marinara.  Yum.

The crab cakes were tasty, nicely cooked and served with the same tomato aioli that the Fritto Misto was.  They were nice and crabby (for lack of a better word), with not too much breading.

I was not a huge fan of the pizza, it was quite simply but still tasty.  Next time, I would def get the sausage pizza.
author: Ashley S.

description:
If I could give zero star, I would!

One star minus - nasty food. Calamari, was over cooked With way too much oil left on the plate. Didn't taste like fresh seafood. Waitress recommended Polk chop to my girlfriend for entree. Unfortunately, it wasn't cook well. Have to return it for second cook. Ravioli was too light, just taste like broil, sauce was watery.

One star minus - waitress only came for four times for our party of 8 during the whole night. When ask for the detail of menu, negative attitude threw up on our faces. Unable to answer simple Question on the menu.

One star minus - slow service, waited more than 1 and half hour for entrees just for our table.

One star minus - when ask about the bill, waitress given wrongful answer and when bring up to manager, he still not admit the error and won't even correct it!

Surprisely, A restaurant with high feedbacks could provide such horrible and unacceptable services.

Be aware! Stay away from this place if you could!
author: Yoko W.

description: The linguine and clams was very small (I don't eat that much and didn't feel satisfied after eating it) and was quite expensive (for the amount of food). The meatballs with spaghetti my wife got was really good though.
author: Fabio M.

description:
Anyone that knows me knows that I love gnocchi.  I went to this restaurant in hopes I would find a great tasting gnocchi.

To my disappointment it was dry and tasteless.  I prefer the creamy kind.  three stars only because my friends got the spaghetti which was pretty good and the Bellini was great too.

Im sad to say that this restaurant is not the best italian food I have had around the bay...at least with the gnocchi anyways.
author: Michelle T.

description: After spending nearly $400, we were asked to move by the very snotty hostess.  No "I'm sorry" or "we'll comp you a drink". Just her saying they were running 40 minutes behind and needed the table.  Not my problem. I will NEVER come here again with this kind of amateur service.  It's too bad, because our waiter was great especially with my gluten free needs.
author: Kate W.

description:
If I had a choice, I would give this place a 3.5 star rating.

My friend and I came to have lunch here right as they opened and it was empty, at first. Then it seemed to get ridiculously busy right away. My friend was on a work call for a while so the servers did their best to make sure we were okay. 

When we finally ordered, the food didn't really seem presentable. It was not plated well and didn't look interesting or different. We both had a lasagna plate and it just looked sloppy. Plus the servers after a while seemed to rush us. I think it was because they looked short staffed. 

I have loved this place in the past and definitely will come again but wasn't as impressed this time around.
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Was in San Francisco for work and stopped in on a whim for dinner since it was located between my hotel and shopping.  

I was seated immediately (had made a reservation for 6:30, but that wasn't necessary).  Great atmosphere and ambiance.  Yes, it was a little loud, but not to the extent of  being bothersome.  

My server (Kirk) was great.  Attentive.  Quick on his feet.  Friendly.  

Had the linguine and clams which I found to be very flavorful and a very nice portion.
author: Maureen V.

description: The food is just ok. I order the seafood pasta, probably the smallest portion and cheapest seafood option I have ever eaten. It is not worth $26. I just paid a total of $32 for a dinner that I'm not even half full.
author: Hieu P.

description: The food was good, great location for a weekend, staff was attentive (although our waiter seemed to be a bit out of it and forgot a few things we would ask for).  Good selection and very fresh.  Great caprice salad.  Great white pear cheesecake.  Overall very good but we ended up with a very high bill for 3 people.  We were drinking but it seemed to add up quick...  That was my only downside.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Terrible service and attitude. Sign says they close at 10 but they roll the sidewalks up at 9:30 and refuse to serve.
author: D F.

description:
There's a reason why Italian food isn't one of my favorite cuisine's to eat.  This place proved it.  You can go into 100 different italian places and all 100 tastes totally different.

This place lacked the Italian flavours I was longing.  I decided to stop in to eat dinner after putting in some hours of shopping in Union Square.  

Everything was kinda bland and nothing to call the cows home about.
author: Sandra S.

description: Went to dinner there last night and the food was amazing. The chicken morsalla was the best I've ever had, the polenta with the short ribs was perfectly cooked and the service was great. Definitely a place I would go again!
author: Billy K.

description:
This is one of the best Happy Hours I've found so far. P&P has a great menu and their bartenders are really good at what they do, even when the bar is crowded (and it usually is).

Special mention goes to Daria who is not only great at what she does, but adds that personal touch.
author: Jesse R.

description: The gamberi sautéed shrimp with peppers, white wine and garlic butter sauce is terrific. Went there on Sunday after a show and they were packed in the bar for their day long Happy Hour and the service from the bartenders was perfect despite how busy they were.
author: Eileen H.

description:
As folks who read my reviews know - Service is always the most important thing for me.

On recent business travel, I chose Puccini & Pinetti on a week night for dinner.  Time was probably a bit after 8pm.   My decision was informed by the reviews here on Yelp, and the fact the place was across the street from my hotel.  The restaurant and bar was somewhat busy - the tables were mostly full, but no one was waiting.

I asked for a table and was told they were really busy at the moment, that I could have a bar seat overlooking the kitchen, or I could wait 5-10 mins for a table.   I said fine, I'd wait (I despise eating at a bar)

As I waited, a woman came in behind me with a problem with her take-out order.   

As I eaves-dropped on her problem, I noticed a nice little booth had been sitting clean and ready to go...   so, after the hostess finished with the take-out woman, (told her to wait for manager) I asked about that table.

I was told, "Oh, we have a policy that we only put 4 people in booths..." and yet, as I pointed out to the hostess, "Well, the other 2 booths have only 2 covers in them..."   "Well, sometimes we make an exception" - so I waited a second for "the exception" and after she didn't respond, I said, "So, you won't seat me there?"   "No, restaurant policy"

The take-out woman snorted and I said, "Well, then I guess I need to see the manager."    The hostess hustled off to get manager.  Take-out woman said to me, "Jeez, where do these people come from - of course she should've seated you...."    She went on to explain that her take-out order was prepared totally wrong - all the shrimp was excluded from her shrimp entree...

So this manager-type approaches and hollers over his shoulder to a server, "I've got three fires to put out..."    (apparently we were on fire?)  He then approaches us and says to me, "I'm going to take care of her first, because she was here longer..." - Take-out woman rolled her eyes and I was gracious and yielded.

While Manager talking to her, two larger parties arrived, and hostess seated them right away, one group at the table I wanted.   Now I'm pissed...

Manager assured take-out lady he'll have a fresh order made - would take 20 mins...   and he'd toss this one.   Then turned to me.  I told him that I was frustrated, and they'd seated other folks at my table.    He says, "We do have a policy that we can only seat 2 or more at the booths..."  I indicated I felt that silly, I was frustrated, and would be writing a review on Yelp.

He said, "Well, what can I do, you're already going to write a bad review..."  and I paused, giving an opportunity...   he didn't get it right away, then he said, "Well, we can feed you..." and waved toward the bar (feed me?   what am I, the family pet?!)....

"No, I'm going back to your competitor a block away, who welcomed me as a single diner last night, even though they were busy."

His response was, "Here's my card.   Call me on your next trip and let me know when you're coming and I promise you will have a great dining experience...  I promise.   Just don't write a review until then..." 

I took the card and left. 

I debated a few days before I decided to go ahead and write this review.

Here's my position:  Yes, anyone can ensure a diner has a "great" experience if the diner calls ahead and says, "I'm a critic, and I'm coming over in an hour, per our arrangement..."   That would be a bogus experience that would not accurately represent the Service practices (or food prep practices) that the restaurant has in normal service.

So, here's my review.    It is clear to me that this place is not focused on the customer experience.   The staff doesn't understand what it takes to be great servers.  They chase covers instead of focusing on providing a great experience.  Management is clearly over their heads and unable to monitor staff behavior and reinforce best practices.

Further, being surrounded by hotels in Union Square, they don't really care about taking care of business travelers who, while only a single covers, tend to be on expense accounts, often spend more than the average tourist, tip better, and tend to look for places that are reliable so they can give them repeat business.   I thought most restaurants learned this lesson in the 80's...

I intend to stay in the neighborhood on my monthly trips to SF.  I certainly won't be taking advantage of that manager's offer.

I am not the only reviewer here who has indicated this place has serious service issues.    I would recommend avoiding this place - unless you're only looking to be "fed".   There's plenty of great dining experiences in the neighborhood.

Oh, and Take-Out Woman?   Five minutes later, a cook showed up with a take-out box that looked suspiciously similar to both of us... when she asked if they'd just dumped shrimp in the box, he stuttered a bit, then said, "No, we had another ready for another table, so I just took that one..."    Neither of us really believed himh
author: Jeffrey F.

description: Consistently very good and a favorite for Theater nights.  Angel is very custmer-oriented and friendly waiter.
author: Harry R.

description:
Great Happy Hour.
$3 glasses of red, white or Champagne.  Hefty pour.
Delicious appetizers, $1 oysters, either raw or baked.
$7 Mini Margarita pizza.

Nice people watching location, good service.
author: Song H.

description:
I am going to give this place a 4 because the food we had was very good. Yes, it is in the middle of a very touristy part of the city, however, the food was above average for this type of neighborhood and the restaurants that surround it.  

My advice, stick to the "mom and pop" Italian items and you will be very pleased. The Spaghetti and meatballs were outstanding. Being an Italian girl I have no doubt that those meatballs were homemade, never frozen and prepared that day.  The sauce had a bit of a kick, which I do in my own kitchen. The penne arrabbiata was great as well. Sausage in the sauce was out of the casing and pasta cooked to perfection.  Both dishes came out piping hot and did not disappoint. The salads are fresh, great and huge.  

The atmosphere was clean, cozy and a bit predictable, but it was fine. Service prompt, friendly and attentive.  If you want fancy/forced Italian, go around the corner for food that is not as good. If you read the reviews from the 3 stars and below people on this thread, you will see that many focus on themselves or a particular incident. Do not let that ruin your opinion of this place, and accept it for what it is, a solid Italian restaurant in the midst of Union Square.

 Reservations needed but you can get them the day of if need be.
author: Meg M.

description:
How to enjoy this place:

1. GO TO THE BAR!

2. Eat off the happy hour menu.

Seriously, pretty good food and really decent wine, especially for how inexpensive everything is. 

What ruins this place:

1. The first and the only thing: THE SERVICE!!!!!

I mean really though! Come on! I feel like the bar gets so busy that they just don't care about you. That would be fine, if there weren't a bunch of servers watching the game on the tube while you are waiting to order another glass of wine. Even when I left, they could barely budge from the TV to let me pass through to exit. 

I would have raved about this place for days to come had my service been somewhat decent. It was so bad that I probably won't be back anytime soon.

Let's hope it will get better so I can come back and enjoy the happy hour again. Maybe the servers there only like baseball and I can safely return while baseball season is over. Most likely not. Hopefully it was just the cocktailer I had that day and it will be better when I return.
author: Christina C.

description: What to say. Definitely an interesting evening. First, we had a great server in Jordan who did a wonderful job taking care of us from start to finish. Second, had the interesting experience of a homeless person who generated a $66 bill and dashed without paying. The staff was unable to chase him down unfortunately. Cudos to the management for not holding Jordan responsible for the meal. Sandi, Mel and I decided to at least cover the lost tip on the homeless meal. Seemed like the right thing to do for Jordan. BYW, food was great.
author: Michael G.

description: I came here for a work dinner recently and was excited to try it.  They were participating in the Dine about Town and the prix fixe looked good so I ordered that.  It started with a salad that sounded better on the paper than it was.  It was an arugula salad with blood oranges and feta cheese.  The feta cheese was the best part about the salad.  I'm not sure what it was but the salad just didn't feel like it went well together.  For the entree I had the short braised ribs and these were very good.  The creme brulee was also good but nothing over the top.  I was very happy to hear they had sazeracs and I ordered one and it was perfect.  My only issue with this place was that it felt very rushed.  We were here for a business dinner and had planned to take our time and talk and go over things but everything came out so super fast it felt like they were rushing to get us out of there.  I'm not sure if it was because of the Dine About Town going on or not but I felt very put off by it.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Directions for having a good time:

1. Happy hour is awesome but it's only in the bar.(Wait it out)

2. Order a red or white wine by the glass from happy hour(it's delicious and cheap)

3. All the Happy hour food is delicious(I ordered the Meatballs, Margarita pizza, pesto pizza, bruschetta)

4. This place is fantastic, and the only reason this place isn't getting 5 stars is because of the horrible service. 

**Our server whose name I wont reveal, but let's call him "Crandy".
Crandy came once or twice to our table, gave me a glass of wine with lipstick on the rim, which I went to the bartender and corrected myself (he was no where in site and couldn't care less).
**He ordered us the wrong food, put the wrong drinks on our tab, and as we were leaving, he refused to move out of the way because he was watching the football game.... WOW! My girlfriend and I grew up working in restaurants and we were appalled!!!
**Times are tough, the strongest line of defense that any restaurant can utilize to stand out is with a great staff. This server let this restaurant down tonight.

ATTENTION SERVERS: IF YOU HATE SERVING TABLES, DO SOMETHING ELSE! YOU ARE HURTING THE RESTAURANT AND WHAT IT COULD BE!!!!!
author: Nathan B.

description: nothing spectacular. Mushroom risotto was pretty good, but I would recommend hitting locanda and delfina for better italian food.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
After our relaxing day at BW, we walked to Puccini & Pinetti for some grub. It's a good place for a group get together, family meal, business meal, and any other type of meal.

I ordered the short rib ($23) which was a good sized portion...enough to take half of it home. The entree came with 3 hearty slices of short rib (no bone) and pesto mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were light, fluffy and creamy and the short rib was a bit bland in flavor but moist and when you pierced the meat, it just flaked off.

Everyone else was happy with their meal and we also ordered 4 desserts. The best out of their creme brulee ($7), sorbet trio ($7), tiramisu ($11) and truffle cake ($8) was the creme brulee. That dish was the first to be demolished by us!

Service was average and the noise level inside was pretty loud...but then again, I think our group was adding to it. Overall, not a bad place to go. I actually never knew it existed and was surprised to see a decent, sit-down restaurant so close to the Union Square area.
author: Janel Y.

description: 3.5 stars. Good ambience and delicious chicken Marsala...but not $25 great. Marsala sauce was a bit on the sweet side and they spinach did not mix well. Right across from the 55 Wyndham.
author: RC D.

description: I always come here when in town, the calamari and chicken Marsala can't be beat. The specialty cocktails are also creative and good and they have a nice wine list.
author: Michelle H.

description: Another great dinner tonight. Good band playing live music, waiters are very careful about customers, and yes, food is awesome ! I've been here already 5 times, always a pleasure! Forgot this one : they forgot my daughters pizza, apologized a lot, rushed it and got it to our table in minutes, and finally offered a desert to kids. Again, awesome !
author: Antoine S.

description: This is probably picked most due to location to several hotels and close proximity to shopping. But really...don't go here. When seated we noticed The table had a gross amount of gunk in the crevasses of our leafed table. My cutlery had dried spinach on it. When taking our order, The waiter seemed annoyed since we didn't order drinks and it went down hill from there. He brought us stale table starter bread. When ordering We chose the spaghetti with meatballs because of its rave reviews---which was too salty had no real flavor to the sauce & was not all that saucy but more like stewed tomatoes with burger meat. The meatballs themselves didn't taste terrible but it was $25 for something subpar. We also ordered a margherita pizza was too saucy snd the crust was slightly doughy despite the fact that it was a thin crust pizza., we also had the ceasar salads which had a ton of salad dressing. Just another wannabe trying to be foodie like!
author: Amy F.

description: I wish I could give this 3.5 stars, because it was a good meal with nice gluten free options. They have a gluten free menu and our server was knowledgable. Their meatballs are actually gluten free- I don't  remember the last time I could order spaghetti and meatballs-and it was good! The meatballs were moist and the best part of my meal. The sauce was fairly bland, which stopped the dish from being a home run. Husband enjoyed his steak as well. It was packed on a weekday night, and it showed in the service. We had to have someone hunt down our waiter to even greet us and get our drink order- and it took forever to get those first drinks. And we sat there forever after finishing, waiting for him to return with a bill. Bottom line- enjoyed the food, service knocked it down a star.
author: L C.

description: Nice when dining with kids.  Food came quick and was good.  I had the chicken Marsala which I would recommend.
author: Mark W.

description: Average. Service was fine. Food was average.  No complaints but nothing special here.
author: Tracy Y.

description: Do not eat here.  Mediocre at best and insanely overpriced.  Linguine and clam sauce was flavorless with only a handful of clams.  95% of the dish was pasta, and for the price, it was a complete ripoff.  Terrible and extremely disappointing.
author: Laura G.

description:
Came her on a recomendation and was glad I did. Chicken Marsala was off the hook as was the the Lasagna. My son had the pizza which was very good with a thin crust and pepperoni generosity applied.

The Waitress was very nice and professional even though the place was busy. I would go again and reccomend it. I noticed a yelper said the food lacked flavor, nothing could be further from the truth, they need to go see an ENT and get their taste buds checked out. I grew up in an Italian home with my mom off the boat so i think I may have a clue to what flavor is and they had it.

The only thing I did not like was the blonde working the desk I found her to be a bit condescending and acting as though she did me a favor by giving me a table otherwise I think I would have gone 4 Stars.
author: Palmer W.

description: Visited this place multiple times during our one week stay at the neighboring hotel and it was awesome!!  Had the seasonal greens w salmon and champagne vinaigrette which was absolutely delicious.  Several good kids' options including homemade mac and cheese.  Minestrone was a big hit, as was chicken marsala.  Good coupons from hotel next door.  Service was excellent.
author: Cristina P.

description: Pretty decent food, with Italian leanings.  Service is average, food is tasty, location very convenient in Union Square.
author: Brian M.

description:
I would have given this tourist trap One star before partaking in their happy hour last week.

But...$3 Champagne is enough to merit three stars. It's a good equilibrium of cheapness and bubbles.  Inverse correlation between stars and monies.  Bump it down to $2, bump up to four stars!  That's my recession equation.

Try the crab fonduta, olives, and ravioli if you're hungry. If you're not, they're not very special so don't go out of your way.
author: Joanna M.

description: We just sat in the bar area, Food and Appetizers were delicious, and Amanda provided excellent service!!! We'll be back!
author: Henry I.

description: Great cocktail menu, great gluten free options, great service. It was just lacking a WOW factor for the 5th star... However I would most definitely return and try more!!!!
author: Rachel W.

description:
Granted... Initially I was not going there to eat.  Merely stopped in, in  need of a couple parking meter quarters to drop off a package. (I was nicely dressed... in other words, not a hobo).  Was directed to ask Casey the bartender.   He plainly refused and said that he had no change.

Fine Casey...  But I will never set foot in your establishment to dine.

It would have cost you nothing to help me.    Furthermore,
I was hungry and if you had helped me I would have been thrilled to order lunch there.  But you've left me now with a bad taste for 
Puccini & Pinetti.  (Not friendly to local citizens).
author: Michael W.

description:
I am the world's fussiest eater. I need everything on the side and no dairy and no meat... Blah,blah. I'm a server's nightmare. I have to say our server Ian, at Puccini, never once rolled his eyes or gave me the big "sigh... I'll ask the chef" that I get so often. He was great! My food came out just the way I asked and was delicious. I didn't have to send anything back and that's rare for me.  I asked for the capellini with just olive oil and garlic and it was delicious! The grilled romaine was yummy and I had all the goodies on the side so I could just add a tiny bit if I wanted it. 

We got seated right away (granted it was 6 pm on a Sunday) but the service and food were really good, IMHO. They even comped our friend on her birthday creme brûlée. 

All in all a meal I remember fondly. One of my top five meals in San Francisco.
author: Tesia B.

description: I went here with a friend and was super disappointed. It gets 2 stars because the food didn't make us sick... but that's about all the good the good I can say about it. Our waiter didn't listen. We each had to repeat our order 3 times and even then, he got it wrong. What's so difficult about "diet coke, no ice"? The food was not overly tasty... as my friend said, "we could have gone to Carl's Junior and gotten food of the same quality and taste." And it was wicked expensive. Skip this place... it's a tourist trap and nothing more.
author: David P.

description: I may give this restaurant 2 1/2 stars if the waiter Kyle hadn't been such a dingbat. The bruschetta was just ok. They included the tough core parts of the tomato in the dish...c'mon nobody likes to eat that part! The dipping sauce that came with the complimentary bread was very oily, salty and didn't taste good. The spaghetti and meatballs were again very salty and the sauce was just ground beef. The frutti de mare lacked any shellfish and was mainly cubes of yet again salty salmon. Now for the waiter: I asked what the soup was and he says "onion". So I asked "French onion?? You know where it's baked with cheese?" And he says, "I don't know it doesn't specify". Um ok. Then I get a "wedge" salad with flat layers of iceberg and minimal bacon bits drenched in ranch and few tomatoes. So I asked the waiter for blue cheese crumbles..he returns with dressing. Then I had a voucher for a free bruschetta and when I showed the waiter he says ok and then puts in ANOTHER order of bruschetta even though we had already completed our entrees and the bruschetta appetizer long ago. Very disappointing experience.
author: MissM R.

description:
To be fair, I never would have selected this place on my own. It isn't the kind of food that I am really interested in. However, two of our party of 7 are in the middle of a gluten free diet attempt and this place was recommended since it has a gluten free menu.

Sunday, 1PM and the place is mostly empty. We made a reservation, just in case, and when we arrived our table was not ready. Nothing major really, but the antenna went up, if for no other reason than there wasn't much of anything else that the servers had to do. OK, so maybe they have had some unpleasant experiences with groups not showing up and they wait until you do before going through the work of setting a table up.

Now to the important part, the food: Burger order was a burnt tire, grilled salmon was still partly frozen in the center and obviously raw. I guess they left the burger cooking while they tried to defrost the salmon; unsuccessfully.  Meanwhile even though the place was less than 5% filled, we waited almost 45 minutes from ordering to being served. 

Wrong salads arrived, including an all important gluten free version that we had ordered. Grilled bread with the salmon order wasn't there.

So, I guess you get the drift. As i said when I started out, I knew this wasn't my kind of place, but I figured that I could at least enjoy a simple grilled salmon and have fun with good company. Sad to say this place just does not have a clue about how to do that -  simple, easy to prepare dishes that are almost impossible to ruin, all on a day where there was absolutely no pressure from starving hordes. I can't imagine how the kitchen can cope with crowds!

The prices were on the really high end too, for basic meals!
Do yourself a favor and spend twenty/30 minutes getting out to the Mission, Sunset or Clement and get a decent meal for a lot less.

For those who  are just dying to know. The individual who recommended the place was suitably rewarded. Perhaps you read the story in The Chronicle Monday morning about the guy in the pink tutu tied up in the S F Zoo's monkey house watching the apes devour a triple box of Schubert's. Cruel, but justified.
author: robert g.

description: I came here for brunch with my husband and my mother, the service was great! We had bloody Mary's and peach bellinis. Great place to eat I had the Belgian waffle and tried my moms delicious crab cake Benedict. I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Katie K.

description: Amazing Penne with sausage! If they didn't have such a horrible greeter, I'd be back and they'd get an extra star. She has such a bad attitude! The waiters are super friendly though!
author: Paula R.

description: Recommended by our Hilton concierge as a nice home made Italian place. Was expecting middle of the road food, but was more than pleasantly surprised. Great food and very attentive service. Highly recommend to anyone.
author: Hugi O.

description: This is the worst service place I ever sat at. It took the host 15 min to just show up at the front to take us to our table. No waiter even bothered to show up to take our drinks and said " sorry we are busy". Horrible place don't go there
author: Nikki C.

description:
Bar review-

Although ive never been seated in the restaurant portion of "Puccini", i am a frequent visitor of the bar and happy hour section. This place is a must go Sunday- Tuesday for Happy Hour... which, by the way, lasts till 10PM! ENOUGH SAID! Wine and champaign is $3! Must tries are the garlic fries and the margarita pizzas ($5). The bruchetta  is so-so.  Not enough tomato for me. The cheese balls- only had once but were a little greasy. 

The staff is always super friendly and the place is booming so be prepared to wait for a bar-top seat or a spot at the bar!

Note- the bathroom is in the hotel portion. 

See you there.
author: Jen E.

description: Great Happy Hour $3 Red White Sparkling, Great Happy Hour Food, try the meatballs, Great Bartenders Kevin, Carlos, all of them. Good crowd at the bar and tables! I always enjoy myself and always always meet people. Great place to hang!
author: Paul A.

description: AMAZING food! This place is great and the service is great. Everything looks so good on the menu, it's hard to choose! They have delicious breakfast and lunch foods. Seriously, if you're in San Fran, you must try.
author: Alicia C.

description:
What can I say about this place other than it is simply the BEST place for happy hour downtown!  

My coworkers and I have been there so much recently that we are now on a first name basis with the servers.  One might think we are alcoholics but really we are more in love with the appetizers and low prices.  Wine and champagne only $3?!  Gourmet snack plates ranging from $4-8??  Yes please!!  

The bar area is small but we are usually able to find a spot no problem.  The energy is good but it isn't ever too loud so we can still have decent conversations.  The staff is always super friendly, attentive and on top of things.  

No matter how many I throw back, or how much I stuff my face, I never seem to spend more than 25 bucks.  And I always feel like I got way more than my money's worth at this place.

It is really no wonder we have become regulars here!
author: Alissa A.

description: Waited 45 minutes. Never got service. Was half full. The bartender, when asked the eta on service let us know his lunch has been sitting for 45 minutes.
author: Jef H.

description: Would give zero stars if that were an option. Walked in at 10:15 on a Sunday evening, where their sign clearly says open until 11, was tole that they had already closed the kitchen?  What kind of bush league crap is that?  Change the hours printed on your door, maybe?  Or stay open until you say you're going to?  Won't ever return, and will make sure that I let everyone I know that this place isn't worth a thought.
author: Brent D.

description:
I'm Puccini & Pinetti.  I wanted to like you, I really did.  But I just can't.

$30 dollar pasta? Really? For some arrabiatta (barely any heat) pasta (not nearly enough pasta to fill me) with lemon zest and shrimp (5).  Ridiculous.

I've given Puccini & Pinetti two chances now.  And both times it has failed to live up to m expectations of a good Italian Restaurant.

I know it's harsh, but I definitely will not be giving them a third.
author: Chelsea C.

description: It's ok. Not exactly what we wanted or the flavors we craved by it wasn't bad. A little over priced for some items. Great service! Awesome waitress with lots of knowledge. She gets a five.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Awesome Happy Hour! $5 cocktails, $3 beers, etc. Decent food as well. Drink prices are unbeatable though! Get here early to get a seat at the bar.
author: Rochelle I.

description:
Why eat here?

Unless you're a person who's visiting San Francisco to only see Union Square, you've got no reason to go to this restaurant. The food is mediocre at best, the prices are way above reasonable, and the service is awful.

The only reason I gave this place more than one star was the the food wasn't totally inedible. Aside from that, one star, at best.

In a city that's got such a great food culture, this place is maybe on par with TGI Fridays.
author: A L.

description: Contemporary, clean and european. Love the free appetizer courtesy of Yelp. Staff is very courteous, thank you Elvis. Rigatoni and cheesecake were great. Outstanding service for a  busy restaurant. Recommended !
author: G R.

description: Nice bar. Did not eat there. Service was good and pours were healthy. Definitely recommend it.
author: Clark H.

description: Staff was incredibly accommodating and diligent!  We had a baby with us and ordered spaghetti with Alfredo sauce and for ourselves we ordered the kale salad, spaghetti and meatballs, linguini with clam sauce and the daily special.  The Alfredo was the most delicious Alfredo I ever tasted , very cheesy and not bland!!  Too bad it wasn't on the big kids menu!  I thought the pasta with clam sauce was okay , it was made with a tomato base which I wasn't expecting (my bad, should have read the menu closer), though it came with TONS of clams!  The spaghetti and meatballs were pretty good, too, but I think needed more cheese!  The special of the day was excellent, too.  Overall a great restaurant that I would definitely return to!!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I've been here a couple of times, didn't really think it was that great but my friends keep coming back here.

We came here on chance as my floormates and I wanted to go into SF for a nice dinner so our friend picked this place.  Some of my friends continue to go here every so often but I don't really see whats so great.

The dishes are wayyy too overpriced for what its worth and not that good.

There are really only a couple of vegetarian options on the menu which weren't that memorable.

I've had the potato gnocchi which I remember the sauce was a little bland and the gnocchi overcooked to where I felt like I was eating mush.

The Tuscan Lasansa has WAAAYYY too much oil on it.  I felt I was eating mostly just oil soaked vegetables sandwiched in noodles.

I've also had the pizza which was eh.

I think for the amount of options, quality of the food and price (~20-25 a dish) I don't really think its worth it if you are a fellow vegetarian.  This is why I cringe everytime my friends ask me to go with them to Puccini and Pinetti.
author: Kameron K.

description: We went here for happy hour since we were staying at the hotel next door, what an improvement over my first visit! The crab cakes on the appetizer menu were so delicious, I was starving so I ate the salad it came with, that had the best vingarette on it. We also got the shrimp which I really enjoyed. Our server, Kevin, was super friendly. He was very funny, and I felt like he was my friend instead of our server. It was awesome that they offer an happy hour on the weekends too!
author: Lisa H.

description: Bruschetta and Caesar salad were tasty. 5 different people waited on us, none of whom were friendly.
author: Darlene K.

description:
Summary: Good happy hour, otherwise overpriced.

Came as part of Dine About Town w/ two friends. Sat in the bar area and split one Dine About Town menu (salad, salmon, cake), spaghetti and meatballs (waiter said it was their most popular and best dish), and a few bar items (fried calamari, burrata, fried ravioli).

Food was decent overall, but not phenomenal. Ok at the bar / happy hour prices.

Would only come back for happy hour, not for a full meal.
author: Gary Y.

description:
Review is for Happy Hour only! 

Their bar area is always pretty crowded, so come early to snag a table. Happy hour is from 3PM-Close on Mondays and Tuesdays! Ordered the meatballs, calamari, crab cakes, and nachos. They also have $3 wines and beers to top it off. All the food was surprisingly delicious but don't expect dinner-sized portions! Our tab came out to be around $30 for 4 plates of small bites...will definitely come back to try more dishes! 

Bartenders and servers were extremely friendly. Drink prices were very reasonable. Food prices were decent.
author: Vivian D.

description: Had a very nice lunch here and have always enjoyed the happy hour specials.  Probably the best happy hour deal in SF.  The bartender Kevin is awesome and very friendly.  Definitely recommend!
author: Luke L.

description: Great place! We have been coming here for ten years or better. The food is always decent and the people are very friendly! What a concept! The bar is fully stocked.  The Kale salad is delightful! The Grass fed pork chop was fantastic our server was so accommodating!
author: Charlene V.

description:
Don't go by the pics....I got fooled by that. I cannot even say food was average becuase it was super bad.
tomatoes in capellini looked as if they were out of a can....chicken marsala was even more pathetic. 

And what added to the pain was i ended up paying $42 per head (gratuity included as we were 5) and this $42 per head include just a beer and 2 glass wine among five ppl.

I am not sure about their happy hour but i would say if you r looking for gud food then stay away from this place. I wud have preffered the pizza slice place which is on the corner of this place.

The food was that bad that none of us completed and our server asked if we want to get it to go. We said know and he said he has seen this a lot. So even the servers know that food here is pathetic.
author: Rishi K.

description:
"Meh" adequately describes my sentiments here. This place has a great reputation and a loyal following so we gave it a try. While we did enjoy the food, I really didn't think it was spectacular. 

Unfortunately, the whole experience was mired by the sub par service. Our food came out hot but that was the extent of the positive elements. The feeling was that of a busy diner were the server makes it very clear that you are to simply order your food and then leave him alone.

Meh
author: Robert M.

description:
The Rating goes Straight up at 4 purely because of the location this restaurant is in.
Awesome Place to dine and wine in San Francisco . One Can Lazily sit around , Lay back and watch the busy streets of San Francisco and yet not get disturbed by the crowd.AS far as the food is concerned . VERY GOOD . Wine , the best and the service is pleasant. Staff is very good and makes the place even better. I had been here atleast more than 10 times with different groups of my friends . I enjoy coming here everytime i m San Francisco . DEFINITELY Yes for me .
author: Anil V.

description:
Came here this past Saturday with my girl friends after movies and shopping downtown. Puccini & Pinetti is across stress from Infusion Lounge. Yeah, we were planning to party at Infusion after dinner. That's the reason why we ended up at Puccini & Pinetti. 

We came in after 9 pm without reservations, and it was still packed. We had some drinks at the bar while waiting for our table. Not bad - only a 15 min wait. 

To the food! The Warm Spinach Salad was great and Corn Chowder was creamy and yummy. The food here is not bad.

Puccini & Pinetti is a decent spot to have some drinks and food after shopping downtown.
author: Chloe B.

description: Great bar menu and happy hour. The service is a little slow, but very friendly. Give the Jim Beam milkshakes a try for dessert.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
We went into this place with my wife for happy hours late lunch.We tought that was an italian cuisine.It wasn't.The food was a pre-made american interpretation of italian course.The price was way to high for the non existing flavor and happy hours!My wife recieved a pre-bottled ceaser dressing over conventional lettuce and a really flavorless mojito without limes.I recieved a school-lunch pizza.The cheese plate was nice but cheese is really hard to ruin:)
I only gave 2 stars because the service was quite good.
My suggestion is,if you wanna have an italian food,go somewhere else!
author: Balazs V.

description: This is a delightful restaurant.  Really casual, lively vibe -- great place to grab a dinner.  Entrees were pretty expensive for pretty good/decent food.  All in all, glad I checked it out -- will probably look elsewhere in the neighborhood to try out some more Italian restaurants.
author: Mel G.

description:
We went here for a belated Father's Day dinner. My dad has been coming here off and on for awhile and he recommended it. 

+ Hostess was very sweet and and flexible about moving us to a preferred table.
+ Busboys excellent with our water refills. 
+ Waitress friendly and attentive
+ Chicken marsala and grilled samon were delicious
+ Calamari was good
+ Check was prompt 
+ Nice atmosphere and cozy tables - nicer by the window though. :) 

Total bill was about $100 for three people, an appetizer, soup, and two alcoholic beverages. Not super low but I'd say the food was worth it especially because it was some of the best service I've had in a long time. I will definitely be back the next time I go out to eat with my dad! :)
author: Kristi D.

description: The ambiance was cozy and food was delicious, must try White Pizza' Girls night with Two girlfriends and my 10 yr old daughter. Great for kids, she ordered the make your own pizza and had fun doing it.
author: Amanda R.

description: This is a review for the bar area. Let me start by saying we used to love this place, has been our go-to for several years for great bar drinks in a friendly atmosphere. Since Kimpton hotels  sold the establishment it has gone downhill. Quite frankly, the staff look like they want to be elsewhere. The service used to be top drawer,  such a shame it is now so poor. Prices for food have notably gone up too. Today was the last time for a 'second' chance, shame.
author: Aj W.

description:
The absolute worst food in San Fran. Everything is previously frozen. The calamari was all the same size so it was obvious it was frozen. My fiancé had spaghetti and meatballs and it tasted like dirt, and I had the frutti di mare and it was like eating linguine with colored water instead of sauce. I am not picky at all, but it was really bad.  The prices reflect a nice restaurant ($25-$35 per meal) but taste horrible. Do not waste your time. 

When we asked the waiter if he was shocked that we sent our food back he was not at all shocked, and knew it was awful.
author: Gabrielle R.

description: The manfriend and I intended to have dinner at Infusion Lounge across the street, but they had stopped serving dinner around 9:15. So we popped across the street to Puccini & Pinetti. I'm glad they were serving dinner late, but that's about it. We had the short ribs and the chicken marsala. Both dishes were SO SALTY that they were almost inedible. I love my food with tons of salt, and this was even overkill for me. Bleh.
author: Taylor B.

description:
My boyfriend and I like to stop by for drinks and a quick bite after work but have recently decided it's not worth our business. 

The food and drinks are decent during happy hour but the service, mainly the cocktail server, Darya?(brunette curly haired) who works during happy hour is terrible. We used to come here a few times a week and she's quickly turned our experience into an awkward and annoying one. She's not attentive, friendly, or warm whatsoever. She acts as if it's a complete nuisance to take peoples' orders. Clearly she hates her job and it shows. 

I would never normally call a server out on yelp but she's really bringing the place down.
author: Julie M.

description: Great Happy Hour, and on Mondays and Tuesdays it lasts all night! Make sure you go early though because the place tends to fill up.  If you dont get in during happy hour the prices become not so friendly.  Sidenote: if you like bubbly they have an amazing champagne ;-)
author: Shaina N.

description:
The happy hour here is AMAZING. $3 wine and champagne? Yes, please. The food is also very good. We tried the pizza margarita, the mussels, and the calamari. The prices are great - everything was around $5-7.  

The only thing i don't recommend trying is the meatballs. They come topped in a weird chili-like sauce (which is better than the actual meatballs), and the meatballs have a weird "squishy" texture. Besides this, everything about this place is fantastic.
author: Jazmine S.

description:
I just had the steak salad for lunch! I substituted chicken for the steak. It had amazing balsamic vinegar dressing, caramelized onions, grilled peppers, and mushrooms... Amazing!!! 
Absolutely delicious!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
MENU CHANGE!  I haven't been all summer and when I went back for Happy Hour, the deliciousness that was their bruchetta was destroyed!!!  A lot of other yummy stuff was cut from the menu as well!  I was actually shocked...

Sam Adams is off Happy Hour prices too.  Boo.  :(

I wonder if management/owners changed and are cutting back?  SAD.
author: Kitty O.

description:
I saw on their web site, the lounge has a different menu than the tables. I was in the mood for several appetizers, and chose to sit in the lounge.

I highly recommend the calabrese!  I cannot speak to the lunch or dinner menu.
author: Randy R.

description: Horrible, sat there for 15 minutes and not one employee bothered to take a drink order or even say hi.  Won't ever waste my time here again.
author: Travis J.

description: Awesome spaghetti and meatballs! I would even say there was too much meat, is that even possible?   I don't think so, but very good selection overall.  I'd go back for sure.  Good beer list as well.
author: Mark D.

description:
Cheap drinks and cheap bar food after work! Great location and fun atmosphere. Only a hop and skip away from Westfield and Powell BART. The servers were all really friendly and were good about checking if we needed refills or wanted to order more. 

The bruschetta was tasty especially with the brie still warm. The bread to cheese/tomatoes were a bit off- we ran out of bread before being able to finish the good stuff. 

The pizza was thin crust so it was pretty minimal. Calimari was good, but a little too floury. I personally liked the spicy chicken but it was a bit too spicy for some of the people I was with. 

Happy hour is only good in the bar area, so hope you're lucky that you can grab a table especially if you're with a big group!
author: Christine A.

description:
Flat out solid! Had a great lunch here today and love the menu across the board.  Execution from the kitchen was super quick which made it easy for me to be in and out of there in just 45 minutes.  Actually, I could have been out of there faster had I wanted to be.  Had a fresh salad with moist chicken as well as a great made from scratch tasting minestrone.   Service was friendly and on top of everything.  Great value and a fun place to be at. 

Also, had a great espresso to end the meal.  Thought this was a nice touch as I think they just got a new machine.  

Was here another time for dinner and remember enjoying super meatballs and a great mussel dish.  

Will definitely be back.
author: Stefanie S.

description: Breakfast was great. However a waiter completely screamed at me, intimidated me and actually I was afraid I was going to have to defend myself and my baby. because all this was happening in front of my baby. I was the last client a Saturday morning,. Turns out he was upset because I entered at 10:15  and they close at 10:30. He told me he didn't give a... about the business or me. I asked for a manager but nobody came to talk to me, only the stuff from the kitchen and a waiter were apologizing to me for the behaviour of the waiter. The guy , which I am going to omit his name, seemed to think he was al pacino on a mafia movie. Anyways, the truth is that this guy is not  qualified to provide service to anybody and I hope management takes notice and does eright thing before they have a lawsuit.
author: Mike T.

description: Had a beautiful red wine with their short rib entree.  Wow, the whole thing just took me too another level.  Great bar staff.  Great food.  Friendly atmosphere.  A world of difference from the outside atmosphere of bums and drug addicts.  Five stars for making me forget there were any problems in the world.  Going back next time I'm in SFO.
author: Jason W.

description:
Not sure why the bad reviews. I'm a jaded ny'er and I thought the food was great.  Had the grilled salmon over asparagus and subbed spinach for rice, it was seriously amazing.  I'm sure that eating might be the equivalent of a ny'er eating in Times Square - which we would not - but it was very good.  And $3 glasses of wine..all night Monday and Tuesday - beat that! 

Rating is for the food not the ambiance....I sat at the bar
author: Debbie R.

description: The atmosphere here is awesome! We were seated at a huge booth that was cozy in the corner. Our group ordered the beef carpaccio, bruschetta and fritto misto! They were all amazing! My sister and I shared the salmon entree and it was cooked perfectly! My husband got the spaghetti and meatball plate and it was huge and delicious!! We will be back to sample other delights from the menu!
author: Allyson F.

description: Best staff and excellent service! Frutti de Mare is the best and my son had the ravioli scarfed it down as well as the bruschetta! I can go on!!! Guys really gotta try this place, I definitely go back again!!!
author: Sharon P.

description: Worst bartender ever. Little moby looking dude. There is a special place in hell for these owners
author: Jake C.

description:
They have a SWEET happy hour... which is probably the only cool thing about this place.  C'mon, who has a happy hour that runs until 10pm?

Monday and Tuesday from 4pm - 10pm
Wednesday through Friday from 4pm-6pm
Saturday from 3pm-6pm
Sunday from 5pm-10pm 

Go with friends, sit at the high tables, share some appetizers (about $5 each), and get some drinks.  This is a decent place to go for a cheap, after work gathering, but other than that... eh.  I wouldn't come here for dinner or anything.
author: Jessica F.

description:
The SF Dish had a promotion on voting day for certain participating bars; It was something like .50 cents for select cocktails if you could show proof of voting. We were around Union Square at the time and Puccini & Pinetti was on the list so we decided to drop in for a casual (and cheap!)cocktail. 

Come to find out that nobody in the restaurant had even heard of this promotion. The manager came over and asked us to show him the email that indicated they were participating; he was completely perplexed. After some investigation on their part they finally spoke with somebody who confirmed that they were indeed apart of this promotion. 

This incident isn't actually why I'm giving the 2 star review (although it does indicate a certain lack of togetherness). The two stars is for the crappy, tasteless dessert we ordered. We had the Italian donuts which tasted more like popovers without any sweetness. They drizzled only the tiniest amount of chocolate over them; they might as well not have even bothered because we could barely taste it. 

I hope their entrees are better than their desserts because if they're not they're not going to be winning over any business.
author: Julia N.

description:
Bravo, Puccini & Pinetti!

After a few disappointing meals in SF, I was pleasantly surprised by this cute little place. 

Honestly, I chose it for dinner because it was semi-close to the hotel and I was in the mood for Italian, but was very pleasantly surprised by a wonderful meal. 

The place is a bit on the loud side, especially since they were doing their all-night happy hour. It seems to be a great deal, but by the time I arrived, all the seats in the bar were taken and nobody appeared to be budging.

Instead, I was seated at a cute table by a window, which allowed for some people watching. And it was nice to have a little nook to myself.

The service was fabulous here. The waiter was kind, engaged, attentive, and knowledgeable. Need a recommendation? Sure - he'll give you one or two and tell you why he likes it. His support staff was also great - keeping the table neat and tidy, removing dishes in a timely manner, re-filling water glass, etc.

They serve focaccia as their bread of choice. Not my favorite, but theirs was flavorful. Instead of butter or olive oil, they serve a lovely caper-olive-sundried tomato tapenade. It was *delish*. 

I started with the Caesar salad. The dressing seemed more to be a hybrid of creamy Italian and Caesar, but was good nonetheless. Huge shavings of parm adorned the lettuce leaves - big plus in my book. It was a good salad - not perfect, but hit the spot.

The pizza was the star of the show. I ordered the Margherita pizza. It came out with a super thin crispy crust and wasn't over-sauced. In fact, the sauce was super-flavorful, with a hint of spice from the crushed red pepper flakes. Was a nice touch to cut the richness from the fresh mozzarella. Quick tip: rip off a piece of that crust and dip it in the tapenade. Oh. Yeah. Baby.
