We'd just driven in from LA and it was so noisy so I asked if we could be moved to an open table that was across from the kitchen a few steps down.  The host said that we had to wait because the server had too many tables.  He brought us back to the front of the restaurant so we could wait.  As we were waiting, we glanced at the Happy Hour menu.  I also looked at the regular menu.  The Happy Hour menu was much less expensive so we chose that as we werent that hungry.  The food was good, and a total bargain.  My partner had meatballs( 5 bucks for a huge plate), a cheesy bread which was more like a grilled cheese panini with a pomodoro sauce and a pizza margarita( both 5 bucks).  I had crab cakes that seemed to be deep fried.  Those were served with some greens that were a bit too salty.  I had the shrimp cocktail that was served with a bloody mary cocktail sauce.  There was way too much sauce for 5 shrimp.  The shrimp were great, perfectly cooked.  I could have eaten 10 more.  The sauce was too spicy and didnt really taste like cocktail sauce. My partner loved the meatballs.  To me, those were a deal since spagetti and meatballs on the regular menu was 20.00. Not sure why pasta costs 15 dollars.  We didnt drink, so with 2 sodas, our bill was 38 and change and we were full.
author: Randi M.

description:
When working retail downtown, this was the favorite post-work drinking spot for several of my co-workers, for good reason.  The cocktails, while on the pricey side, are good and strong.  The food is decent, though slathered in too much olive oil for my taste.  

Why so many stars? The reason is the staff, esp. the bartenders.  Super friendly and cool and if the right bartender is working, drinks are pretty much on the house if you are chill.

That, and the fact that a co-worker of my mine was 86'd here after some drunken, porn-star hijinks.  Too bad I wasn't there the night she got kicked out. It sounded pretty hilarious.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
went there last Th dinner with a party of 10. Check split 2 ways, and they added usual 18% tip.

Food was good but not special considering the prices. Service was inattentive and scattered, had to ask 4 times for a drink. As we left the waittress tried to guilt-trip us into a bigger tip, showing a check with a bigger tip added than we left.  It was for another table.
author: Kenneth F.

description: This place is the best !!   Me and GF came from out of town and stayed in a nearby hotel and stumbled upon this place.  We got there durring happy hour and ordered some 1/2 price Mojitos (that were incredible, seriously the best I've ever had) and some Mozerella Cheese Balls (this ain't no bar quality fried crap), they litteraly melt in your mouth and will have your taste buds screaming.  We just wanted to pop-in to have some drinks and apitizers but ended up staying there for dinner.  We split a Filet Mingon Steak with Garlic Mashed Potatoes (which wasn't even on the menu, but the waiter hooked it up somehow??) and Asperagus with a sweet glaze.  OOOOOHHH MAAAAAANN !!!   Top Notch Ingridients!!  To top it all off the watier was friendly and told us about some free parking spots and a few of his favorite night spots & things to do around the area.   A+, Thanx P&P
author: Jason H.

description:
I really want to give this place 3.5 starts, but I am rounding up because I am feeling nice.

I was staying near by and met a friend here for dinner as it was convenient to transit. I had made a reservation through Open Table, and they seated us right away. I was bummed that the happy hour drink prices did not carry over into the dining area. 

We started with the bruschetta appetizer, which had a nice smoky flavor. Very tasty and a good starter. I ordered the pesto gnocchi for my main meal and my dining companian had an appetizer and a small side of gnocchi. We liked our food, and it tasted good, but I wasn't particularly "wowed". Our server was OK. There were big gaps where we would not see him. The bussers were good at keeping the table cleared and the water glasses full. 
Overall, this is probably a safe bet if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Sophia M.

description:
A major dissapointment!!!  Service was bad and they forgot our appetizer and they were slow.  There were 6 or us and they messed up 2 of the orders. Make sure you fill up on the bread as the main course will certainly not.  For the prices they charge, you would expect a bit more.

Needless to say, we will not be back
author: Shafik K.

description:
Imo T. and I tried this place out for DAT.  It wasn't exactly what we expected, but the menu looked appetizing and when we're together we pretty much just eat.  We got there promptly at our reservation time and were seated within 2 minutes.  

I was slightly disappointed that we weren't offered the DAT menu, but had to ask for it.  Once we received it we decided to order one DAT meal and one regular dish.  The DAT items were just so-so...the scallop salad was delish, the pepper crusted filet was not great, but the pistachio cheesecake was a definite winner.  We also order the pesto gnocchi, which was the best dish of the night; the gnocchi was perfect - not too gooey and not to firm, it was just right!
author: Christine C.

description: My friends and I were walking back from Brenda's and we decided to go here for drinks since they had happy hour.  We were already full from dim sum and crawfish beignets so we didn't order anything to eat. I had a glass of champagne and it was ok.  The place itself is pretty nice.  I believe it's connected to a hotel.  We took over a corner of the restaurant and just sat and chatted.  The place is pretty chill, a good place to go for a drink with friends or coworkers.
author: Di L.

description: I went here with a group of 10 and had a good experience. Everything we tried was really good and the portions were good sized. The sangria is amazing! I'm not sure if they change it for the seasons but the spices in it made it taste like a fall/winter sangria. It's definitely not one of my top picks for Italian in the city, but if you are looking for a place near union square that can accommodate a group, this is a good option.
author: Gina C.

description: The hostess was extremely rude when we made a very simple request to move to identical, adjacent table.  Overall, the food was good to very good but after asking twice to verify that the pasta dish was made with gluten free pasta, my wife and daughter (both have celiac) were sick that night after dinner.  The bar scene looked great.  Probably a good choice for happy hour but I would not go back for dinner.
author: S H.

description:
Had a great vibe while enjoying dinner.  It was right across from our hotel so it was nice just to walk there.
The calamari was very enjoyable as it was not too chewy and came with a great aioli.
My fiance had an adult chicken pot pie and I even enjoyed it, not being the biggest fan of that dish.  I played it safe and got chicken parmesan, and was happy I did.  It was a huge piece of boneless chicken with a light breading.  
Do not miss out on dessert, I recommend the creme brulee, it was light and delicious.
author: Tim C.

description:
Ate there this past weekend.  It was super crowded- which kind of made it exciting.  I got to see what everyone was eating while waiting for a table at the bar.  

The Frutti di Mare is very, very delicious if you like seafood.  I highly recommend it.  Lemon cheesecake with strawberry was also excellent.  

Our server was very attentive- overall an wonderful meal and experience.
author: Gary C.

description: Ate here last night for my birthday. The food was tasty and creative, however still trumped by the excellent drinks and wonderful staff! Great place to celebrate. I stumbled back to my hotel a very happy guy, barely averting a food-induced coma.
author: Alex B.

description: If it was possible to give a place negative stars I would not hesitate to do it... However since I cannot I have rated it as low as conceivably possible. First of all the service.sub standard, and the food is even worse. Personally I enjoy the art of eating and preparation, therefore to be served a can of water with a mush they call vegetable was very disappointing, the bread was also something like cardboard or worse yet burnt cardboard. And finally the culmination of the meal consisted of a regurgitated tasteless slop known as spaghetti. Needless to say I will not be returning and the best thing they provided me with was the check.
author: Regina R.

description:
You know, when a restaurant has 219 reviews already, I don't know what good mine will do, but I'd like to get a couple things off my chest. First off, some day I'm going to open a restaurant where every person, particularly female, who walks in by herself, is going to get the best seat in the house, and all the couples are going to be relegated to sitting outside the kitchen, near the serving stations, etc. This was the vow I made to myself after once again, being seated by the hostess at Puccini & Pinetti in the worst seat available. What is it with restaurants? Don't they think that women eating by themselves would like a nice view? Don't want to listen to or smell the kitchen, or be constantly assaulted by wait staff reaching for this or that? So, so tired of this ongoing trend. I eat out a lot by myself, particularly on business, and gosh I'd like to be treated like a first class citizen for a change. 

Okay, after that little rant, I still wouldn't recommend this place. I ordered the beet salad appetizer (too cold so the ingredients didn't meld, could have been canned beets, really), and the osso buco....which was very tough, served over risotto, which was nice. I had a glass of wine. I left, because, hey, who wants to stick around and watch the wait staff putting together salads and grabbing silverware to give to other more fortunate diners seated near the front of the restaurant or the window? I was pleasant. I left a great tip. I'm a nice person, even attractive in my own way. Not sure why I'm always getting buried in the back other than being a female alone...but I'm going to start speaking up and demanding a seat with the "other" grownups....THE REVOLUTION BEGINS....
author: Helen F.

description: Great! I went there after having to beg for someone to even greet us at Kuleto's. The service was excellent and the atmosphere very nice. I had great soup and some wine...
author: Laura K.

description: OK so I was skeptical about this place based on the photos on yelp.  But I was proven wrong by having one of the best meals I have had here.  We started off with focaccia and tapenade which was full of yummy capers.  Then I had the special orecchiette pasta with sausage and pesto...to die for!!!  My friend ordered the spaghetti and meatballs...again so flavorful and past was cooked to perfection.  I was so full at the end of this meal but it was so worth it.
author: Christina P.

description: I've been here many years ago and I don't remember what I had which means it was just an ok restaurant. We had a work holiday party here and overall, it was pretty satisfying. We had a whole restaurant ourselves and this place is good for a party.
author: Yoko S.

description: The staff here is just about the least friendly group of people I've seen in San Francisco - excluding the hostess staff.  Other than the hostess staff - no one smiled and often grimaced at us.  Rarely saw our server and the server and busting staff acted as if it was our fault they had to work.  The food was adequate at best.  I will never recommend or be back to this restaurant again!!!
author: John M.

description:
I am lucky enough that I can often leave work a bit earlier than most.  Thus, I can fully appreciate Happy Hour!  $3beers!  Pizza of the day! Yum!

They also have tower of fries, which is rather silly, but admittedly I find charming.  And their calamari ain't bad either.
(edit 3/10/08: this place is under new management.  RIP tower of fries.  The calamari is just OK now, not bad, but not fantastic either. Still has the $3 beer happy hour though!)

the bathrooms are in the hotel next door, which provides a nice bizarre change in scenery from the bustling restaurant.

Don't bother going to happy hour on a Friday until you like standing!
author: Rebecca R.

description:
Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I received a gift certificate to this place as a gift and was skeptical based on its location. So on a weeknight with nothing else to do, we ventured downtown to check it out. We were definitely expecting a tourist trap of crappy food, cheesy decor and overpriced items. When we arrived, we were pleasantly greeted by the host and surprised to see one of the most crowded restaurants I've ever come across downtown. (Did I mention it was a Wednesday night?) 

We ordered the Bruschetta and lentil soup to start off with. Both were decent but nothing special. Although, the lentil soup could've been out of a can from Trader Joe's. For our entrees, we got the mushroom risotto with truffle oil and their signature spaghetti & meatballs. Both were very solid dishes, and they didn't skimp on the truffle oil cuz you could smell it from a mile away. For dessert, we opted for the chocolate cake (sort of a souffle) and the marscapone cheesecake. Everything we had was definitely decent. But nothing was great. The service was a bit slow, but it was extremely busy so I'll give him that. 

And we were seated in this back alcove by the kitchen door which was not ideal. But it made for exceptionally priceless people watching as we were seated next to a young couple who proceeded to order "jungle juice" (that takes me back to my desperate underage drinking days) and shots of root beer schnaps after an attempt to "put a deposit" down on their bill with the waiter. Priceless...
author: Marie M.

description:
I've been here a few times for lunch in the past, but a recent visit reveals a nice remodel of the interior - it's a welcome change from the oak-y dark colors they had prior.

I had the caprese panini with fries - I was initially a little disappointed when the sandwich arrived - the sandwich was a little on the smallish side, and I was expecting it to have been put through a sandwich press. It looked liked the bread was toasted on the inside. 

I still did manage to enjoy the food.
author: Sean G.

description: Stumbled upon this place friday night when we were freezing, hungry and running out of time to eat. Didn't want to wait so we sat at the bar. Our bartender was nice and attentive. We started with wine (ive had better), olives and the fried ravioli (OMG!). After that I was actually pretty full but we had ordered the lasagna (which was very, very meaty!) and the orecchiette which was good, but to me could have had a little more veggies or added some chicken of something to break up the flavor a bit more. All in all I walked back to the hotel satisfied and with some cash still in my pocket.
author: h l.

description:
Despite being so close to Union Square, this is a pretty decent choice for Italian in the area. Usually Union Square area restaurants are over priced and underwhelming, Puccini & Pinetti was a welcome surprise for the area.

The portions are quite substantial, and prices are quite reasonable (at least for the area). Service is excellent, and do try the grilled Caesar salad - sounds strange, but actually quite tasty.

Update: After a second try, I have to down grade, a lot. Maybe last time I got lucky going during the week, or maybe I ordered just the right thing, but a second try reveled overall lackluster meals, and really pretty awful service. Too many tourists on top of it, just not quite far enough away from Union Square to be really good.
author: Ben K.

description:
I have been here twice now, and would have to say it's a solid three star experience.  Both times I felt my servers were minimal or just annoying.  The first time I went, the cocky waiter handed the credit card back to my date and loudly said "There ya go" looked at the name "Junior!" (Since he is named after his father  - who he has never met) and my date wanted to punch the guy. 

To be fair, there was an asian server (not  our actual server, but someone helping out) who brought us bread and refills and he was very nice.

Service aside - their bread is AWESOME.  I still crave it.  The actual food seems bland.  I've had eggplant parmigian, chicken caesar salad, and calamari.  The people I ate with have had Chicken Marisa and spaghetti and meatballs.  The calamari was pretty good.  I never walked out of there thrilled with anything, and for the prices you pay  ($12-18 for a plate) I would rather get a huge plate of linguini in the metreon and feel comfortable sitting down without having a server in my face every five minutes.

However, I will re-review this place once I stop in for happy hour.  I had a delicious cocktail - I think it was called Berries in the Snow.  Maybe not the best place for dinner, but for drinks?  Could be great.
author: Rei E.

description:
hidden gem in union square - not touristy!
really, really good food!
author: Deka M.

description: I came her on a Tuesday night. Their happy hour goes until 10pm on Mondays and Tuesdays. It was very crowded, but there was still room at the bar to sit. I ordered a $6 mojito, fries ($5) and Champagne ($3). Very cheap, but quality was not so great. I noticed that most of the people sitting around us did not finish their food. I'd come back, but only to try different food there.
author: Stephanie U.

description:
I came here today with my friend who works at the hotel next door and let me tell you... the service from Ian was TOP NOTCH!

Maybe because my friend worked next door, but he seemed pretty friendly... he brought us some olives (YUMMMM) on the house and even suggested some dishes (sorry!! didn't mention that I was vegetarian at the beginning of the meal!).  

OK, the bruschetta was AMAZING.  The balsamic vinegar that was on it was sweet and not too strong. The bread was warm, the tomatoes were delish (not too cold) and the goat cheese was SO SO SO good! It had the consistency of ricotta you buy from the grocery story to put in lasagna so it was easy to spread over the top of the tomatoes. Yummmmmm. 

We weren't really hungry so that's all we got. hahahaha, my friend also got the minestrone soup said it was really good.  Place looked really nice, heard happy hour is great here.

I was also v impressed with how many vegetarian options they had.  If I had been hungrier I would have ordered one of the pizzas or the mushroom ravioli! Yummm.

Anyways, cute place, good food, great service!
author: Stephanie Z.

description: I really like the atmosphere here- as long as you're not sitting in one of the back booths. I think it's best around happy hour for drinks and appetizers.. it's in kind of a questionable area of downtown/union square- a lot of homeless people flock to the window near those back tables if you're unfortunate enough to get one there. Good big bar, a lot of wine & like I mentioned before good happy hour. I believe it's everyday also- don't quote me. Wait staff is very attentiive, and the food isn't anything to rave about, but I have no complaints either. the short ribs LOOKED incredible- I regretfully didn't order them
author: Kimberly M.

description:
We went here for a family dinner with our kids, ages 8 & 11.  We told the waitress we had to be somewhere in an hour, so she made sure our food arrived promptly and with plenty of time to enjoy it.

We shared their fried calamari, which everyone enjoyed and was not overly breaded or greasy (tasted very fresh).  The warm spinach salad was delicious -- definitely my fave of everything we ate! -- and a meal in itself with the bread and dipping sauce.  Daughter ordered the kids' mac and cheese, and her sauce was so yummy we ate what she didn't finish.  Son ordered the kids pepperoni pizza; the leftover was dinner this evening, with both kids asking to have more after we all devoured what was left.  I ordered the orecchiette with fennel sausage, which was very good too (by the time it arrived I had filled up on bread and salad, so most of it was reheated for lunch today-yum!).  The only disappointment was husband's rib eye steak; even our son, who isn't too picky about his meat, was not impressed.

I was very impressed with the attentiveness of our server and the quality of the food (with the exception of the steak).  There was a long lag time between appetizers and main course, which I suspect was due to a line of pizzas waiting to cook in their small brick oven. But given the restaurant was packed with patrons and our time constraints, they did a great job getting us seated and served promptly.

The kids are asking to go back again.  We will definitely be back.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
My good friend and I went to San Fran on vacation, and one day, we really REALLY wanted Italian food. The place we wanted to go was NOWHERE to be found, and we stumbled upon this place as we walked on Ellis. We had no idea what to expect, but as soon as we got the food, we totally fell in love.

Before we even had our appetizers, they brought out bread, and the bread is SO fresh. Not only that, the olive oil we dipped it in was PERFECT. I have never tasted such delicious olive oil before. I believe it comes in bottles you can buy in the restaurants, but we chose not to...

The presentation of the food we ordered was so lovely. I almost didn't want to eat it because it looked so pretty. But eating it was definitely the highlight.

I would totally recommend eating at this place. Service is good, too. =)
author: Linda T.

description:
I first came here about a year ago.  I would have given it 4 stars, but they lost a point when they started to get skimpy on their $4 happy hour calamari!  When I first came here, the calamari was on a huge plate.  Then I came back just a month ago for happy hour cuz I had a craving of calamari, I thought maybe it was just that time I went.  They served the calamari on a smaller plate and less calamari.  Then I thought, maybe they  just ran out of the larger plates.  Turned out they've reduced their happy hour size, cuz I came back last week.  Same small plate and less serving of calamari but the same price!  

I feel jipped!  I'm dissapointed.  Not the best place to get happy hour. I had more hope.  I'm sure there are more in the area that serve drinks for less than $3/beer, wells.  Other than the calamari, one of my fave is the Pasta Nachos!  I hope they don't start getting skimpy on that either!!!
author: Christi S.

description:
My biggest dilemma when writing the review for this place, was whether to give it 1 star, or 2 stars.  I think i'm gonna give it 1.5 stars, and that's being generous.

So, it looked like it was good.  Packed restaurant, lively, etc.  We were here for a bday dinner, so we had a group of 12.  1 start for accomodating a larger than usual group.  However, things didn't improve.

It took the server probably 15 minutes just to get water.  Not good with 12 thirsty guests.  After the water came, we realized they were short a couple glasses.  So we brought it to our server's attention.  Time it took for her to bring more water........well, it just never came.  These little things do a lot to show the efficiency and service of the restaurant.

Then the food.  Well, what can I say about the food.  It just wasn't....tasty....at all.  I had the veal piccatta, and it was dry, and sour, and....dry....very dry.  What the hell is this crap that I'm eating!  And it wasn't just mine either.  Another one of our friend actually returned her dish because it tasted like crap and got something else.  All around the table, the consensus was that if they had to rate the food out of 10.....3 was the average score.  Not good....and not worth the jacked-up price.

So, finally, dessert time, which was a cake our friend made himself.  It wasn't from the restaurant.  They just brought to the restaurant so we could have it there.  The server brought it out and asked if we would like them to cut it up.  Sure...sounds good.

Mmmmm...the cake was goooood.  Thank you baking friend, for bringing some joy to our dinner.  And no thanks at all Puccini and Punani.

All seemed to end on a better note until the bill arrived..... 
[12 x Cake/Fee @ 3.50]

wtf??!!

uhhh...what is this?  As it turns out....they charge you to bring in your own cake....like a corkage fee....except for CAKE?!??!?!  WHAT THE?!?!?

This angers us!!!

oh...that extra half star...well, at least the restaurant looked decent.....
author: Tadd L.

description:
Visited the joint when I was in San Francisco for a gig.  Sure, it was conveniently located near the hotel, but food was also something to write about.  Pizza comes piping hot with nicely caramelized onions and juicy prosciutto teasing the appetite just right before the plump scallops with creamy sauce and cheesy risotto decorate the table.  Pomegranate sangria is a perfect company for the upbeat atmosphere in the room.

Though the place may be popular with tourists, I will go back again with others as a tourist.
author: Yoko M.

description:
Went here for lunch with two of my partners.  Had canneloni, which was updated, I  suspect for an easier presentation.  It had chunks of chicken, ricotta cheese and golden raisins.  The pasta was too thick, the sauce was waayyyyyy too thick and only a bechamel, no tomatoes or tomato sauce mixed in or accompanying the other ingredients.  The sauce was much too cheesy also.  Heavy, heavy, heavy.....the dish should be comforting, warm and light, not heavy and overly cheesy.  
Service was good, attentive and staff were pleasant.
They need to improve kitchen execution.
author: Ron T.

description: We stayed at the hotel across the street, not because this place was good. The coffee is one of the worst, very bitter. The house spaghetti was also bad, the meat sauce was more like chili and the taste was not good. I also had the chocolate molten dessert and the bread pudding both were terrible. The chocolate was like syrup baked in the oven and the bread pudding was chunks of bread in a dish. Even if this place is crowded do not be fooled.
author: Kimmy C.

description: HH with $3 wine and $3 gigantic bowl of olives.  'Nuf sed.
author: Nina L.

description:
My date and I got here around 6pm last night, hoping to enjoy a nice dinner before the play we were going to see.  Puccini & Pinetti did not disappoint!

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted promptly with a warm and friendly smile and sat at our table.  Before Jonah could pull my chair out for me, the person seating us beat him to it and ensured I was comfortable before he handed us our menus.  Andre, our server, had excellent recommendations. We shared the calamari, which was oerfectly crisp and whose sauce did not overpower its seasoned crust. I had the Chicken Marsala over spinach and Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes.  The dish was excellent- and I was pleasantly surprised that the Yukon potatoes held their own distinct taste even with the marsala sauce nearby.  JOnah had the risotto- one of the best I've tasted (yes, I ate some of his food)!  We had a warm truffle dessert a la mode and a mocha- a great paring indeed! They kept our beverages full and multiple staff members checked on us to make sure we were having a delicious experience. 

The place was clean, with nice huge windows one can use to people watch while eating- a great thing to do in downtown SF.  Overall a wonderful experience!
author: Ling S.

description: Dropped in an evening after work with friends. We all had a phenomenal meal.
author: chad d.

description:
Needed a quick bite the night we came into town, so the concierge at the Hotel Monaco (a Kimpton Hotel) directed us to the nearby Puccini and Pinetti, the restaurant of another Kimpton Hotel.  No doubt the recommendation was because of its ownership, but we took it at face value.  The hotels are great and the food at their neighboring restaurants has typically been very tasty as well.  This was definitely an exception.  

It took us an hour to get seated.  The waiter seated numerous parties before us, even though we were there first and requested to be seated at the bar to save time.  When we finally were served, it took them 10-15 minutes just to get us a menu.  When we did receive the food, it was subpar.  The selection was mediocre as well.  Steer clear of Pinetti and Puccini....it's definitely not worth it.
author: Zach S.

description:
Came here for an unfortunate happy hour. I can't deny, it is dirt cheap, but the atmosphere made me want to cry. The crowd was an awkward happy hour mix of disjointed family diners and cranky shoppers. It made me long for the Financial District, which is saying something.

I should have known better. I DID know better, but against my instincts I went to placate a friend. I'd trade all of my cheap beer (even the fat tire) and discount "pizza of the day" to have been somewhere else.
author: Sophie S.

description:
In general, I think this place is a little overhyped mainly because of its fancy looks and its location in downtown.

This place was recommended by a friend of my gf who said the food was good. Decided to come here after my gf strongly insisted we try it out. Went there without reservations with party of 4 and got seated at a table in the bar section after half hour wait. 

We were given menus after 3-4 minutes of waiting around, wondering if we'd be serviced. The prices range from $10-25. Typical "mid-fancy italian restaurant" prices. 

Ordered calamari which was good. I also liked the bread and the special olive oil + whatever "flakes" stuff it is they put in there. 

I won't bore you with all the details so let me get straight to the point. I ordered a $20 plate of Frutti di Marre that was absolutely good, pasta with a red seafood broth yum yum. Only problem is me and my gf decided to split. This plate is not one you can split. For $20 I expected a looot more pasta, but obviously this wasn't Buppa di Becca (sp?). Heck, I could go to Sbarro's and buy a $5 plate and get twice as much pasta. Sure I'm comparing apples to oranges but for $20, I expect a lot more pasta. If I ate this plate alone, I probably would still be hungry. I ended up eating bread to get myself full. 

Another problem - I ordered ice tea, emptied it in 15 minutes, and did NOT get a refill throughout the rest of the meal. What made it worse was my friend got a refill for his root beer, so I felt singled out on not getting a refill. And WAIT, that's not it. His refill wasn't even free, it was one of those damn "oh here's a refill, and we'll charge u later on the tab, sucker" refills.

I read the previous review that said the brought in their own cake and got charged $3/person. WTF was that, I would be outraged if that happened to me.

nothing special here, move onwards to the next italian restaurant please.
author: David N.

description:
Average at best Americanized Italian joint. Food was not what you'd expect from a good Italian restaurant. Being located around the Union Square you would think they would want to cater to a lot of tourists, they do, but no one (or most of them) won't be coming here, ever. Avoid if you can. There are better Italian places out there. 

Service was good - but that does not make up for lack of well cooked, less greasy Italian food. It ain't just about the cheese... :)
author: Neeraj M.

description:
Try this one for lunch!
My husband and I attended one of San Francisco's city walks (Bawdy and Naughty).  Go to http://www.sfcityguides.org to see a full list of free SF walking tours!
After the tour, we went to Puccini & Pinetti for lunch.  What a great choice.  Elegant decor.
Wonderful service.
Good wine.
Good food.
Yup, they had it all.
We ordered:
Smoked turkey sandwich combo ($11.50)
Italian Flatbread sandwich ($11.50)
Bottle of wine ($39)

The combo is the way to go!  That is a half sandwich, small cesar salad and a cup of minestrone.  My husband had the flatbread sandwich.  It came with french fries.  He coveted my meal the entire time we were there!
The restaurant is very close to the Powell BART station.  We would definitely try P&P for dinner.
author: Carol H.

description:
Great for happy hour work downtown, great food, delicious cocktails, nice service.  
I LOVE their Rosemary Lemon Martini --it is a little peice of sweet, cool, heaven.  I could drink them allll night long.  The rosemary sprig cuts the sweet of the lemondrop, and makes it cooooool and tastey.
The sangria is a pretty good treat too-- a little spicey like cinnamon or nutmeg or clove is in it, adding nicely to the wine and fruit.
$5 apps from the bar menu-- all I've had are good, love the pizza, the polenta, the truffle fries, and the breaded ravioli (there are only three tho -keep in mind).
Always a win, but I think earlier in the week when it's less crowded is optimum.  who happy hours on a monday?  I do.
author: kerry a.

description: I just had dinner with my sister here tonight. This is a great spot for anyone that wants good inexpensive food but still needs that special service. The staff here is great, every time I've been here for dinner or happy hour, the waiters are always nice and attentive which is hard for a place that has so much walk-in traffic. Another great part is that the wait time is never that bad, the restaurant was full today but we only had to wait 20 min ( keep in mind this is a Friday night) and that was without a reservation!
author: Jess B.

description: Awful breakfast! The cream on the table was curdled in all 3 containers. The eggs in the eggs Benedict was hard boiled for all 4 guests in our party. I do have to say the server was very nice. Wouldn't go back.
author: Julie H.

description: Came here on a busy Friday night. It was full house and my friends and I managed to snag a table. It was passed the happy hour time but we got the Yelp drinks (half priced). I tried the Side Car and the Pomegranate Sangria. I wasn't expecting much but I thought both drinks were ok. The Sangria was watered down a bit. I liked the appetizers. We had the calamari, cheese/spinach pizza, and bruschetta. I especially liked the brushcetta with the warm stewed tomatoes and goat cheese spread. The atmosphere is festive and we were had a great time. They have a variety of great appetizers on the menu.
author: Candace F.

description:
I'll admit that my friends and I wanted to go to another restaurant but as it was closing in an hour and there was still a wait for seats, we decided to settle with Puccini & Pinetti.

Service:  Our waitress was very nice and friendly.  Every time she served us anything, she said "It looks delicious...I'll come back later to make sure it tastes delicious too."  Anyone that worked at the restaurant who walked by our table was very courteous and friendly, saying "hi" and asking how we were doing.  Superb!  When someone's cup was empty, their drink was refilled right away or a new one was brought.  

Food:  We were a bit rushed this day so our main courses seemed to take a while to be served.  The potato and leek soup was yummy but the parsley on top, although aesthetic, added a gross parsley taste to the soup which I did not enjoy.  My friend and I ordered the chicken marsala, a sauteed chicken breast on top of spinach and mashed potatoes in a mushroom marsala sauce.  The sauce ruined the entire dish; it did not taste like a marsala sauce..maybe it wasn't reduced enough?  I tasted too much wine and it was very watery and swallowed my entire plate.  It was disappointing.  My other friend got the butternut squash gnocchi and said it was very dense but tasty.  He got about half way before he felt too full to continue.  We ended with the tiramisu that came with a vanilla cream sauce that tasted like melted ice cream.  The cake was in a odd-shaped wedge slice and didn't taste that much like tiramisu but it was still very good.  

All of the food was good but not spectacular, and the portions were very tiny.  However, service was great!
author: Jenny W.

description: Best happy hour ever! Margarita pizza and some vino, perfect before a little shopping! Casey is an amazing bartender!!!
author: Tiffani D.

description:
I went for dinner on a monday night, while in town for a business trip. Kinda stumbled upon it, and I wasn't sure why we stopped here, with so many restaurants stacked within the 4 blocks radius of here. But we went.

A playoff game was on so bar area was filled. Not too big of a bar area, so it didn't take away from the ambiance. It never got loud or rowdy. Had a lounge-y feel to the place (especially the front bar area). We were seated towards the back of the restaurant. Open kitchen along the side of the restaurant space (long floorplan.). So you see the action if you sit close enough. They have some beers on tap (anchorstein, bud light, the standard stuff..) and others in bottles. Pretty good wine list. 

Actual menu is focused and not very large. This is perfect! Restaurants who try to offer everything usually doesn't do well in anything. Puccini has a mission- to offer seasonal italian meal, with home cooked feeling- and it does it well. The people in my party got: Short Rib with pesto mashed potatoes (the person liked it a lot, noting that it wasnt heavy and the meat had a nice tenderness without losing texture), lasagna bolognese (before i checked in, the person already wiped the plate clean.. the portion was good too! so he must have enjoyed it!), home made parpadelle with prociutto, spinach and asparagus (I got to try a little. It needed more "umph" acid, salt or some kind of seasoning. the cream sauce was ok. the pasta was well made. Very home made looking. the person in my party liked it, but wished there was more meat/ prociutto and not as much greens). I had the Frutti de Mare (seasonal seafood stew, tomato based saffron flavored broth, served with linguini and crostini). Good healthy portion. Generous with the shrimp and calimari and mussels. The broth was delicious to soak up the crostini with. But i do wish i had a little something in the broth. While the saffron was nice (without overpowering) it lacked a little acid to cut it, and some kick (maybe a little pepper?) Overall it was delicious. I would order it again. 

Entrees were between $20-$30. It wont break the bank. The place is good for business lunch/ dinner, as well as dates actually. The back back of the restaurant has a separate room, that is lighted more dimly, and quieter.
author: Felicia T.

description: The worst service ever!!! Very rude took forever to serve our party food was not that great sat us in the back near the kitchen/employee entrance away from all other customers when restaurant was half empty overall horrible experience!!!!!! Will never go back again!
author: Alejandria E.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place for a while now and finally have. We didn't have a reservation so we had to wait about 45 minutes, which is pretty good for Union Square on a Friday night. I wish the place was a little bigger, as it was loud, loud, LOUD and is often packed. Our waiter was really helpful but at times service was a bit slow.  As for the food...

Bruschetta was the best of my life!! It's not really your traditional bruschetta, the bread seemed to be some sort of rustic white bread that was grilled (sooooo good), and the rest was like a caprese salad... little balls of fresh mozzarella, fresh basil, tomatoes, and also grilled onions. Yum. I opted for the chicken sauteed in marsala wine that came with spinach and mashed potatoes, which was also delicious. My usual picky eater companion had spaghetti and meatballs which he seemed to enjoy as well.  For dessert, tiramisu, which is my favorite dessert but is pretty mediocre here.  They also had good cocktails, so good I wanted to lick the glass after I finished my raspberry lemontini...

Definitely not a good place for a romantic date!!! Don't be surprised if your voice gets hoarse after yelling above all the noise.
author: Nicole z.

description:
My friend was in town with the production of "Legally Blonde" and we were searching for a post-show spot to sit and chat.  Even though the kitchen had JUST closed when we walked in, the staff were really accommodating and kind.  They whipped up a delicious warm gooey chocolate cake and a cheesecake with too-sweet sauce.  

No matter, they were gracious enough to let two old friends sit and chat for an hour after not having seen each other for several years.  For that, I'm grateful to Puccini & Pinetti.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Had to try this place, as I live right next door.  We went on a Sunday night, so not very crowded.  The service was good.  That is saying something, as since I moved out here in June, I've been extremely unimpressed with San Francisco/Berkeley waitstaff.  The waitress was friendly without being overbearing, and our water glasses were promptly filled.  I would have only given two stars if not for the service.

They have a decent beer selection on draft.  But the food?  Forgettable.  I started with the minestrone soup.  I like the Olive Garden's better.  This tasted like it came from a can.  I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs for my entree.  Okay, but not particularly flavorful.  My husband ordered the special (tilapia picatta).  Very bland.  Even worse was the price, $23.  

Would we go back?  For dinner, no.  They are renovating in early September and we received a free dessert coupon.  So maybe for dessert and beer...
author: Jory R.

description:
A nice place in a great location. The staff is nice and engaging, and the food was pretty good though in a higher price bracket than I would normally go for

Ordered Saltimbocca for main dish. Very good veal & potatoes though the sauce was a bit too salty (mmm but salt is good). My friend ordered Frutti del mar (sp?) which was a seafood stew/pasta and I tried some of it. Quite fresh I give it a thumbs up.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Went with a VERY large group here, and left very happy...partly because I didn't have to pay.

I ordered scallops, which came with a parmesan and prosciutto risotto. The risotto was extremely rich, too salty, but still tasty. The scallops were seared, very sweet and very good. The best scallops I've had in a long time actually...

Everyone left pleased and full. Prices seemed reasonable. Also, the place was pleasantly casual, as we were all dressed like total bums and didn't feel too out of place.
author: Ryan L.

description:
The Gina is not impressed.

Well, yes this restaurant is a block away from the Powell cable car station.  That can explain the average bottle of Merlot being priced at $55 on the menu. But wait, this is just the beginning of mediocrity.

First of all, their wine list is really not good and seriously overpriced. Stick to beer, please.  We were seated in a section where the server barely had time to say Hi to us. We almost walked out but he finally did show up. To be fair, the focaccia bread and the tomato/olive oil mix they bring are lovely.  The rest is only average. I ordered the spring salad (actually not bad, order dressing on the side or they will drown it in oil). The special scallop dish was not anything to write home about: the scallops were overcooked and way fishy and yet again, way too drowned in butter and oil. To top it all off, the audience seemed to consist 50% of children (8 PM on a Saturday night.) 

Without ordering a bottle of wine or deserts, our bill was over $80. All that in a place with no linen on the tables.

Yawn. Next please!
author: Gina M.

description: I love this place for happy hour! They have great drinks & really good food. I recommend getting the bruschetta or the pizza. The only downside to this place is that the bar area is fairly small, so get there early.
author: Billijo J.

description: For the price, I expected way more than what I got. My party of two got here at about 8:30 on a Saturday night (night before the SF Marathon), the wait was at 50 minutes so we decided to order to go and take it back to our hotel across the street, Parc FF. While waiting for our food, we got to look at what everyone else was eating and the food looked absolutely delicious. However when I finally sat down to eat my meal, Spaghetti and meatballs with bolognese sauce, it was good for the first couple bites but it ended up being extremly salty. I needed to eat the bread in order to balance the flavor out. My sister agreed, her pasta dish was also salty. At $18/dish I expect not to have to drink a gallon of water after eating what should have been a carbolicious meal.
author: Min K.

description:
This is one of the best Italian places I have been to in this city, though I have not been to the other places yet. 

The foccacia bread and the sauce was amazing it even had  a couple of capers. This is the best pairing I have ever had. I have had horrible bread pairings where they give you cold butter and sourdough. This time they had this vegetarian mixture with the capers and whatnot and it was really different but in a very nice way. I thoroughly enjoyed it. 

The only reason I did not give 5 stars was that I did not like the dish I had the last  time went. It was prepared well but I am not a fan of anything spicy. The clams and linguine was a rather large dish and I had a difficult time finishing. The dish was prepared well it just was not my favorite. I liked the clams just not the rest of the pasta, cause of the large kick to it. Not a fan of spicy dishes, but if you like it go ahead and have it. 

The soup though was amazingly well done, butternut squash with a hint of maple syrup or whatever it was that sweet. It was sweet and savory and the added crushed pepper worked really well to bring out the flavor. 

The service was amazing as well, the waitress took my order quickly and thankfully I had a reservation through opentable.com so I had no wait whatsoever. She kept refilling my water and my bread, and i think i overfilled on the bread. On top of that the entire staff seemed to really cool. 

The time before I enjoyed a lot more, the entree that is. The calamari was also very good as well and nice and well done. 

The wow factor for me was the Cioppino it had an amazing combination seafood. I actually said wow when I put it in my mouth. The flavors just worked out pretty well to a great tasting dish. The chef did an amazing job of making the dish and I wish I had ordered it instead.
author: Christopher C.

description:
I got their spaghetti, which apparently was their "best dish" as the menu suggested. The sauce was quite runny, and not thick (as I prefer). The plus was that the sauce had nice big chunks of tomatoes in it. Fresh grated Parmesan cheese was also good, but this should just be expected. The meatballs lacked in the same way most meatballs lack in restaurants, they were dry and cardboardy tasting (seriously, trader joe's party meatballs taste better). 

The service was so-so. Almost like a on-the-go service where your server will drop your check off on the side of the table as she's walking by. Perfect if you want to be left alone, but not so for grabbing the server's attention. 

Conclusion: This should be a $5 restaurant rather than a $20 one.
author: Gravity S.

description: Great happy hour! $3 glasses of wine and champagne, plus other drink specials. Extra long happy hours, Sundays 8-close! The calamari and fried buffalo mozzarella balls are delicious with marinara!
author: Sue W.

description:
It was a last minute late dinner option as my girlfriend and I strolled around San Fran on vacation and so we stopped it.  We originally were going to get a margarita pizza a salad and a pasta to share until...the server told us of the evening's special which happened to be Lamb Shank over Creamy Parm Polenta.  I'm not much of a meat eater, but when something is good comes along and it's a special I will certainly indulge...and so I did.  We had the margarita pizza which was Fantastic!!!!!  The fresh cheese atop was so creamy and it was perfectly crispy and chewy with the fresh basil you cannot go wrong.  Now, onto the special...the lamb shank was out of sight delicious.  I have never had a better lamb shank and the cheesy polenta hands down was amazing.  My girlfriend got the gnocchi and it was very boring so don't bother.  After speaking with the server and advising that the $32 for the lamb special was amazing I'd even pay double it was THAT good the good news is she said it had positive reviews and it may very possibly become part of the regular menu.  So if it does I highly recommend getting that and the pizza you will NOT be disappointed!!  Also, the brussel sprouts were undercooked and less than desirable.  Stick with the goods!!  The 5 stars was for the pros hands down!

Pros: Lamb Shank over Creamy Parm Polenta, Margarita Pizza
Cons: Gnocchi, Brussel Sprouts
author: Melanie P.

description:
when i think of what middle america thinks italian food is, i think of this place.

i came here on a business lunch, so everything was expensed -- usually free food for me makes the food taste better; however, this place just isnt that good.

to start off the menu had a bunch of typos -- it definitely did not look like these menus were printed daily...they should have been checked and fixed by now. or they should of at least ran spell check. i expect this at chinese restaurants, but not "italian"-american restaurants owned by a large corporation. no, i dont want some timamisu or casar salad.

i however, did want a salad and desset along with my meal so i got the business lunch deal. i forgot the price as i didnt pay, but i believe it was a 3 courser including salad or soup, an entree of either lasagna or chicken marsala, and tiramisu.

the salad was decent -- you cant really fuck up a simple salad too bad, but thats where the food went downhill. the chicken marsala was bleh and tiramisu also forgettable

so if you are a tourist from say bumblefuck, nebraska and staying at the hotel right next door, by all means, try this place. you might actually really like this place. im probably soundy snobby, but san franciscans and seasoned diners should visit pretty much any other kimpton restaurant.
author: justin t.

description: Service was sketchy at best.  Food was okay, but not great.
author: Barbara S.

description: Great appetizers. Fun bar. Good prices.  What more can you ask for? Also a shout out to our waitress Stacey, who despite being crazy busy on Saturday night, was professional and made our dinner all the better.
author: Paula A.

description: The service was excellent, food wasn't.  The lasagna tasted like Chef Boyardee.  It was also very loud in there, so we were yelling at each other through the entire meal.
author: Kjersten F.

description: The bread with the olive oil and caper sauce was AMAZING! So much better than what most Italian places do with just olive oil and herbs. The calamari was fantastic and a good portion. Also had their Mista salad and it was really good! Their champagne vinaigrette was fantastic and full of flavor! The hubby and I shared the Fruti de Mari. Full of seafood instead of mostly pasta. Great flavors. Really wanted to try a dessert but was way too full to eat more!
author: Rosie M.

description: Been here plenty of times..I love the fact one of the chefs have been here 9 years and they don't have much turn-over..very good thing in the restaurant biz..I had fruti de mare and the ceaser..the seafood was fresh and pasta perfect and anchovies delish
author: Athena C.

description:
Ive taken the Mussels as a starter, very good! The salsa was incredible!

The main course, some pasta with seafood, was tasteless. But maybe it was because the mussels had strong taste.
author: Jose C.

description:
This place rocked! I was very impressed with the food (although disappointed that they were out of one of the house fav lasagna bolognese) & the service was impeccable! 
I didn't appreciate being seated straight across from the kitchen door, so they gladly relocated us :) 
The head server (I believe) came by several times to check on us & make sure we were OK. She (sorry, I cant remember your name, but you were very nice & I really appreciate it!!) really gave us that personal attention - which was great, since I chose P&Ps as the right spot to celebrate my sister's 50th bday. 
Our main server (Kirk - Loves ya!!) was AWESOME!! His suggestions were right on par. We killed the bruschetta & Cesar salad. I tried my best to pack away the 2nd house fav (spaghetti & meatballs), but sadly was unable to do so that night (but it was great the next day! lol). I did however manage to pack away a couple of spoonfuls of the delightful CHEESECAKE **drools** YUM!!
CHEF CAME OUT & brought us the main course himself! That was a shocker - What a TREAT!!! 
Everyone wished my sister a Happy Birthday, which made her feel very special. 
Thanks so much for helping make the evening so wonderful!! 
We will definitely be back to Puccini & Pinettis :)
author: Candace G.

description: I have seen this place but never ventured in, I was referred by a free Bruschetta, grilled crostini, stewed tomatoes, goat cheese, basil certificate from an on line service. It was a rowdy crowd and I went on a Thursday night. I ordered the free appetizer and I was very disappointed with the flavor of it! It literally tasted more like can stewed tomatoes. The bartender Eugenia on the other hand did recommend the Calamari but failed to mention their happy hour specials (which was still going on all that night) that I found out after the fact and from a local customer that frequents the place after work. To say the least I don't think this place rocks.
author: Marco R.

description:
Not a solid experience...
The food wasn't really all that bad - bruschetta had an interesting smoky flavor - but the front of the house is beyond disorganized.

Waitress never bothered to list the specials to us nor did she figure that perhaps we DIDN'T want ALL of our food all at once.  Really?? Bruschetta with a side of King salmon, leek and potatoes...hmmm...interesting concept.
All that aside the food could have been a lot worse...however...

...the end of the meal was an interesting experience.  We sat there waiting...for something, anything to happen.  I tried to wave to my waitress and she just stared off into space.  15 minutes after being finished, a busboy arrived to clear our table.  He proceeded to take what he could care and head off.  Then nothing happened.  With 2 empty large plates and all our bread plates still sitting on the table, we sat.  Waitress never surfaced to ask us if we wanted dessert or coffee.  Finally 10 minutes later, a completely different busboy showed up to clear the rest of the table.  VERY efficient.  

When our waitress finally showed up she non-chalantly asked me if I WAS WAITING FOR HER...hmmm...what the fuck else would I be doing exactly...my  plate is empty, I've been waving at your for 20 minutes and I want some tea and dessert.  In any case, she finally took our tea and coffee orders, never offered a dessert menu and just seemed aloof the whole time.  She was a nice girl but either distracted or inexperienced.  The place happened to be out of earl grey so instead of asking me what I wanted as a substitute, she just brought me some other random black tea.  Luckily enough, I like breakfast blends and took what she gave me but WTF...

The speed of food deliver is a major plus for any restaurant but it has no bearing on the QUALITY of your service or the food itself.  I saw other tables being taken care of much better than ours so give this place a shot, however, understand there is a chance your meal will be a disorganized mess.
author: Sean M.

description:
I was really impressed. Limited menu, but great food and very reasonable prices. The Service was the best that I have had in a REALLY long time, as far back as I can remember. We went on a very crowded Friday night and were made to feel like we were the only ones in the restaraunt. As far as the atmosphere goes, there were suprisingly a lot of families, my group was a party of 6 so they put us in the back with them, but I think a smaller group may seat you in the 'adult' section in the front. 
All in all it was worth it - definitly will return
author: Maureen M.

description: I've been here twice, once for New Years Eve and again for a birthday celebration (bot large groups) and I have been impressed both times.  Good food and good service.  It is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for!
author: Tony H.

description: WOW!!! This place is perfect ;) first off my host ( I think her name is Katy) was super sweet and very courteous. We were sat in about 15mins-not bad. My girlfriend had the short ribs and I had the beet salad w/ chicken Parm. The food was delicious. The best part was our server-Ian!! He was funny, polite, and attentive. Can't wait to come back!!!!
author: Nathan R.

description: Awesome dinner. Excellent pastas and short ribs. Order the bruschetta!  Skip the rib eye.
author: Alexa S.

description:
came here with my girlfriends for some good food and good conversation. nice atmosphere (not too quiet not too loud) and very friendly service. wait staff helped us pick the perfect wine. but underwhelmed by the food. 

complimentary bruschetta-- that was great! 
frutti de mare-- looked good and my friend liked it
short ribs-- a disappointment to me and my other friend. beef was cooked just right, nice and tender, but there was hardly any flavor. the menu also said it was in a red wine sauce, so we were expecting something like a reduction with a bit of acidity. but the sauce was also bland and kind of ketchupy. we had to add salt several times, and then just gave up on it. the mashed potatoes were good though.
tiramisu for dessert-- a bit soggy but decent.

in the past my friend had the chicken marsala and liked it.
author: Della Q.

description: I was really disappointed with the food here. The service and wine was fantastic, but my gnocchi was super disappointing. It was not a very cohesive dish (see photos). The other pasta at our table was the angel hair special and I thought that one was better, but nothing to write home about. I might be open to come back to this place for happy hour or a glass of wine, but would probably pass on the pastas.
author: Jessica H.

description: SUPERB SUNDAY HAPPY HOUR All Day!... $3 house wine (which was pretty good actually) and most appetizers in the $5-7 range.  I thought this was a pretty touristy spot, but it turned out to be quite tasty and very warm/friendly.  I'll definitely go back!
author: Debby C.

description:
Last night 4 colleagues and I went here for a meeting. We'd made a reservation requesting a specific table which is out of the way and quiet. We told them we were having a meeting and did not want to be seated near any large parties. When we arrived we were seated next to a 10-person party at such close proximity we were practically sitting in each other's laps. It was extremely unpleasant. The wait-staff were very kind while explaining there was "nothing they could do" but the cloyingly nice attitude while staunchly refusing to seat us where they said they would (the table we wanted was open when we arrived, by the way) was EXTREMELY LAME.

The food -- as indicated otherwise on this site, is uninspired. I'm giving 2 stars for pleasant (though not accommodating) wait-staff, and food that's not horrible. I would only go here if I was in the neighborhood and hated Indian food -- because New Delhi restaurant across the street is far superior.
author: Elise B.

description: Our first experience with P&P was a total disappointment due to the fact that we finally found an amazingly yummy restaurant on our last night in town. We found P&P while walking back to our hotel (Parc 55) and decided to try it out ,  we were so glad that we did. We were so impressed that on our yearly trip to SF we came here first.  Great service and great food. I didn't feel out of place when I brought my 10 month old along.
author: Fae L.

description: I know this review is outdated but better late than never. We ate here about 5 years ago just prior to seeing the Jersey Boy's. 5 stars to the Boy's. Fabulous show. Now back to the eatery. Place was packed. I recommend reservations of forget it. We had our evening scheduled down to the last minute. We arrived on time, it was raining no less, we were seated then we started watching the clock food was ok. The service was slow. It took a rather long time for our meal to be brought to us. Just this last weekend we ate across the street @ First Crush. Now that was nice. See my review under First Crush. Nothing really to write home about with Puccini and Pinetti.  Very noisy, parking street if your lucky, food ok nothing to write home about. Haven't been back since and don't plan on it. We believe in trying a new restaurant and not going back to the same old same old. How else are you going to find out about places.
author: Nancy M.

description: We went here on a Friday night before heading to see "Young Frankenstein" at the Golden Gate Theatre. Our party of 4 had 6pm reservations, and we were seated right away. Service was a bit slow since the place was very busy, but we were glad it was still quiet enough to be able to hold a conversation. The food was yummy! We started with bruschetta (delicious, and complimentary with theatre tickets-- a $10 value) and a margherita pizza (fresh & creamy mozzarella!). Our entrees were tasty, too-- we had the short ribs with pesto mashed potatoes (the star of the dish), lasagna and spaghetti & meatballs (perfect if you're craving pasta), and a warm spinach salad (I heard no complaints). I'd definitely recommend this spot if you're heading to Golden Gate Theatre, as it was a quick 4-block walk and well worth the money.
author: Sarah W.

description: From out of town, dropped in here for dinner. Had the margherita pizza and asparagus. Both were good. Waiter knew nothing about the wine list and was unprofessional more than once. I'd suggesting picking a better restaurant in the area.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Wish the service matched the food. Expect slow and poor service. Had a bug in my scotch and had to ask for it to be removed from the bill. Plenty of other places to try in the area.
author: Matthew V.

description: Went there for happy hour. Food and drinks were delicious and reasonably priced. It gets crowded so make sure to give yourself time to wait for a seat! Loved the house wine!
author: Ashley L.

description:
When I walked by, I checked out the menu and thought that my friend and I should eat here.  We were both visiting Frisco and wanted some Italian near by our hotel.  The wine selection was nice with a choice of some nice italian half bottles.  The starter Misto salad was very good.  I ordered the Butternut Squash Gnocchi and my friend ordered the Bolognese Lasagna.  Her's was like a squared hamburger.  There was way too much meat in it.  My gnocchi came out like a plate of roasted potatoes and cubed butternut squash.  When I first saw it, I thought...hmmm, interesting but probably tasty.  Not.  It was very bland and dry.  Gnocchi should still be light and fluffy, but instead it was hard and starchy.  I had to ask for a side of marinara, just to add some flaver.   So, we both weren't fans of our meals and we're still craving something, so of course we had to gander at the dessert menu.  She got the Lava chocolate torte thingy, which was more like a brownie topped with vanilla ice cream.  I got the trio Gelato...more like watered down ice cream.  
The costs of the meals are higher than the quality.  Next time, we'll be hitting up North Beach.
author: Diana D.

description: Preetttyyyyyy gooooddddd.  They were out of the lasagna when I went there, sp the Capellini it is.  It was pretty good, very filling.  The creme brulee was excellent as well.  It's connected to our hotel (Hotel Abri) so if you really don't feel like going far, it's an exceptional place to dine.
author: Olivia M.

description: Not business friendly. Real hassle to split check. Would not go back based on the hoops we had to jump through. Food was just ok.
author: Michael B.

description: I had the mushroom ravoli. It was very rich and creamy. Pretty good.
author: Arlene E.

description: Great place for Happy Hour! Good location too! It does get a little crowded after work, so beware! $4 wine and $4 pizzas! Its a good idea to order multiple glasses of wine before the 6pm deadline...the waiters tend to be a tad bit slow here.
author: Brittany H.

description: Yummy Pomengranate Martinins.  Had the ginormous rolatini thingy and that was pretty tasty.  Very rich.  Don't get the Caprese as the balsamic they use is overly sweet and a bit like caramel.  Caramel flavor es no bueno over mozzarella. Service was great but the server (a chica) kept winking at me?  WTF?
author: Joyhan S.

description: Solid 3 stars.  This place ain't bad, but it ain't amazing either.  Great happy hour!  $3 and $4 appetizers and drinks.  I mean that is practically unheard of in this city.  By that alone it makes this place great.  I had a whole meal there for under $10.  Good place for groups.  Service was okay.  Kind of cheesy decor.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Food was average nothing special in fact . I think we should have walked over to the Westfield mall and the food would have been more exciting.... Our waitress however was a doll ...  I ordered some mussels in wine sauce and the mussels were just awful . I didn't even eat it . It was pure sand so she credited the dish ... so one star for the food and two stars for the service...
author: michelle r.

description: Warning:  This review is probably slightly biased since my friend knew the bartender, so we got taken care of fairly well.  Quick service and free drinks will do that.  However, on a totally food tasting perspective, I got the fettuccini herb chicken dish with spinach.  I never knew alfredo sauce could taste that good.  It was the most buttery and delicious nectar of the gods that I have ever had.  The steak was tender and delicious.  The breaded eggplant with garlic spaghetti was fa-boo.  There was so much minced garlic in the noodles that you could see the smell vapor radiate out of our mouths.  Normally that could be bad, but hell, being single has its benefits occasionally.  Prices are a little steep, but due to the sampling of the other dishes, I took half of mine home with me.  Can't wait to have it for dinner tonight.
author: Chris M.

description: I'm a fan of this place purely for it's Happy Hour.  You really cannot beat their $4 house wine and $4 pizza at Happy Hour and the Pizza is really good.  If you were visiting from out of town and have to eat on own, your dinner at the bar can be less than $20!  The restaurant went through a little face lift and did change their menu with smaller sized Happy Hour offerings but they do have awesome Truffle Parmesan Fries at $5 and great Pizzas and Calamari to go with your drinks.  The Happy Hour Sangria and Martinis are delicious!  Wait service depends on who you get as they are always busy and it could be hard to flag someone down for orders.  You can't beat their Happy Hour prices and it keeps me coming back.
author: Elaine L.

description: Good food, service and ambiance if a little generic. The papardelle is very good, the tiramisu just ok. Bar is pretty happening. Tough to do better at this price in hotel-heaven.
author: Vincent P.

description:
This place needs to be cheaper. I would give it a much better review. I've been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. I do think I saw an advertisement once when I went to watch David Sedaris at the War Memorial Opera House, that said if you attended a show at the Opera House you could get 15% off for dinner at Puccini if you brought your ticket with you.

Either ways, $18.95 for spaghetti and meatballs (their signature dish, and not a big serving either) is just not a good deal. It tasted really delicious though, and had a relatively overwhelming garlic flavor, which I happen to like :) I still prefer Chow's spaghetti + meatballs (and their portion size and price). I've also tried the frutti di mare (a big serving, and it looks like ciopinno and comes w/ crostini), grilled chicken panini with pesto (their lunch special of the day), ahi tuna appetizer (humongous portion, might as well be an entree, and it also comes with crostini and eggplant), and the complimentary bread and dipping oil (complete with sun-dried tomatoes and peas).

The first time I was here I had a terrible dining experience, really not the restaurant's fault though. We were sitting next to a group of overweight, over-aged, overly-drunk wierdos from the Sunset area, and they were drunk and screaming about their lost youth. Seriously they all had a story to tell or something to vent about but they didn't seem to understand the concept of waiting for someone to finish their story before beginning theirs, so instead everyone just yelled over one another until the loudest person won. The person that won repeatedly was a woman who kept screaming "B*tches and HO's! B*********tches and HOOOOOO's!" for no apparent reason, until another woman won over by yelling at the top of her lungs "METALLICCAAAAAAA BAABBBYYY!!!!!" until another woman beat her and yelled "RENEEE IS A F*ING B*TCH@(*#&$@!!~~!!!!!!!". That same woman ended up tripping (on nothing) and falling on her ass right next to my seat and looking at me and screaming.

It was amazing... I felt like I was watching a sad sitcom. Anyway, I digress. Moral of the story, if you have the disposable income and have the foresight to ask to be reseated right away if are near an obnoxious group of idiots, this is not a bad place to go.
author: ting b.

description: Came in for the yelp week specials. Their sangria is absolutely amazing! You can eat at the bar so there wasn't really a wait even on a friday night. Food was terrific, particularly the crab cakes. The service was prompt and my friend and I left with two drinks each and about three appetizers to share for only about 20 bucks each including the tip. I'll definately be back!
author: Emma H.

description:
Nothing is outstanding about this place -- service was mediocre, ambiance maybe below mediocre and food - blase, nothing great.  In fact, the one redeeming thing about this place was the cesar salad - it was actually really, really good.  The BF really liked the focacia (sp) bread and tapenade they put down at your table right when you get there.  I wasn't the biggest fun, the bread seemed a little stale and the tapenade's taste was just too overwhelming.  I got the chicken marsala which taste fine but seemed like it had was frozen at some point and then just re-warmed.  The BF's pasta was bland - it was the fettuccine with the prosciutto and I guess nice that it wasn't drenched in a heavy creamy sauce, but some flavor would have been OK.  
If you are going to go - seems like it is a good idea to make reservations, I think a lot of tourists come here because it was crowded but not really like crowded full of SF peeps.  Also - they seem to be able to accomodate a lot of large groups - large as in number of people in the group, not large as in larger people groups.
author: Katie P.

description: I only went here because I was starving and craving Italian food. I didn't know what to expect. I was with my boyfriend and he suggested we try it out.  It's casual and fun...great bar atmosphere.  We ordered the halibut and capardelle..so good! Oh yeah, the mozzarella balls for an appetizer are great too. Friendly waiter, good atmosphere (if you like it a little loud) and great drink & food. I was always under the impression that this place was for tourists, but it was really a great place to eat and have a few beers .  It's so refreshing to be pleasantly surprised sometimes.
author: C S.

description: Service was excellent and FAST.  We had to go to a theater performance post dinner and got in and out in under 40 minutes (just let the wait(er/ress) know.  I had the cesar which was decent and the chicken pasta was pretty good.
author: Jared F.

description: i love their hh. pizza was good, pasta nachos were ok,. drinks were on point :)
author: Anne A.

description: For an Italian place they had only a Margarita pizza and it wasn't too great. Disappointing and not great food.
author: Jacob C.

description: Referred by the hotel concierge. Not bad. Touristy !!!
author: Jay R.

description: The food isn't really worth the price. Of course, my party was being stingy and I ended up paying for half of someone's pasta (psh!) and some of their appetizers. The service was fantastic! Our waitress was very attentive and offered to holla at some people at another table. Because it was my friend's "birthday" we got some free chocolate cake, which was pretty good. The atmosphere and service is fun, but don't count on getting the greatest food.
author: Diane A.

description: Have to give this one a "meh."  We went for dinner and I got the margherita pizza to have something small-- really a lame pizza.  Lots of tomato-flavored dough, some fresh mozzerella, but I left about half of the pizza since it was only dough without much sauce.  My husband had the spaghetti, which he said was fine.  Drinks were very expensive, and they hide the cheaper options at dinner (for instance-- they offered one glass of Prosecco for $11, but during the day there are 3 other champagne options for cheaper).  The HH prices seem good.  We were there at 2:45 pm (HH started at 3) and even then our bartender made us pay full price for the drinks.  The service is indifferent and they really don't care if you were there or not.  I vote, find somewhere else.
author: Lauren B.

description: good happy hour food, strong mojitos, cheap beer
author: Christine M.

description: Their happy hour is cheap!  $3 drinks and appetizers.  What a bargain.  Came here yesterday after checking out the "invite only" preview at Bloomingdales with my non-yelper friend.  I had a glass of the house red (which was not bad) and we split the pasta nachos (GOOD!!) and the fried calamari.  We sat next to this very chatty woman who, i think, is a P&P happy hour regular.  She seemed a little scattered but was giving us lots of recommendations on what's good on the menu.  I might come back to try stuff from the regular menu, but I don't know if it can beat the cheap bill from happy hour.
author: Kris L.

description: Went there for dinner and drinks with friends.  Food was awesome, service was awesome.  Then as I went towards the restroom (in the hotel it is attached too) a little brown mouse ran past me and towards the restaurant door.  That is why I couldn't give it 4 stars....if a mouse is involved in any dining/shopping experience a star is deducted.
author: Erica N.

description: Puccini's has very friendly and attentive staff! The prosciutto pizza was good. The raviolli with mushrooms and cream sauce was excellent! The waitress told me that was their best item. Beware that the portions are large and the free bread can be tempting and fill you up.
author: Daniel L.

description: Nothing really that stood out. Hard location to find parking in and too many tourist--but the food was pretty good and the service was great.
author: Sue L.

description:
whatever.
that's my summation of this place.
uninteresting, boring food, chain-restaurant-like decor.
fair service.
a reminder never to get risotto in a mediocre (or less than) place.
author: Jessica L.

description: this place is decent.  I wouldnt say that its good.  Its good when you need a place to sit down to eat with your coworkers and you dont want to pay too too much.  I would say its about an average of $20 a person.
author: Janet S.

description: Originally this place was a 4 star for me, but since my last visit it lost a star.  I go to school a few blocks away and you can only have so much of the Macy's Food Court and the under the SF Center.  So Puccini and Pinetti came introduced to me on those days you just want to sit down and maybe chill out with a bottle of wine.  Loved the food the first few times, food WAS usually consistent..until last visit.  My friend ordered the fettucini  except they ran out of the fettucini noodles and served it with angel hair without even letting us know.  When the waiter was confronted about this he said "pasta is pasta..most people can't tell the difference".  WTH?!?!   And the sauce was terrible might I add.  Based on the last experience..I will probably not go back considering there are other options to choose from.
author: Helen C.

description: I had a great time here! I can't remember what I ordered.. but I CAN remember that I liked it a lot! You can't go wrong with wine and pasta
author: S B.

description: Ok, I always want to be as objective as possible, so giving this place one star was tough...however, if I could have given it none, I would have...We made a reservation and was kept waiting more than 10 minutes....who really cares, but this was only a clue as what was coming up for us...we were seated in a table right near the door into the kitchen, but that wasn't really a problem....the fact that the legs of the table were not even and constantly wobbled, even after pointing it out to our server, was more than annoying...well, ignoring this, we ordered...I ordered the Fruiti de Mare and my friend ordered spaghetti and meatballs....they arrived and sadly my dish had ABSOLUTELY not one ounce of flavor...and the "seafood" was so pitiful, I hardly recognized it......my friend's order was better, however she stated that it was just "ok"....we decided to order two desserts and share...both were pretty tasteless...I was soooo disappointed.....honestly speaking, this place was a step above an Olive Garden, which to me is the most horrific eatery in America....
author: Joanna M.

description: Went there for Valentine's dinner after a show. What a wonderful dining experience. It was Saturday and we didn't have reservations...the short wait was worth it!!  We sat at the chef's bar and interacted with the energic and friendly chefs...we were able to ask questions about the preparations and foods they were using. Great fun!! We ordered the valentine's day three course special and it was amazing!!  The staff was pleasant from the hostess to the bus boys.. Will definitely go again !!
author: Richard R.

description:
Three of us went to the restaurant after a matinee at ACT. We were told that their specialty of the house were Saltimbocca and Spaghetti and Meatballs. 
Two of us ordered Saltimbocca which was served on a bed of delightful Mediterranean vegetables. But the veal and prosciutto were were like a "jerky", dry, overcooked and tasteless, they had fused to one another. Both of us who ordered it are good food and good cooking aficionados. This was a terrible meal!
author: Yasmine S.

description: Recommend the warm spinach salad and either of the two pizzas--an excellent combination for a moderate appetite.  Don't expect to have much of a conversation--the noise is pretty over-powering.
author: Tony S.

description: Read good reviews about this place but wasn't very impressed. The food was OK, the atmosphere kind of boring. Maybe we were there on an off night but there's not much to say about this place.
author: Selena S.
