description: Food was good. I shared my plate with someone else. Had Frutti di Mare. Thought it was pretty expensive for the amount of food given. Service was awful. After 45m of sitting down is when you take our order? No way! We had a big party of like 11 people and we were like in a corner. I felt the waiter forgot us more than half the time. Service was crappy and we spend over 300. What a rip off on the tip. That waiter did such a bad job, he just got money for free.
author: liss c.

description: Brilliant! Best Happy Hour in that area. The service was quick, the pizza was satisfactory and I was just plain happy that the tab would be so inexpensive.
author: Anita C.

description: Note these stars are awarded to the bar. Majority of the martini's we had were on the sweeter side, the acai martini is incredible and original with fresh squeezed fruit and the perfect amount of belvedere vodka-heaven in a glass. the espresso martini was a warming heavier drink- espresso shot, Kahlua, vodka cream and cinnamon. yummy. raspberry mojitos-delicious, and the lemon drop martini had sugar along the rim and had a touch of tart and a touch of sweet. we enjoyed a few too many, so be sure to have a designated driver or grab a cab so you can enjoy more of them too :) bottoms up
author: Ariana P.

description:
Went last night for V-Day with my friend to celebrate single's awareness.  We went onto opentable.com to find any Italian restaurants in the city that still had reservations for that evening, and this one did, so we just went.  We only had to wait 2 minutes for our table once we got there, and our server was very nice. The bread is fantastic, and the water guy could tell we were starving, and kept bringing us more, I seriously think we ate like 3 loaves...ahahha.  They had a special lobster and shrimp pasta special, so I said what the hell and ordered it.  
It was freaking BITTER! Like there were grapefruit seeds mixed into the sauce, and the entire dish tasted sooooo gross and bitter!! I didn't want to cause a scene, but I kindly told our server and she was soooooo sweet and brought me an entire new dish w/o the grapfruit seeds, and she freakin piled on the lobster...yummmmmm!!!!!!!
Wasn't my favorite Italian restaurant, but did the job.  Extra points for the bread. It's close to  Union Square, so I think tourists must hit it up. Probably wouldn't go back again, but wouldn't be opposed to it if someone really wanted to go.  It's not really that "Italian". I was expecting lots of ravioli's and such, and there really weren't that many. Kinda an American/Italian restaurant more than straight Italian.
author: Lauren G.

description: This place did not disappoint! I loved my salad and pizza margherita.. and the mimosas tasted like orangina (i.e. deliciousss) with still enough booze. The prices aren't bad either. Service was friendly and efficient. I'll most likely be returning.
author: Betsy W.

description:
I've been here several times and have always enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and service .... until last night.

We decided to grab dinner here before catching Jersey Boys at the Curran Theatre a few blocks away. We came around 6pm. It was a little busy, but not full, and we were seated right away. I like the food here, but the service last night was definitely not up to par. The food came out very fast. However, ALL of our dishes (appetizers AND entrees) were brought out at the same time. Plus the bread and bread plates were still on our table -- this created A LOT of clutter. The food was tastey. At the time, I didn't really enjoy my burger -- maybe because I was eating it at the same time as the bruchetta or maybe because I just felt so claustrophobic at my table... I dont know, so I only ate half. (Side note: I heated up the leftovers for lunch today and it actually tasted a lot better than last night.)

We finished our food and some of our plates were cleared from the table. I looked around for our waitress and noticed her wiping a wine glass by the bar. Service actually wasn't too bad until this point. I waved at her to get her attention (because we wanted to order tea and dessert), she looked blankly into space as I continued to wave and wave. My boyfriend and mom tried to get her attention as well, but were also unsuccessful. A few minutes later, another busboy came by our table and we asked him to please tell the waitress to take our dessert orders. He said ok, but walked in a different direction. After more waving fifteen minutes later our waitress arrived * Halleluiah! * and asked us if we were waving at her! HAHA! We told her we wanted some tea and coffee. She took our orders and proceeded to walk away without offering us any dessert. Great. She brought out our teas but the cups and plates were all wet. Yuck. 

I will definitely not be coming back here for a long time. 

Oh I also have to mention that as we were leaving we walked by the front window of the restaurant. There were these two ladies with their two entrees on a two person table with their bread and bread plates there as well... AND they had their appetizers ON THEIR LAPS!!! Well actually, one had one empty plate on her lap and the other one had her half finished appetizer. LOL!! Are you f*cking kidding me?!? I wish I had taken a picture.
author: Andrea G.

description:
I'm one of those people who doesn't like to eat in restaurants alone - I always feel like there is a spotlight on me, declaring "Look at the lonely geek over here!'"  But sometimes I get the urge to eat a certain something - in this case Italian seafood - so I overcame my fear of eating alone.  I was lucky enough to get a small table to myself, tucked away from most of the happy couples and college kids. I came here for the cioppino...which I've ordered on many occasions in the past...ah, the past...
...the past - when, in happier times, I use to come here more often with my ex...and sometimes with Big Frank, his father, who was like a big scary Mob dude.  A lot of the employees knew him, and seemed to cater to his every whim.  Big Frank could usually drink two carafes of table wine by himself. He was a big fan of their  'The Godfather Dinner' ...he could put most of the food away by himself, nevermind the fact that it was to be shared by 5 - 6 people.  He was sort of crude, but always entertaining.  He added to my dining experience!
...the food is still good here, along with the service, by the way.
author: Monique H.

description: We came into SF for the theater on New Years Eve and chose Puccini and Pinetti from the Orpheum website without checking reviews.  As a family, we have a long history of eating great Italian food in the City and this restaurant did not measure up in multiple areas.  Union Square location or not, their food is overpriced (pasta over $22 and Chicken Marsala for $24).  The mashed potatoes did not taste real and their ingredients are quite inexpensive and nothing special.  The bruschetta toasts were soggy due to the pile of canned diced tomatoes on the plate.  Since they operate on a system in which multiple servers bring food to each table, our salads arrived before our drinks and appetizer.   If you are from out of town and not familiar with quality Italian cuisine in the City, this restaurant might satisfy.  If you are looking for a traditional SF experience of rich flavors, white tablecloths and crusty fresh sourdough, you will be disappointed.  I would characterize this restaurant as a tourist spot which can survive because of location and a great deal of foot traffic.  It is unlikely that this restaurant could attract "regulars" who are locals.
author: Lindsay P.

description: I rarely give a bad review but this restaurant deserve it. The food is tasteless, it taste like water and tomato paste. The waiter is condescendent. If I pay this much I expect to be treated nicely.
author: Thierry W.

description: Had high expectations for this place but they fell way short.  Went there for Happy Hour on a Friday night (btw, the "happy hour" is only on drinks, those bar food prices that you're seeing are available at all times...had I known that, I probably would not have come here since I was mainly looking for a place w/ happy hour food specials)...it was crowded but not the point where we couldn't find anywhere to sit eventually.  Like ppl have said, service is subpar here as they really seem to not really care much about their customers.  We ordered the calamari, cheese plate, sausage pizza, truffle fries, and breaded raviolis and I tried hard to enjoy everything since I picked the place for the 6 of us but it was difficult.  The calamari was good but really small.  I found it to be a little overcooked but the aioli made up for it.  The cheese plate was pretty useless.  There are two crostininininis (emphasis on how small they were) with like half a thumb-sized wedge of 3 different cheeses and none of them stood out to me.  Sausage pizza was ok, didn't expect much there...Truffle fries taste like regular fries.  Maybe my palette is not refined enough but every single person tried both regular fries and the truffle ones and we couldn't really tell the difference...also small portion and yes, I realize that I paid $4-$5 for it but it was still small.  Finally, the breaded raviolis were mediocre.  They were about as good as something I could buy frozen.  2 stars all around and I won't be back.
author: Derrick C.

description: My friend really loves it here so I took her here for her birthday.  I enjoyed the meal although it must not have struck me as very memorable because I don't even remember what kind of pasta I ordered.  A bit expensive, but it is in the Union Square area and our service was pretty good.
author: Michelle N.

description: The wild mushroom ravioli--one of several vegetarian options--is to-die-for.  Warm atmosphere, good service, and they have Anchor Steam on tap.  What more can you ask for?
author: Helena K.

description: We were recommended this place by a friend and it was so-so. We went during dinner and it was starting to get busy. The bar was packed and everyone was dressed nice. We ordered both of their specials for the day: cheese tortellini with turkey sausage and jalapenos, and salmon over greens. When we asked about their wine selection, our waiter Ian told us he didn't know much about the wines but recommended the second most expensive bottle. Hmmm... The service was average and the food was okay. There wasn't anything spectacular so I probably won't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Jenny L.

description: This place is the best. I had there pizza and man, I must say the best pizza I've ever had. The waiter was very nice and friendly, hard to find these days. I agree with Shveta, the hostess was handling a personal call it seemed like, not cool.
author: Vik D.

description: Came her for DAT09(dinner). I didn't really know much about this place but chose it for my bday dinner cuz it's right on the center of downtown. Easy access for everyone. I was very satisfied with the food, ambiance & service.  Reservations at 8:15pm Friday and got there right on time and got seated 10 seconds after  we checked in with the host. Love the "Capensante"- basically some greens mixed with grilled scallops dressed with pancetta-rosemary olive oil.  I had the black pepper crusted filet for the second course. I was very surprised with the serving size. Not bad. For dessert, I was never really into cheesecakes but I fell in love with their pistachio cheesecake. It was the star of night together with the Capensante.
author: janey t.

description:
Note to visitors- this restaurant is located on all hotel concierges' lists.  However, I was greatly impressed.

Service was impeccable.  From a team of hostesses, the bussers, clearing plates frequently and filling water glasses to our waitress recommending wines and even beer with our food.  The room gets very loud, so I was screaming most of the time.  They have a few booths but mostly 2 top tables that are joined together for larger groups.  

I had the scallops with risotto which looked small at first but filled me up!  So good with the bits of proscuitto to add saltiness to the risotto.
My friend had the spaghetti and meatballs and was blown away, the meatballs were very hearty and the sauce not too chunky.  My other friend had the veal which was a little overcooked but still enjoyed the sides.  

I think my fave thing is the olive tapenade/bread...what a great way to start your meal!
author: Melissa D.

description: The price is good, the location is good, the food is acceptable. The shrimp and saffron risotto sounded really good but seemed to be covered with this greasy and salty cheese. The apple and walnut salad (a staple) was good, except that they put the wrong dressing on it -- don't use the creamy white.
author: Ellie P.

description:
Have been here several times with a few combinations of peeps and I must say, the best combo is me & a best girl for an evening of decompressing with some Plymouth or Belvedere. :) 

Beside their great bar, (which also has a few nice ports) everything I've had to eat here has been delicious. My favorites have been their mushroom risotto, eggplant on a bed of mashed potatoes and their simple pasta dishes. 

I suppose it is a little pricey, but it's one of the few places in the area with a nice atmosphere & cool crowd, yummy food, a good bar and friendly service.
author: A W.

description: Yep, they have a happy hour from 4 to 6pm with $3 per pint, about half a dozen beers on tap from Stella to Anchor Steam and inexpensive mini pizzas and other food during that time, too. Service was fast, we just weren't lucky enough to sit in the area where the lovely waitresses are serving the crowd. Happy hour made up for that, though. Hic.
author: Roland A.

description: The service was very good -- I came during the height of the dinner hour and was seated promptly, and served promptly.  The atmosphere was noisy, but not loud.  It was a very family-friendly atmosphere, and I was quite optimistic, even after reading the other reviews here.  ...but despite many tasty-looking dishes on the menu and choosing a seafood dish I thought would be particularly flavorful, I found the food rather bland.  They've got the right service, the atmosphere I was looking for, and even the recipes themselves looked fine but I just can't say anything good about the ingredients they're using.  Even the caesar salad was bland.
author: Marc M.

description: Best place for happy hour!  Well drinks, domestic beer and house wines for $3-4.  The small plates are also fantastic with items such as fried calamari, sausage pizza, fried ravioli, truffle fries and many more ranging from $5-$11.  If your a commuter like myself, its only a block from the powell bart station so you can stop by and get your fill on alcohol and yummy appetizers before heading home.  Oh and their olive tapenade is to die for.  You can take a pint home with some fococcia for only $11.  The place gets a little crowded around 530-6 so get there early.
author: Suda S.

description: I've eaten here a couple of times, both work related outings. All I have to say is: eh! With so many great restaurants in this city I don't know why any of the locals would eat here. The food is eatable and that's about it.
author: Reza E.

description: Ok, so it may not be "authentic" italian, but guess what? This is America! and we eat american food. I ate here several years ago with my dad and loved it. Imagine my joy when I realized, after moving to the bay area, that I could frequent P&P whenever I felt like it. I haven't, however, because it's not exactly cheap, but for a date or special evening it's near the top of my list. I absolutely love the spaghetti and meatballs and know for a fact that it heats up in a microwave just fine if it's too much food for one night. They have a respectable wine list and if you're the type for an aperitif, the lemontini is quite tasty. For desert you can get a plate/desert wine or digestif combo for around $8. The service is very good and charming.
author: charlotte c.

description:
Puccini and Pinnetti is definately overpriced but I would without a doubt return. My experience was quite pleasant. The host and service were both very nice and accomodating despite the fact that it was saturday night and we were about an hour late for our reservation. We ordered the calamari to start. It was pretty good but nothing to write home about.
Then for our main courses, I as well as another person in our group ordered the eggplant. Very, Very satisfying and this is coming from someone who eats eggplant very seldomly because I'm not a huge fan. But I was in the mood and it just felt right. My boyfriend ordered the linguini in a saffron tomato sauce. Yuck! I hated the sauce but he liked it. I also don't like clams or mussels though and it included both of those and shrimp. Lastly, the fourth person in my group ordered the risotto of the day. She enjoyed it but it was a bit too salty for my taste and she thought there was too much broth. But specials are kind of hit or miss, so go figure. 
It was my friend's birthday, so they brought her a slice of cheesecake so we could sing. It was so amazingly delicious, we all had some. It was rich and creamy and tasted coconut-y. One of the best cheesecakes I have ever tasted. All in all, a good night.
author: Jenna L.

description: I went back in December, and I stayed at the Hotel Nikko nearby, so this restaurant was in ideal proximity.  The drinks were OK, but you're really only there for good conversation and to nibble.  I thought the portions were huge, almost like Cheesecake Factory proportions, but I guess it all depends how hungry you are.  All in all, very pleasant atmosphere.
author: Jay J.

description: Now i know why this place is always busy; The food here is deliciously out of this world!  Last Wednesday, I had crispy calamari, bruschetta, and my main course was some scallopps w/ greens. Lemmie tell u, the food were all very yummmmmmy!!! Last night, me and my co-worker ordered some pork chops w/ mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts. (she eats like a bird, so i ended up eating most of it) For desserts, we had the chocolate cake w/ ice cream and tiramisu.  Believe me, every bite was like heaven!  Most of their friendly staff are either Americans w/ Italian descent or Mexicans who look like Italians. The place is quite noisy, but have a very friendly atmosphere. I strongly recommend this place to anyone.
author: Rick B.

description: Yummy calamari, good pastas, fun and cute atmosphere
author: Joy C.

description: If the name doesn't give it away, yes, this is an Italian restaurant. It's a cozy little place, cozy in the sense that we felt very welcomed and comfortable there, situated at the corner of Cyril Magnin & Ellis just minutes away. The atmosphere is nice and whether you sit at the stools by the grill, where you can watch the chefs, or at the tables by the windows to watch the passing people, you'll be delighted by the service that you'll receive. The food was well prepared and plated.
author: Hieu D.

description: We had a great meal after a day of shopping. My honey & I  shared each course.  Arugula salad lightly dressed and appetizing. Minestrone soup was ok. We had the short ribs.  The ribs were tender and sauce and veggies were tasty. The relish was great for bread dipping. We will add to our list of places to eat when we visit to the city.
author: Jeff W.

description: This is my favorite happy hour spot, although not all my friends agree.  The style of the place is maybe alittle outdated, kinda 80s like with the purple and yellow, but I like the food, and I think out of all the spots down town the happy hour menu items are pretty good for $3, and all well drinks, wine and champagne is $3 too!  It's not crappy wine either.  The dinner menu is really good too.  The restaurant isn't exactly chic, or THE spot, for someone who may be looking for a cool spot to go to for happy hour but I personally love this place.
author: Charla M.

description: review based on the bar.  GREAT HAPPY HOUR.  good bruschetta. good calamari.
author: jessie h.

description: Good place to go for lunch. I love the Focaccia bread they serve w/olive oil. Calamari, Risotto, Crab Ravioli, Chicken Panini....it's all good and you get large portions. Tiramisu is average. Food comes really fast, so it's a great place to go if you are headed to the theater.
author: Arlene C.

description:
came here for a friend's birthday with a group of 7 people...meaning automatic 18% tip....uh oh

took a long time for us to even order, and it took even longer for us to get our food...feedback on the food was that it was either too salty, or just was not appetizing

aren't you supposed to run a smooth operation if you're a tourist trap?
author: Cheester O.

description:
Came here for a group bday celebration during dinnertime Saturday night.  Decent amount of people, main corridor somewhat cramped.  The restrooms are a ways away.  Parking garages nearby so not really an issue.

Tried the acai martini and pomegranate sangria, AWWWWESOME!  Food was OK at best.  In my opinion Parmesan cheese is very flavorful/pungent in small quantities, not meant to be a sauce drenching everything on the plate.  What made this worse was the Cannelloni had Parmesan filling as well.  Oy.  Apparently there was chicken in this dish, and you can't see or taste the chicken.  One has to believe it's just there?  Weird.  I didn't finish this dish and it wasn't worth bringing home as leftovers.  They ran out of Tuscan Lasagna at 830pm on a Saturday night...what?!  Chicken Marsala flavorful, and spaghetti & meatballs typical, nothing impressive.  Overall, I'd come back for drinks, but not dinner.  Burning that much money only to leave unsatisfied is ridiculous.
author: Kathy V.

description: Had a great late night dinner here.  The olive oil dipping sauce that they give you with bread is awesome.  I had the linguine with clams and it was delicious.  The grilled bread that came with the pasta had a burned taste.  Their portions aren't as big as most italian restaurants.  I went with a large group and everybody thought their food was delicious.
author: Jennifer D.

description: The hostess saw that we had our little munchkin with us and seated us in a nice comfy corner with plenty of space, and let us know (as she laid out crayons and a coloring menu) about their make-your-own pizza station for kids.  My munchkin made a pizza that the waiter took away to bake, and was excited to consume the self created pie!  Meanwhile, our food was delicious.  The fried calamari was a great start, and I enjoyed my wild mushroom ravioli and I got a taste of the chicken marsala, which was also delicious. Tiramisu was yum, but a bit heavy after a full meal.  Another excellent experience here!
author: R S.

description: Can anybody say OVERPRICED?! The food here was not that good. I ordered the spaghetti while my date ordered tuscan lasagna! The spaghetti was ok. It was edible. The lasagna was plain. I almost felt like asking for some extra spices so that I could put it in the food. The food was so overpriced. $19.00 a plate?! Really?! I don't think so. The only reason I stayed was because we didn't feel like looking around for anything else. Bunch of stubborn people eating there too! I ordered wine only for them to tell me that they don't have the kind I want, and if they find some, that it will be warm! The only good thing was the waiter who was very nice and patient with us. I would not go here again. I would have rather had pasta made with Prego.
author: Cesar R.

description: Best happy hour in town.  I used to work around the corner and loved sneaking off for $3 glasses of champagne and yummy little pizzas and appetizers.  The staff here is the best.  If you become a regular and tip well, you'll get all kinds of little extras on the house.
author: Stormageddon S.

description: Good food and good service. We came for dinner on a weekday. The pasta was satisfying but certainly lacking in bringing out the flavors. Somewhat pricey but it is hard to complain about that about a respectable restaurant in union square. The warm spinach salad was quite good.
author: Jeremy S.

description: So this was the first restaurant we stopped in on this trip to San Francisco. The place was pretty busy for 5 o'clock on Saturday so we bellied up to the bar. A bartender immediately came over, told us it was Happy Hour and brought us water. We had a fried calamari plate for $6, an antipasti plate with cheese, salumi, and house cured olives with some bread and a couple of different spreads for $6, and a couple glasses of their house wine at $3! Calamari was lightly battered, almost like tempura, cooked perfectly and the spicy dipping sauce was very good. The house cured olives were very tasty, as was the cheese and salumi. We could have used a couple more pieces of bread, and I'm sure we would have gotten them if we would have asked. Portions were very generous, and the wine was way worth $3 a glass. The bartender talked to us in between taking care of his other guests, and he was really personable and informative. I would highly recommend Happy Hour at Puccini and Pinetti if you're around Union Square.
author: S. C.

description:
We stopped in on a whim before a show, and it turned out to be a great experience!  Here are the highlights:  
*friendly and extremely attentive service from the hostess and waiter (didn't have to ask for drink refills, and our waiter checked on us numerous times)
* tasty food (Bibb salad and spaghetti with meatballs -- great flavors from simple dishes)
* no hassle about splitting a meal (in fact, the waiter brought out the salad and the spaghetti on two separate plates, and there was no extra fee)

Overall it was a very pleasant experience.  We were quite happy!
author: cheryl b.

description:
What a disappointment!  I thought that this would be a great restaurant to go to for lunch.  Boy, was I wrong.

What kind of restaurants have servers that yell out that he can speak Spanish because he lives in California?  What does that have to do with anything?  And why yell it?  So unnecessary, and patrons shouldn't have to hear it.

So, anywho, we sat down to our table.  It was okay, except for all the gnats/fruit flies surrounding us.  EWW!  The food wasn't any better.  The bruchetta and calamari are pretty descent...nothing sticks out about them.  BUT the rest of the meal...not so good.  I had the  Eggplant strata.  Sounds good right?  Nah ah.  The risotto was super bland and had the texture of hard lumpy paste.  Or, like you left out some undercooked rice for a couple of days and it got mushy.  The eggplant itself..looked good...layers of deepfriend egplant and cheese.  Looking good is not the same as tasting good.  It tasted EXACTLY like the calamari we just ate.  No kidding.  They must've fried it in the same oil with the same breading.  I don't know about you, but eggplant is not supposed to taste like seafood.  That's just gnarly.  Everything was bland and tasteless except for the olives scattered on top of the dish.  So I figured that I treat myself with some dessert.  I must've been a very bad girl to get a treat like that.  I asked for WARM chocolate cake...like it's written on the menu.  Got the cake.  It was NOT warm...not even lukewarm...more like it was baked an hour or so ago and left somewhere hoping someone would order it.  I was the poor soul who did.  As for the gelato on top, how can you even call it gelato?  I'd like to call the whole dish: wanna-be chocolate cake with icy milk on top.    

So not happy with this place....just being generous with the stars.
author: Miss T.

description: I love the food and the happy hour. I frequent the place at least once a week.  I must say their service sucks.  The server that tends to the bar/happy hour area is very slow and needs to be more friendly and attentive.  I like the food there but unfortunately, everytime I go there, he's there.  Liven up.....when I ask for water, don't roll your eyes.
author: Swati K.

description: Stopped in with the girls Friday after work.  The happy hour prices are really not to be beat. It was busy, but not crowded, just the right amount of energy in the bar.  Our server was friendly and chatty.  Though the bar was definitely slammed and drinks were a little slow to arrive to our table... next time will have to remember to order multiple rounds at once.
author: Frances L.

description: I normally receive great service and delicious food and I always manage to stop by when in town.  On my last trip to SF, I stopped by with a group of 7 for an early dinner which was about 5:30.  The bar area was packed during happy hour.  Since we had a party of 7, we had to wait a few minutes for them to set up our table, my friends and I bought a drink and took it to our dinner table once it was ready.  The waitress came up to the table and said bringing drinks back to the table was not allowed.  A - O - K...we'll take our drinks to the side walk next time (as there was NO space at the bar/area whatsoever.  Anyhow - the food just wasn't the same...felt like it was totally over priced for the quality received.  Thumbs down on the service and thumbs down on the food this time.  What a bummer.  Sorry - P&P just lost my business and all the groups of people I bring to this place.  Please tell the waitress with the tattoo on her chin to be nicer.  OMG - she was SO rude.  She gave us daggers at every request.  I mean, c'mon - if we order appetizers - do we really have to ask for plates?  Do we really need to ask for bread and butter??? Plenty of other restaurants around in nicer areas - sorry.
author: C L.

description: its okay, the food is decent, the only thing about it thats really good is the location, which is great because its one of only a couple restaurants in Union Square. I would definitely recommend not having the Cioppino or the lamb chops. hindsight is 20/20, and only a stronger screwdriver would have made those bad tastes go away.
author: Patrick M.

description:
we dont go to the City that often, and just passed by this fantastic restaurant last night.  Thought, umm maybe we'll try it, because it was PACKED!  we waited for about 5 mins and got our table. 
Terrific service and food.  We tried their calamari, wild mushroom ravioli and halibut. All 3 are fantastic. 
Highly recommend this awesome restaurant!
author: Helen L.

description:
Lets see here...

1) Cool Place
2) Great Location
3) Interesting Bar setup..
4) Their signature dish Spaghetti and Meatballs was delicious!
5) Friends, big table, and chuck Norris jokes...

= great evening

Few issues:
1) Services was a little slow....
2) I asked the bartender "What's on Tap?" and her response - well, none. She just gave me the drink list and walked away. Its not like they had 50 beers on tap, they had 8! Not cool.

Otherwise a pleasant dining experience.
author: Kevin P.

description:
If you sit at the bar with a few friends its real value for money.

Bartenders are really chill and the food is very reasonable at the bar. They have a great happy hour too. Cheap beers, Mojitos, Long Islands....................

Apps are bout $4-8. Great for sharing and generous servings. Antipasti is great!
Sausage pizza too..

Definetly a place you should visit.
author: shane B.

description: we were treated better the second time around.  the half empty restaurant, with full bar and flat panels, recreated a slight applebees vibe that i miss...  8T
author: Ethan L.

description: Came here one night with my husband, his parents and my parents.  The food was delicious, but I'm going to have to agree with the other reviewers in that is it VERY LOUD!  Probably not a good place for a first date, but probably a good place for a group.
author: Leslie R.

description: Returned here Friday with my two kids and a pal of theirs.  Nothing close to our last visit.  It was slow for a Friday night.  The salads ordered off the kids' menu dripped with olive oil.  Most was left on the plate.  The serve, Kirk, was fabulous and engaged my son but seemed far more interested in the female hostesses.  Service was painfully slow.  A family friendly place to be sure, but the visit was a disappointment.  Doubt we'll be back.
author: Connie E.

description: I ordered the warm spinach salad ($11). Very, very good. It had mushrooms, caramelized onions, red peppers, balsamic vinaigrette and blue cheese! The cheese ravioli ($21) with mushrooms was also very good and creamy. Towards the end I almost felt it was too rich. I had a glass of Cab ($9) that helped with the richness of the sauce. Overall a good experience.
author: Xavier C.

description: Service and food were sub par.  Waitress vanished after taking our order.  Food tasted like salty warmed leftovers. Almost forgot, the house red wine was really bad too.
author: carlos c.

description: Went there at about 9:00 at night. It took a bit to get served, but the waitress was attentive once she arrived. Good food (I wasn't looking for authentic). Slightly pricey, but this IS San Francisco...
author: Ontario E.

description: Puccini and Pinetti is amazing for after work happy hours!  Their food specials drew us in and will keep us coming back!  Everything we ordered we loved!  Their drinks were on a great special too!  Our waitress was extremely accomodating even though they were super busy!  It does get packed, so you want to make sure you are there early if you are getting drinks and apps for happy hour!  It's a great place with a great staff!
author: Emily T.

description: Terrible long wait, mediocre food.  Don't bother with the restaurant side.
author: Bruce W.

description: We had an office party there last night during happy hour and it was great. The appetizers were hot, tasted great and the drinks were fabulous. I highly recommend the Tiramisu martini! We had a large party, and they were very accomodating and the service was good.
author: Femi J.

description: gonna have to agree with what seems to be the general consensus: this food is tolerable, yet completely non-distinctive and i'd even say pedestrian. in a city like san francisco, why bother?
author: Marla W.

description: honestly, i can't remember what i had for my main course but the bruschetta here is AMAZING. the freshly cooked tomatoes with basil and onions are paired with a mild and creamy goat cheese topped by this wonderfully sweet and high quality balsamic. the bread is fresh and warm and once you top it with the cheese, tomatoes and vinegar, your mouth will dance and start singing italian operas. honestly, the bruschetta is the only reason to stop by. order it with a glass of wine and enjoy.
author: Amanda S.

description: ok, we had an awful experience in May, complained, and had an AWESOME experience just recently!! The manager, Ruthie, invited us back to give them a second chance. Our service was FIRST CLASS and the food was delicious! Ruthie even came out and greeted us, super nice!!! She and her staff made up for the bad time that we had there. Now we want to try the Happy Hour!!!!
author: char e.

description: We came here as a bachelorette party after our other plans fell through and we were all quite pleased. They had a great drink menu (I recommend the accai martini, but definitely not the peach julep) and the bartenders were really great and accommodating. We all seemed to enjoy our food and the atmosphere was fun and casual. I would happily go back to this place.
author: c y.

description: Great food and great service. We made reservations and didn't have to wait too long. It was also a great place to bring our three kids. And their kids menu has good choices on it. Not the usual chicken fingers and french fries. Service was also really good and fun. A really nice time and not too far from our hotel on Union Square. Good cocktails from the bar too! A good discovery, so we WILL be back!
author: Tom D.

description: I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. The food was good, but nothing special. I thought for the price I'd be getting something super good, but I guess it's only cause it's in downtown. The service was alright. She gave us everything we needed and was pretty efficient, but she was spacey and more concerned with getting things done so she could chat up with her friends at the bar asap (we were sitting next to the bar so of course it was a little awkward). I'd say go here for happy hour if you're in that location. Definately not worth going out of your way for, but the happy hour is a good deal.
author: Haim C.

description: Last  night before going to watch the Jersey Boys at the Curran Theathre, we decided to eat  here.  We have been going here for a few years now.  The place has this really warm feel to it and the  food and service were always good if not excellent . I have always liked their nacho cheese and  hamburgers.  Although there were a lot of people, the place wasn't necessarily packed so were were seated right away for a table for 4.  There were also a lot of people in the bar area.  Last night, the service was terrible, it took about 15 minutes for the waitress to even come and ask us what we wanted.  We ordered several appetizers and a bottle of wine to share and the fwine and food came quickly after, which was good since we were all starving.  But the nachos were slightly burnt and not as I had before as golden brown.  The bruschetta looked overly soaked in  oil (hopefully olive oil)... so I didn't even touch it.  The burnt nachos were also hardly eaten, what a disappointment.  The hamburger and fries filled me up, but the bread was a little stale.  Going back to the service, we had to keep "waving to our waitress" just to catch her attention.  The waitress and the busboys were  totally spaced out.   And judging from the food, the cook was probably not having a good day too. Overall last night the food and service rated a one-star for me, maybe this was just a bad night but I don't think I'll be going  there again in a very long time.
author: Tess G.

description: I won't write a real, real review for this restaurant because I happen to work there and it wouldn't be fair:) Our name may be a bit hard to remember but I think it is well worth it.. I love working here.. the employees make the place and our mission statement and ideals are right on the mark. We strive for excellance all the time but a reservation definitley helps on a Fri or saturday night when it gets crazy (because people like us:D). I have never worked in a place that works so hard to personalize things for their guests. There are a ton of Italian places to eat in North beach but I have not found them to be as friendly or customer service oriented as we are. We are also in the heart of downtown and no one will cat call you to come inside(as in NB)..ladies.. Plus, for those of you that work near by the powell/market area, we provide a neighbor discount during lunch and have a great lunch club where you earn free meals. I work lunches. Come in and judge for your self for sure!
author: Arielle C.

description: food is just  so-so. they cut up my pasta into little pieces. wanted to use a spoon instead of a fork. seems they were serving it alla baby's food. calamari was good. upside was waitress gave us good service and pleasant. and good drink - cyril spitz or drink with aperol.
author: Dan P.

description: Went here at off peak hours, so the service was good. The food was satisfying. I did have margarita which I would say was not worth the price (very small for $10). Overall, an okay place to catch a meal as long as you don't mind that they're typical patrons are most likely people staying at the hotels nearby.
author: Tara C.

description: This place has good food, helpful staff, and is an overall good value.  They have several tasty wines by the glass for around $8 and delicious menu items for under $20.  The hostess was delightful and our waitress had lots to say about the various dishes which was really informative.  They even brought us a sample of the appetizer special which was a cheesy risotto-like ball that had been fried and topped with marinara sauce and parmesan (mmmm).  Between that and the fabulous bread that comes with olive oil, peppers, and capers, I was almost too full to eat but managed to share a couple things with others.  This place has a great location and is unpretentious and serves good food.  I would definitely go back!
author: Karen L.

description: Okay, so I first went to Puccini & Pinetti about 3 years ago and loved it.  However, over the past year or so it has changed.  Along with increasing its prices and serving smaller entrees, they have altered some of my favorite dishes!  It still is a cool place to go to get good food and they still have the spaghetti and meatballs (add fresh mozzarella balls) that I love.  Definitely recommend this place, but they were even better a few years ago.
author: pat j.

description: great food, nice price, great for pre theater dinner, fun service too.  crowded but they fit us in.
author: Anonymouse Y.

description: amazing, everything on the menu is definitely worth getting and reasonably priced for good Italian food, the veal was the best ive ever had, my group also ordered salads which were equally raved about, highly recomend it
author: Kevin B.

description: food was only okay, but definitely overpriced for the quality and the menu was small
author: Elle E.
